Preply is a global language learning marketplace, connecting 15,000+ tutors with millions of learners from all over the world. Since the company launched in 2012, students have signed up to more than five million lessons.
Backed by some of the world‚Äôs leading investors, Preply is on a mission to shape the future of effective learning. Fueled by a belief that live engagement with a teacher is still the most effective way to learn a new skill, Preply is building a personalized learning space that will enable individual learners to reach their goals in the fastest way possible.
Powered by a tenfold increase in revenues over the last three years, Preply now has 220+ employees of over 37 nationalities based between Barcelona and Kyiv. Preply is driven by a culture of experimentation and data-driven learnings, focused on building best-in-class consumer and enterprise solutions.
As the company looks to increase momentum and scale geographically, this is a unique opportunity to join one of the most vibrant and attractive start-up communities in the world.
Preply is looking for a highly analytical person to join a team of talented data scientists who work at constantly improving the understanding of our customers (supply & demand).
As part of this role, you‚Äôll study user behavior, design AB Tests for our experimentation platform, analyze the results and provide insights and recommendations to our stakeholders.
You‚Äôd be embedded in cross-functional teams and work closely with product managers, tech leads, designers, etc. to provide our tutors and learners with the best product experience.
As a Data Scientist, You Will
Master the dynamics of tutors/learners interaction and the economics of Preply‚Äôs marketplace
Produce thorough data analytics across the customer journey, from acquisition to activation, engagement and retention
Increase our customer knowledge through applied analytics, clustering and segmentation
Quantify the impact of the initiatives in order to identify growth opportunities and help prioritize our roadmap
Communicate results to technical and non-technical audiences, sharing knowledge and insights across the organization
Design, execute, and evaluate experiments on a global scale (CRM, copy, etc.)
Iterate on our growth strategy (attribution, bidding, segmentation, channels optimization, incremental tests, media-mix modeling, etc.)
Contribute to the development of analytics libraries and frameworks
Collaborate with the Data Strategy team to define standards and best practices as well as sharing knowledge and capabilities across the team
Participate in the definition of tracking events, engagement metrics and key performance indicators
Work with the Data Engineering team to model data in our Datawarehouse and productionize your data pipelines.
Build models aimed at understanding customer behavior and predicting key metrics such as conversion, retention and LTV
Work closely with our BI experts to develop effective data visualizations, reports and dashboards

What We Are Looking For
2-3 years' experience as an in-house Data Scientist, Data Analyst or a similar role.
Knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.)
Strong coding skills in one or more analytics languages (SQL, Spark, Python, etc.)
Previous experience in some of the following Growth techniques: attribution, bidding, segmentation, channels optimization, incremental tests, media-mix modelling
Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills
Creative mindset and proactive attitude towards the creation and evaluation of new hypotheses
Good understanding of data analysis concepts such as conversion, LTV/CAC, Cohort analysis, Retention, etc.
Good written and verbal communication skills. B1 English is a must

Nice To Have
Previous experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C)
Knowledge of Looker, Tableau or other BI tools
Knowledge of coordination tools (Airflow, Luigi, Jenkins, etc.)
Knowledge of version controlling tools (GitHub, GitLab, etc.)

What We Offer
An opportunity for personal and professional growth, supported by high functioning teams, stellar investors and the exciting challenges that come with joining a company at the start of its growth trajectory;
An environment free of bureaucracy and corporate constraints; a culture where your opinion is highly valued and appreciated;
An open, collaborative, dynamic and international culture;
A monthly allowance for self-development on Preply.com;
A competitive financial package, with generous leave allowance and health insurance

Our Values
Human: We speak honestly and directly with compassion and radical candor. We believe every interaction should be friendly, personalized, diverse and inclusive. Above all, we believe fun should be apart of everything we do
Customer Obsession: We put our customers first by asking for feedback and analyzing the data to build products they love.
Hungry: Our will to win is unmatched. We make bold, data-informed decisions, to quickly deliver value to our customers. We dare to dream big, think like co-owners, and go the extra mile to hire others who share our champion spirit.
Humble: We keep our egos low, constantly learn, and trust in data to make smart decisions. We know that our knowledge is imperfect and incomplete, but not stagnant. There's always more to learn from each other, our customers, and the world around us.
Curious: We are lifelong learners. Our curiosity helps us to view tough situations more creatively. We kill the noise and go deep on insights. We face challenges head on, and consistently seek opportunities to learn more.
Hackers: We‚Äôre obsessed with our customer‚Äôs problems. We focus on what matters, design with pragmatism, and move with incredible speed to create simple, creative, and scalable solutions.

Diversity, Equity, And Inclusion
Preply.com is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people of diverse backgrounds can thrive. We believe that the presence of different opinions and viewpoints is a key ingredient for our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company. That means that Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status.

Are you a specialist in data analysis with extensive experience in collecting, transforming and analyzing data as well as communicating findings across the organization?

In this role, you‚Äôll be‚Ä¶ Pivotal in the execution of a three years roadmap to achieve a more preventive, customer focused and data driven Quality approach at Markem-Imaje. This role will specifically focus on Data Analytics and statistical analysis related to Product, Service, Process quality and performance and will be influential in improving those. This position is reporting directly to the Global Quality Shared Services Manager.
You‚Äôll have an opportunity to‚Ä¶ work in a cross-functional environment, partnering closely on all levels of the organization to ultimately improve the quality and performance of our products, services and processes using your data analysis, machine learning-based tools and IT skills.
You should possess‚Ä¶ a passion for leveraging data to drive decision making across the business and be a forward-thinking individual to look beyond the immediate.

Great package including bonus, career growth and great benefits.

Principal Activities / Duties / Responsibilities:

You will be responsible for managing, extracting, transforming, reporting and visualizing data from a wide variety of sources as it relates to the performance of our products, services and key business processes. Your main responsibilities will include:
‚Ä¢Exploring any and all available data for extraction, transformation, analysis and visualization, incl. proposing new ideas and solutions.
‚Ä¢Design, development, maintenance and improvement of processes and tools for managing, extracting, transforming, reporting and visualization of data.
‚Ä¢Development and maintenance of tools aimed at automation of existing processes and data bases.
‚Ä¢Working closely with end users to translate requirements into data-driven applications and data visualization solutions (e.g. reporting and dashboards).
‚Ä¢Transforming data into value: communicating findings and recommended actions across the entire company in an international environment.

Experience & General Skills:   
‚Ä¢Minimum 5 years of experience in a similar role including experience as Data analyst.
‚Ä¢Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business, Science or Engineering/University degree in Data Analysis.
‚Ä¢Mastering programming tools such as SQL, PL/SQL, Python or R.
‚Ä¢Master Excel at an advanced level with Visual Basic. Experience on Power BI is a plus.
‚Ä¢Fluent in written and spoken English.
‚Ä¢Excellent written and verbal communication and the ability to present data to all levels in the organization.
‚Ä¢SAP CS/SD/MM and Lean Six Sigma certification are a plus.

Vistaprint‚Äôs Data and Analytics (DnA) organization is working to make our company one of the world‚Äôs most well-known and successful data-driven companies. What You Will Do

Are you inquisitive by nature with passion about data and technology? You will be part of the creation of Vistaprint‚Äôs time-series analysis and forecasting capability! You will explore and visualize data, making recommendations and building scalable data products that help Vistaprint become more data-driven in its planning processes!
Collaborate in a complementary team (e.g. Product Owners, Marketing, Developers) on analyses, bringing forward ideas and insights to drive value for our customers.
Identify trends and drivers, perform exploratory data analyses and present views that will provide visibility into business drivers: Data Exploration, Visualization, and Dashboarding.
Incorporate multiple data sources and methodologies to find opportunities to help us better understand customer behavior and give to product-level demand forecasting: Data Analysis and Modeling.

Why You'll Love Working Here

We strive to give you everything you need to learn, grow, and succeed. Remote First-Culture

In 2020, Vistaprint adopted a Remote-First operating model and culture. We heard from our team members that having the freedom, autonomy and trust in each other to work from home and, the ability to operate when they are most productive, empowers everyone to be their best and most brilliant self. Vistaprint also provides collaboration spaces for team members to work physically together when it's safe to do so or believe in office working will deliver the best results. At Domestika we are looking for a Lead Product Data Analyst.

We are looking for an experienced Lead Product Data Analyst to help us shape our growing Product Analytics team. You would be part of a brand new adventure at Domestika. This role will put you in a position to bring a positive impact from day 1. We are looking for a candidate that is experienced in a user experience centric product focused. In addition to the conversion of the sale experience, we are strong believers that our Learning Experience at Domestika is key for our success.

You will work directly with all Product Managers, our Directors of Product, and will report to our Director of Data.

We are building a dedicated team that will allow us to support and guide all our Product teams. This team will work hand in hand with stakeholders to create a direct impact on insights that influence the way we build our e-learning platform. We want to embrace everything Data has to offer, finding insights, optimizing our processes and even rethinking them.

As our Lead Product Data Analyst, you will build and lead a team of Data Analysts that matches our needs and product strategy. You will mentor the analysts and create the environment to set the team for success. You will play a key role in our organization with an expectation of proactivity.

Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other.

Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those who want to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.

What does a Lead Product Data Analyst do at Domestika?
Drive for actionable insight gathering, and evangelize a data-driven product culture.
Partner with Domestika‚Äôs product leadership in building its product strategy and roadmap.
Work with our product teams in all stages of the product life cycle, from ideation to performance analysis.
Mentor the product analytics team members and set them up for success.
Hire and nurture our Product Data Analysis team.
Support the teams in designing A/B tests and analyzing their results.
Oversee, review and optimize our decisional analytical framework.
Identify opportunities for data enhancement.
Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholders, creating visual displays of quantitative information.
Actively contribute to our User tracking framework definition and implementation.

Position Snapshot

Location: Global IT HUB Barcelona (Esplugues de Llobregat)

Full-time position

About IT At Nestl√©

We are a multicultural and diverse team of IT professionals driving the biggest IT operations landscape of the FMCG industry, and a Digital Transformation at scale. We work with leading technologies and top external partners to provide solutions to enable Nestl√© to engage with millions of consumers and customers worldwide. Position Summary

To strengthen our Global IT Hub in Barcelona, we are looking for a Business Analyst ‚Äì Business Solution Integration ‚Äì Data Integration to complete our Analytics, Data and Integration (ADI) Department.

In this position, you will establish and maintain a connection between IS/IT & business Consumers and Customers. As part of the Product Group Team, you will ensure a deep understanding of opportunities and issues facing business functions and advises on the best IT solutions. Furthermore, you will translate business strategies, opportunities, threats and needs into IS/IT product requirements and will play a key role within the Product Group Team to specify, test and deploy those IS/IT solutions.

A day in the life of...

Coach, motivate and direct staff belonging to various organizations (business and IS/IT) to understand the business needs and find the best solution that will both align with the customer objectives and the IS/IT strategy.
Consult with Product Group teams and proposes alternative solutions.

Demonstrated experience in:

8+ years of relevant business analysis experience in a functional area within IT.
Experience working in an IS/IT delivery context, in a global environment, with virtual teams.
Strong experience working in an Agile/DevOps environment using design thinking methodology.
Strong understanding of business processes and ability to translate it into application requirements.

Boston Scientific is dedicated to transforming lives through innovative medical solutions that improve the health of patients around the world.
Boston Scientific transforms lives through innovative medical solutions that improve the health of patients around the world. Our culture and values are what differentiate us from other companies, and we‚Äôre very proud of who we are as a company. Today, we're 36,000 colleagues strong, with an impressive portfolio of 15,000 products. We‚Äôre at the forefront of the medical device industry-leading, evolving, and transforming it into bolder and more amazing territories. Our principles power our performance, and together, we turn our shared vision into value. For our patients. And our employees

With the increasing demand for affordable healthcare services and growing requirement for innovative medical devices, it has become pertinent for us, to increase our Health Economics & Market Access function.

In this context, we are looking for talented Health Economics and Market Access (HEMA) professionals who will be support the development and execution of effective health economics, reimbursement and market access strategies for Boston Scientific‚Äôs in close collaboration with internal and external teams.
 This role will be supporting the New Cardiology Business Unit ( Interventional Cardiology & Structural Heart)

Your responsibilities will include:

Assess reimbursement opportunities and challenges facing the business‚Äô emerging technologies and commercially marketed products and communicate business impact to senior management.
Identify key health economics needs for Boston Scientific platform products, working with health economics and outcomes research colleagues to determine actions required.
Lead development and execution of practical strategies to secure optimal reimbursement (coding/coverage/payment) for Boston Scientific products and procedures Lead implementation of tactical planning activities required to achieve reimbursement objectives (e.g., new code applications, customer billing guides).
Work with new product development teams to ensure global health economics and reimbursement needs are incorporated into product development plans and timelines; ensure all HEMA product development deliverables are completed on time and on budget.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams in the development and communication of economic value messages to support product adoption.
Manage provision of appropriate internal training to sales, marketing, clinical, regulatory, and legal to increase awareness and understanding of health economics and market access competencies and their role in supporting a product‚Äôs success.
Monitor policy developments that impact the reimbursement of BSC products. Build relationships in key markets with government, physician, hospital, and third-party payer decision makers.
Establish and support a work environment of continuous improvement that supports BSC‚Äôs Quality Policy, Quality System and the appropriate regulations for the area they support. Ensure all employees are trained to do their work and their training is documented.
  
What we are looking for in you
Solid work experience involving leadership of functional and cross-functional teams
Experience in health policy, market access, reimbursement, health economics and/or outcomes research
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, including demonstrated ability to develop relationships at all levels in an organization


What we can offer to you
Career Development
Healthy work-life balance
Possibility to make an impact
Fast Growing and innovative environment


A career within Boston Scientific is more than just a job. It is personal

Adevinta is a global digital player, the biggest marketplace specialist in Europe. We are a family of local brands ‚Äì because we believe all great marketplaces are local. Kantar is the world‚Äôs leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar‚Äôs 30,000 people help the world‚Äôs leading organisations succeed and grow.

Profiles

Our profiles colleagues are the experts in helping clients connect with people. This includes survey design, sampling, profiling, data integration and activation for programmatic campaigns. Their single access point to 88 million deeply-profiled research-ready respondents enables clients to build rich profiles of their target audience and access immediately actionable data.

The Role (wider Context)

We are looking for a Senior IT Engineer that will become the local expert of a new Audience Measurement platform. The person will be a leader representative for the platform in the Spain‚Äôs market. High motivation, analytical mindset, and a high ability to communicate with many different teams are the key aptitudes to progress successfully in this position. He/she will be accountable for the correct functioning of the Platform and will be in continuous collaboration with our Central team in London to inform about the particular necessities of the market and thus collaborate in the evolution and modernisation of the platform. This role is also accountable of providing a first-level support service with a critical impact on the delivery to our clients.

Mission (the Sell)

We are embarking on a new exciting challenge to align our legacy Audience platform to a global Kantar platform.

While we are in the final stage of the migration process, we need someone that starts collaborating in the transition and helping us to mitigate the impact on our clients, adapting the particularities of Spain to the new system.

The person will drive all the requests coming from the Operations and Market teams to the Central team and will articulate the best solution in each case.

A challenging position within a fast growing, dynamic and innovative company working in an international role. The opportunity allows for growth and choice in a new and exciting career path

Transforming our Audience Measurement platform is one of the Kantar global strategic initiatives to move towards a new age in the field of the Digital Audience Measurement.

Analytical skills.
Big Data landscape: experience in Spark.
Cloud technologies ‚Äì Azure, DataBricks, Docker / Containers, Kubernetes.
Programming languages: C, Python, Java and Cobol (valuable)
High level of English (spoken)
High ability to cope with a steeped learning curve
Ability to read and understand "tones" of scripts and components
Interactivity with a great variety of teams
High motivation to contribute to a strategic project
Availability out of working time to support the Atria system

Description

Are you passionate about data analysis and marketing in business? Would you like to work in the digital side of a leading agricultural company? If both answers are positive, Corteva Agriscience is looking for a Digital Marketing Analyst.

Your main mission will be to lead the value creation from data and business analytics, developing and implementing digital transformation projects for the company with a strong focus on the agricultural market. You will be responsible for the data strategy, digital tools and social metrics, working on the implementation of the digital culture within the company and the commercial network. From our headquarters in Seville, you will be part of a growing team in charge of the implementation of a new CRM to support the sales structure, with special attention to customer insights and interactions. This position is designed for a proactive person, with a strong commercial and digital background, looking for an attractive challenge in a leading global company in the agricultural sector.

Your responsibilities will include (but not limited to) the following:
Be part of the company's data strategy, implementing data analytics and data structure processes on existing and future databases.
Carry out analytics to assess the end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels, identify trends and evaluate customer touch points.
Manage the change to new internal CRM and ERP systems.
Manage and oversee the organization‚Äôs business efforts by growing revenue from core and digital products and services.
Measure and report performance of digital marketing campaigns and assess against goals (ROI and KPIs).
Collaborate in the company's digital transformation projects, with a special focus on data and analytics-oriented workflows.
Run and distribute digital marketing analytics reports, including website traffic and behavior, apps, digital advertising, digital product launches and social networks.
Advocate of digital transformation in agriculture.

Evaluate emerging technologies, providing thought leadership and perspective for adoption where appropriate.
Brainstorm new and creative growth strategies in digital domain
Interact with the marketing teams on the design and implementation of digital marketing plans and communications
Give support to certain applications to the Digital Agronomy team.

Crop Protection and Seeds Marketing teams.
CRM and Customer Effectiveness specialists
Communication team.
Sales team.

Location:

Seville, Spain

Strong data analysis capabilities. MSc in Data Science or Data Analyst will be strongly valued.
In-depth digital marketing and business experience.
Experience in CRM analysis and implementation.
Experience in user‚Äôs data mining, statistics, data visualization and reporting.
Data Science development skills (R or Python) will be positively valued.
Comprehensive understanding of digital transformation processes
Strong technical expertise and problem-solving skills.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, verbal and written.
Strong organizational, planning, and time management abilities.
Excellent written and verbal communication in English.

Who Are We Looking For?
Curious, bold thinkers who want to grow their careers and be part of a winning team
Market shaping individuals who want to transform the agriculture industry to meet the world‚Äôs growing need for food
Collaborators who thrive in a diverse, inclusive work environment
Innovators who bring initiative and fresh ideas that drive our business into the future and make us an industry leader

We are currently expanding our operations internationally, and our offices are located in Madrid, Barcelona, Lisboa, Par√≠s, Mexico City, Milan, and Dublin. We are a company that specializes in providing comprehensive marketing and technological solutions for digital businesses. Our team is composed of more than 300 digital native professionals, who have a wide knowledge in the different stages and disciplines of the digital transformation: Digital Strategy, Infrastructures, Software Development, Creativity and UX/UI Design, Digital Marketing, and Big Data.

Making Science is People Centric, and we actively bet on our employees! We believe that they are the key to any successful business, and therefore, our greatest asset. We strive to provide daily learning opportunities for those who work with us and their colleagues. It is also really important that they enjoy what they do, and have positive experiences. We want our employees to feel proud of their accomplishments, and that they belong to a company that is in constant growth, because each person‚Äôs contribution is essential to achieve our success. Do you want to be part of this great family?

Some details about your department

At GMP, we are a young, energetic, and fun team! We believe that shared knowledge, teamwork, and internal training are the basis of a versatile, integrated, and powerful team. We highly value a thirst for knowledge, curiosity, and self-learning capabilities, because they help us stay up to date in an industry as dynamic as digital marketing. We are committed to the promotion of team building events, both inside and outside of the company, that will help us get to know each other better

You will never stop learning with us: subsidized training, free language classes, learning capsules, an e-learning platform, and many more.

Work comfortably and follow your own style, because we don‚Äôt have a dress code.

Descripci√≥n:
Context and Mission

ELIXIR (European Life Science Infrastructure for Biological Information) is a pan-European organization founded in 2014, which aims to integrate and harmonize European bioinformatics infrastructures. ELIXIR coordinates the participation of more than 20 countries, engages with other strategic European initiatives and projects e.g. ESFRI, Research Data Alliance, EUDat, EGI; promotes specific training activities and workshops on ELIXIR resources, partners with industry, and play a key role in shaping the bioinformatics landscape. Spain is a member of ELIXIR since 2015, with the INB as the Spanish national node. Within ELIXIR, the INB is responsible for the bioinformatics infrastructure offered by Spain, and therefore, should guarantee its alignment to the strategic areas put forward by ELIXIR.

The INB has recently incorporated two overarching objectives: increase the alignment of its activities with ELIXIR, and increase the translational impact of INB actions towards the Spanish National Health System (SNS). For the later objective, the INB has created and support TransBioNet (Translational Bioinformatics Network) which aims to structure, bring together and work with bioinformatics groups at healthcare settings with a special focus on the Health Research Institutes (IIS) recognized by the ISCIII.

The INB is looking for a Bioinformatics Data Analyst who will join their team in the framework of a new project to organise COVID-19 data in Spain, contributing to develop a computational infrastructure for secure data storage and analysis across regions. This work will involve close coordination with other groups in Spanish health Centres, and with infrastructure providers within and outside the BSC.

Key Duties
Contribute to the development of a computational infrastructure for secure COVID-19 data storage and analysis.
Manage and support users of the INB computational resources, including computational equipment, databases, and software infrastructure.
Develop, document and maintain the processes for extracting and organizing COVID-19 data from projects belonging to the ISCIII-funded project on this area.
Develop, document and maintain software for the integration and biological data, following the guidelines of ELIXIR and the European COVID-19 data portal.
Maintain communication with ELIXIR platforms, communities, and leadership; participate in their regular meetings and discussions.
Contribute to supervise junior members at the INB/ELIXIR-ES units.

Requirements

Education
BSc or MSc. in bioinformatics, computational biology or computer sciences with significant bioinformatics experience.

Essential Knowledge And Professional Experience
At least 2 years of professional experience with a similar role.
Experience in cloud computing.
Experience in data management APIs and most common bioinformatics data sources and formats.
Experience in database design and management (SQL and noSQL): MySQL/MariaDB, PostgreSQL, SQLite or similar; MongoDB, ElasticSearch, Cassandra or similar.
Experience with advanced software packaging procedures.
At least 2.5 years of professional experience on programming languages ecosystems such as C++, Perl, Python, PHP and/or Java.
Vast experience working with Unix/Linux systems.

Additional Knowledge And Professional Experience
Experience on the development, generation and use of software containers, e.g. Docker, Singularity, as well as their orchestration and deployment, e.g. using docker compose, kubernetes, ansible and/or similar technologies.
Experience on workflow managers such as Galaxy, Nextflow or similar.
Experience on developing project technical specifications.
Competencies
Ability of understand scientific literature, and software documentation.
Ability to communicate scientific results.
Ability to work independently.
Ability to represent the team at international project meetings.
Used to work under pressure under strict deadlines.
Conditions

The position will be located at BSC within the Life Sciences Department

We offer a full-time contract (40 hours a week), a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, private health insurance, fully support to the relocation procedures

Duration: Temporary - 1 year renewable

Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona

Starting date: as soon as possible

Role: Data Engineer with C#

Application from women are particularly encouraged !

Within an international environment, we are looking for a Data Analyst to deliver on-going project implementations and support for existing Business Intelligence and Reporting Services implementations under the Microsoft SQL Server technology platform and strong knowledge in C# development.

Descripci√≥n:
We are papernest

We have a dream a world without paperwork. A world where administration phobics like us live finally protected from the anguish of the form filling and surcharges for late payments.

On the other hand, we will not lie to you, there is much work to do. That‚Äôs why we are looking for committed, creative, and enthusiastic people like you.

Since 2015, we‚Äôve been working hard. In France there are 4+ million moves per year, and 76% of people feel stressed about moving - this is the big problem we decided to solve. As a result, we have created the only platform that allows you to transfer all your contracts when you move, 100% free, 100% online. Celebrating our fifth anniversary, we have more than 650+ employees, based in Paris and Barcelona; and we have been serving over 500,000 users in France, Spain, UK and Italy.

We think big bubbling ideas all around the world towards a future where our entire administrative life is as simple as a single click.

As a Workforce Management Team Leader you‚Äôll have a central position in our operational delivery being responsible for producing accurate forecasts and administering our ambitious capacity plan. You‚Äôll have to convey the papernest mindset and ambition to your team, and deliver scheduling for more than 600 hundreds employees.

In order to do so you‚Äôll have to coordinate forecasts, scheduling, and real time monitoring.
Deploy our operational roadmap. You‚Äôll be responsible for meeting our QoS objectives, and designing our international (5 countries) planning strategy.
Define agent requirements according to the levels of service committed through the realization of different forecasting and planning scenarios. Deliver a clear recruitment plan with talent acquisition and operational managers.
Manage WFM Analytics and reporting, and monitor on an intraday and daily basis our forecasts assumptions. You‚Äôll have to monitor very closely any KPIs that impact our QoS and Productivity. Take any corrective action that is needed in case of a deviation.
Feed and monitor our external partners with forecasts and objectives. You‚Äôll be the owner of the relationship with their WFM Team, and for reviewing with them any deviation.
Responsible for scheduling 500 agents, you can understand and take in hand very quickly our current scheduling tool and make it fit perfectly with our needs.
Responsible for all the WFM communications we might need to send (Holidays, Bank Holidays‚Ä¶), you‚Äôll have to make sure that all production decisions that might impact staffing are duly reported to the WFM team.
Manage and structure WFM Team. Coordinate and streamline communication with operational and marketing teams.
Follow-up with papernest growth and new challenges coming in next few months + 200 employees to schedule, a new WFM tool to deploy and integrate into our current infrastructure and structure WFM Team !


Requirements
At least 5 years of experience in WFM
A managerial experience
Perfect English speaking is compulsory, French Speaking is a plus
KPI‚Äôs & data-driven mindset
Excellent mastering of Excel / Gsheet
Great sense of communication
Good knowledge of spanish labor legislation


Benefits

Why papernest?
You will be working with talented, smart, and great people
You will have high responsibility and autonomy to make as much impact as you can imagine
You will be working in a fast-growing and internationally expanding company with great opportunities for you to step up in your career
You will work in a meritocracy with test-and-learn and fear-nothing attitude where truths rule and politics have no space
And not mention our much loved monthly theme paper-party and other events


Your manager

You will be managed by Pauline, our Operations Data Analyst. As comfortable on a football field as on a dataset, Pauline knows how to juggle operational urgency and analytical distance. For more than 2 years in papernest, the database holds no more secrets for her, and she will know how to sharpen your analytical mind and make you a SQL champion!

An Excel test
Interview with Pauline (Your future manager)
Interview with Cl√©ment (Barcelona site director)

If this challenge is yours, we look forward to meeting you!

Description

We‚Äôre working to become the most customer-centric company on Earth. As we continue to open up more opportunities, we are seeking a savvy, motivated Graduate Business Analyst to join our world-class Fulfilment & Operations network. You‚Äôll function as a trusted Business Analyst, Business partner and advisor within the Finance team for the Spain fulfilment network.

About This Key Role

In this role you‚Äôll do far more than manage spreadsheets. Our ideal Business Analyst doesn‚Äôt just manage our books and make our ends meet; they help drive the company forward. So while one aspect of this role is about understanding our numbers and budgets, equal aspects of the position require the big vision and drive of an ambitious Business Analyst. You‚Äôll make huge impact, not just on the bottom line performance of the Spain fulfilment network, but on the overall customer experience.

You‚Äôll employ every facet of finance data mining to ensure your partners, colleagues and leaders have the most up to date, reliable information at hand, helping them make the best possible financial decisions they can.

You‚Äôll Be Responsible For
Managing and participating in finance and accounting activities
Implementing policies and programmes through the fulfilment network that guide Operations towards maintaining and improving its competitive position and profitability
Creating a ‚Äúlearn by doing‚Äù environment, by engaging with the on-the-floor Associates and managers, and cross-site
Working with data source providers and technology teams, ensuring that key decision data is accurate, automated and timely
Standardize reporting processes and reports in order to achieve best in class quality in the fulfilment network

Basic Qualifications
Recent graduate from a degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, Engineering or other related discipline
Fluent in Spanish and English (verbal and written)
Advanced proficiency in MS Excel (e.g. pivot tables, macros, VBA, etc.)
Experience of working with large-scale data mining and reporting tools (e.g. SQL, MS Access, Essbase and/or Cognos), alongside other financial systems (e.g. Oracle, SAP, Lawson, JD Edwards)
Ability to employ root cause analysis to identify issues quickly, while uncovering their causes
Demonstrable analytical acumen in delivering data interpretation of business impact and results
Preferred Qualifications
Advanced problem solving and root cause analysis ability, combined with confident communication skills for conveying your conclusions
Highly analytical and detail-oriented, and bring a strong sense of business acumen
Ability to manage and prioritize your workload in a fast-paced, high-growth, and occasionally ambiguous environment
Previous experience in positions requiring analysis and reporting of finance results
Proven expertise in standardization and upgrades of existing finance processes and reporting deliverables
Previous experience in a manufacturing, distribution centre or logistics environment is a strong plus
Willingness to relocate for potential advancement opportunities
We‚Äôre looking forward to receiving your application, preferably in English.

TeamCMP is a digital entertainment company founded in Rochester (NY) in the early 2000‚Äôs and with offices in Barcelona since 2007.

We're 150+ people energized about our future and enjoying everything a high-growth company has to offer. We're technologists, marketers, business operators, video producers and VR experts from over 32 nationalities

At TeamCMP we are passionate about innovation! We take a cutting-edge approach to development by utilizing the latest technologies and experimenting with all the new gadgets

Big volumes = big challenges

We field more than 250 million HTTP sessions per-day from our collection of some of the world's most well trafficked sites and our B2C products lead in their respective markets. We are committed to amplifying our presence and accelerating growth through our passionate, entrepreneurial and innovative workforce.

We are looking for a Senior Marketing Data Analyst to join our Analytics Department. As you establish a Marketing Analytics role, you will play a key role in the development of our acquisition channels like Instagram, Facebook, Google, Youtube, Search, Shopping Ads, Display, Affiliates etc.

Your experience with these channels will help you analyze the data, automate critical processes, and improve campaign performance.

Using your strong technical background, you will work directly with the marketing and tech teams on the implementations of various tracking systems, as well as solutions to automate and manage at large-scale advertising campaigns through APIs, and with the help of Data Science, you will build advanced models for multi-touch attribution or retargeting.

Responsibilities
Owning and developing tracking of the full customer journey across all current and future marketing platforms. Taking care of data quality, governance, integrations and enhancements of our data lake.
Leveraging data to understand, acquisition, activation, and retention dynamics, and help identify key growth and efficiency opportunities for our marketing team.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams (Marketing, Data Engineers, Data Scientists) to plan, facilitate, and develop Marketing Analytics projects.
Supporting our marketing experts to run A/B test campaigns by designing a clean experiment framework, gathering data, and analyzing results, in order to optimize and scale marketing operations.
Managing key projects for tracking implementation, attribution models, or advanced marketing techniques, such as segmentation or retargeting.

Requirements

The ideal candidate will have an interest in performance marketing, possess good communication skills, and a growth mindset. We are looking for someone who is passionate about challenging tech and data problems, enjoys finding insights in data, and applying conclusions to drive clear and practical business improvements, while exhibiting deep expertise in marketing multi-touch attribution and tracking systems.

Necessary skills
5+ years experience in a similar role as a Performance Marketing Analyst.
Experience working with different ad platforms/channels like Instagram, Facebook, Google Ads, Display, Affiliates.
Expert in Google Analytics and Google Ads (especially data collection and event tracking with Google Tag Manager)
Good knowledge of SQL, comfort working in large data sets in R or Python.
Good understanding of key performance marketing concepts (campaign measurement, audience targeting, etc.) and knowledge of industry trends.
Experience with leveraging marketing attribution models (3rd party or in-house solutions).
Project management experience creating advanced solutions for marketing performance optimization and tracking systems.
Must have strong commercial sense and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation).
Strong interpersonal management skills and ability to work in indirect/remote teams, if needed.
Fluent in English.

Nice to have
Marketing automation tools or Google360.
Shopify integration with other tracking systems for example GA.
Cross-domain tracking.
Familiar with product analytics tools such as Mixpanel or Amplitude.


Benefits
Private Health and Dental Insurance plan for employees.
Subsidized gym memberships and fitness classes.
Monthly internet allowance.
Working from home setup allowance.
Company sponsored Spanish, Catalan and English classes.
Sponsored training and development.
Quarterly company bonus programme.
Top notch Apple equipment.
Remote policy and flexible working hours
Flexible Bank Holidays. Design your own working calendar with a lengthy consecutive vacation day policy.
Day off for your birthday.
Hybrid remote model office.

We are TravelPerk: a fast-growing, well-funded startup that has raised nearly $134m since our creation in early 2015. Backed by world-class investors in some of tech‚Äôs most disruptive companies, including Slack, Trello, Twitter, Farfetch, Deliveroo and Delivery Hero, our team is made up of A-players from the travel industry.

We‚Äôve been named the fastest-growing SaaS startup in the world by the SaaS1000 and featured as one of the hottest startups to watch by both Forbes and Wired. We‚Äôre revolutionizing the B2B corporate travel market, worth over $1.3 trillion, by simplifying the process for everyone involved.

If you‚Äôre ready to take off with us, keep reading!

We are searching for a world class individual to join our Strategic Planning and Analysis team, reporting to our Head of Corporate SP&A. We are seeking someone who has proven modelling skills, and can translate complex analysis into impactful insight.

Role

Our role is to inform and drive some of Travelperk‚Äôs most important business decisions by

We are a dynamic Strategic Planning and Analysis team that enjoy solving the business challenges that come with rapid scaling. Our goal is to grow Travelperk as fast as possible, but in an efficient way.
Providing data driven insight and connection across multiple functions, segmenting by time (quarter, year, multi-year), and among varying levels of data (high-level external metrics to detailed operational indicators).
Linking that context directly to our corporate and business strategy.
Objectively assessing the impact of the decision on our business.

Do you have an analytical mind? Are you good storytelling? Let¬¥s talk!

What You Will Do
Use of best practice techniques to design 3 statement financial models, with multi-year scenario planning
10X our performance reporting capability in order to bring impactful and actionable insight to decision making across TravelPerk
Creating and explaining analysis for C-Level and other stakeholders. This will require experience in presenting at exec and senior manager level, as well as to the board, highlighting an ability to simplify high level details into digestible summary and actions
Working closely with our accounting and data science teams to ensure accurate and robust actual data and forecast
Cultivate and foster strong cross-functional relationships and collaboration across the company

Who You Are
5 years post qualified experience, made up of the FinTech and SaaS sectors.

You are curious and will take ownership of a task/project/action

What do we offer?

Flexible Work Policy
Until local governments and health professionals say it is safe to work from an office, TravelPerk will offer you 100% remote working from the country you are employed in
Once it is safe, you will need to be based in or relocate to Spain or UK for this position
You can be based anywhere in the country you are employed from but we will require you to travel to the office hub in your country in either Barcelona or London once per week
In addition, every quarter you will be required to travel to an office hub location for up 3-5 days to meet with your whole team and the rest of the company for an event
We have core working hours between 10:30-16:30 CET
Team members that want to go to the office more than once per week are welcome to!

We can help with relocation from anywhere in the world, English is the official language at the office.

TravelPerk is a global company with a diverse customer base‚Äîand we want to make sure the people behind our product reflect that. Role: Global Salesforce Analyst and Developer Cost Price and Quote (CPQ) M/F/D

Your Challenge

After a tailored learning programme, the Global Salesforce Analyst & Developer CPQ is an outstanding opportunity to support the Videojet Sales organization. With specific focus on our quoting tool, your work will directly create positive impact on process efficiency, drive revenue, margin growth and improve the experience of the Videojet‚Äôs customers and associates. This will be achieved by supporting leadership-led initiatives to develop these enhancements.

Western Europe Videojet locations, for all these locations we offer ‚ÄúWork from Home‚Äù flexibility.

Your responsibilities as Global Analyst Salesforce at Videojet, include:

Application Development
Translate business requirements into technical specifications while incorporating systematic constraints and balancing cost-reward relationship
Develop new features and enhance existing features to increase the functionality of the Salesforce quoting tool and other Sales system environments
Suggest and drive logic-based business rules, email alerts and process flows to support increased automation initiatives
Understand the user‚Äôs experience and predict use-cases to architect and implement usable solutions across multiple sales organization, systems and tools

Application Support
Manage and provide technical & software support for the sales (mobile) users for the Salesforce.com quoting tool and other commercial applications
Develop and implement reporting mechanisms for key business metrics and provide analytical support to Business Stakeholders in order to identify and capture sales growth opportunities
Provide general Salesforce and Applications‚Äô support for non-mobile sales users

Application Administration
Develop and/or enhance Standard Work Documentation and Auditing activities ( data collections, data integrity, and data compliance)
Manage the set-up, on-boarding, and training of new Quoting users, sales managers and product or managers
Analyse and optimize sales systems-related applications for both Customers (Portals) and Associates in relation to the quoting ecosystem

Basic Qualifications :
Fluency in both written and spoken English.
+4 years experience as Salesforce business analyst and configuration
+2 years experience SF CPQ configuration

Preferred qualifications:
Command of additional European languages

Our offer

Being part of a dynamic team in which there is a high focus on delivering results and continuous improvement, but also where having fun and teamwork is very important.

It's a fast-paced environment, a consultative role, where you will get to partner with people to achieve their strategic business goals.

You will work in a leading global company, with a Manager who cares about you, your strengths and will help you to develop the best possible version of yourself!

About Us

Videojet Technologies, Inc. is the global leader in the manufacturing of coding, printing and marking products. This high technology product prints variable information, such as expiration dates on grocery products, packaged goods, pharmaceuticals or catalogues. Our industry is pivotal in ensuring end users consume their food, beverage and pharmaceutical products safety. As the market share leader, we have operations in over 30 countries with 4,000 employees worldwide. A wholly owned subsidiary of Danaher Corporation (www.danaher.com), Videojet is the core of the $1 billion Product Identification Platform. We offer a results-oriented environment that is multicultural organisation that promotes both diversity and inclusion through the full organisation, team-cantered, customer focused and quality-focused, guided by the successful Danaher Business System. Working at Videojet, gives you access to a robust career development process and exciting opportunities.

Our Core Values

We empower creativity and unconventional thinking to help us uncover breakthrough solutions and accelerate the pace of innovation. We believe with conviction that diversity helps us uncover more powerful customer insights and ultimately creates a competitive advantage in the markets we serve. And we would love to have you on this journey with us!

Data and Analytics at Vistaprint

Vistaprint‚Äôs Data and Analytics (DnA) organization is working to make our company one of the world‚Äôs most well-known and successful data-driven companies. The cross-functional team includes product owners, analysts, technologists, data engineers and more - all passionate about providing Vistaprint with information and tools we can use to deliver jaw-dropping customer value. DnA team members are empowered to learn new skills, communicate openly and be active problem-solvers.

What You Will Do
Be immersed in diverse teams (e.g., Product Owners, Marketing, Developers) where you will collaborate on analyses and continually bring forward ideas and insights to drive value for our customers.
Data Exploration, Visualization, and Dashboarding. Identify trends and drivers, perform exploratory data analyses and present views that will provide visibility into our performance.
Data Analysis and Modeling. Incorporate multiple data sources and methodologies to find opportunities to drive marketing efficiency in our advertising and improve the customer experience to acquire valuable customers and promote repeat shopping behavior.
Design and execute a/b/n tests to optimize the customer experience and analyse results to provide insightful recommendations to the business. Experience with Optimizely a plus.
Collaborating in a fast paced, agile environment that focuses on delivering customer value early and often.

Your Qualifications
Passionate about data and technology. You have experience in SQL. Other programming languages (e.g., Python, R) are a plus. Experience with web analytic tools (i.e., Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics) a plus.
Inquisitive by nature. You are comfortable with exploratory analysis and statistical techniques and are driven to find meaningful patterns and trends in the data. Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Looker is a plus.
A resourceful and driven problem solver. You enjoy and/or have demonstrated ability tackling complex problems, drawing inferences from data, and using your analysis skills and eye for business to identify solutions. You have excellent organizational skills, strong attention to detail and ability to effectively deliver on projects supporting multiple business partners.
Team-minded and versatile. You have experience and an interest in partnering with multi-functional team members who come to the table with different perspectives. You are open to creative approaches to solving problems.
Experienced. 0 to 3+ years in an analytics environment and a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or related field.

Why You‚Äôll Love Working Here

At Vistaprint, we put phenomenal importance into the wellbeing of our employees, which is why we offer perks that ensure an excellent work/life balance. Perks include language courses, flexible schedules, work from home capabilities, and very generous time off, including our outstanding sabbatical-like program, ‚ÄúVistabreak‚Äù, Summer hours and Public Holidays, to name a few!

About Us

As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vistaprint is a dynamic organization that maintains an exciting, entrepreneurial culture. With founder Robert Keane‚Äôs return as CEO, we‚Äôve renewed our focus on empowering and helping small businesses. To do this, we create customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We thrive on providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation and growth - for both our customers and our team.

We are growing our Requirements Engineering / IT Business Analyst Team in Barcelona and are looking for new colleagues who will bring their consultative and analytical experience spiced up by technical skills.

And by technical skills we mean that you have a solid experience working in web-development projects interpreting clients wishes into technical specifications for the Development team.

If it sounds like you, read on...

Your Tasks  

You will be the link between our customer and our development teams and translate business requests to technical requirements and into technical concepts.
You will write business requirements, testing software, executing operational tasks and providing project management support while strengthening your technical acumen and business consulting skills. 
You will take responsibility for the conception and design of web-based solutions in the digital marketing domain, designing, testing and launching the technology that meets fully the business need. You will truly be a game changer for our clients.
You will also be brainstorming with the client at the outset of a project, then acting as an assistant project manager as the project progresses.
You will support the analysis and implementation of requirements along the entire software development cycle.
You will document and present the solutions implemented with your team for internal and external stakeholders.

Strong verbal and written English skills (C1 and higher)

Solid technical understanding of web development and web application integrations
Able to translate business requirements to technical solutions
Basic knowledge of HTML / CSS / JavaScript and / or web-relevant programming languages

Experience in the analysis of IT processes and the structured creation of requirements for IT systems
Knowledge of software modelling methods (UML, flow charts, use cases...), methodologies and process models in software development
Eligibility to work within the EU and/or Switzerland

What makes us smile when looking at your profile

Experience with Adobe Experience Cloud (AEC) products, especially Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), Adobe Analytics (AA), or Adobe Campaign (AC)
Knowledge in the area of Search Engine Optimization (SEO) 
Motivation to work in a distributed, international team
Experience in using tools like JIRA / Confluence
A proactive mind-set, ability to share your ideas and bring them to life
Enthusiasm and an open mind which is looking for continuous improvement
You are not afraid of giving and receiving feedback

What we can offer you:

Permanent contract
30 working days of vacation for all employees
Flexible working hours, with respect to project needs
Recognition bonus system

Free language classes to polish your English or help you with your Spanish

About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo (glovoapp.com) is looking for a world-class Data Analyst. Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on? Are you looking for a challenging experience in one of Barcelona‚Äôs fastest growing Startups ‚Äì helping build a product that will disrupt the on-demand market? If your answer is YES, we are looking forward to meeting you.

The routing team mission is to provide accurate, reliable and business-driven estimations around the logistics of each order in real time, contributing to a top-class user experience and to maximize the efficiency of the fleet. Engineers, data scientists and data analysts work together to develop and productionalize machine learning models, explore and roll-out new features, and to solve complex problems through the means of data.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Understand business needs and produce insightful analyses for internal teams to make the right decisions
Closely collaborate with data scientists to understand models impact on KPI, suggest improvements and coordinate rollouts
Take ownership of reporting of KPIs by creating customised tools or using the available ones
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
Act as an internal consultant to translate business questions into insights
A/B test the launch of new features
Assist colleagues in gaining access to the right data
Build robust relationships with key business stakeholders


You Have
At least 2 years of work experience providing internal teams with the necessary data to make the right decisions
Proficient with SQL
Amazon Redshift experience is highly desirable
Experience in Python or R
Knowledge of visualisation tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview
Data Science understanding is desirable
Proficiency in English is a must


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment


What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we‚Äôre currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://glovoapp.com/ | Twitter: @Glovo_ES | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/glovoappES/ | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/glovo-app/

Reporting and Analytics Business Analyst

About The Job

Our opportunity Are you passionate about data and analytics, someone that wants to be part of a motivated team and help us make a difference? Then this is your opportunity within one of the world's leading insurance groups!

In this role as a Reporting Business Analyst / Business Intelligence Specialist, you will be part of the " Analytics and Reporting " team within Group Investment Management.

You will collaborate closely with IT functions and a diverse range of end user in different countries and translate their analytical and reporting needs into requirements and solutions.

Responsibilities

Your role As a Reporting and Analytics Business Analyst your main responsibilities will involve Develop analytical, regulatory and operational reports using SAP Business Objects, BEX, SAP Analysis for Office, Microsoft Power BI and other analytical tools
Maintain key business applications (based on SAP/BW, BW4/HANA) and support/lead new business initiatives
Perform impact analysis of application changes, holding an end-to-end view of the system
Support the continuous improvement of existing reporting processes, services and infrastructure
Provide end-user support/training for global reporting needs
Run requirement gathering workshops; create requirements documents and design concepts
Ensure compliance and data quality

Your Skills And Experience As a Reporting and Analytics Business Analyst your skills and qualifications will ideally include:
Minimum 5 years of experience as a business analyst/ business intelligence specialist
Bachelor's/Master's degree in Business Administration, Information Technology or equivalent
Strong knowledge of business intelligence principles, data analytics, query design, modelling and reporting front-end tools
Strong Business Analyst skills (e.g. analytical skills, requirement engineering, design thinking, agile methodologies)
Proven ability to work in a multi-cultural environment
Strong Communication skills in written and spoken English
Basic knowledge of financial processes and investment instruments are a plu
Knowledge of SAP FSCM-FAM is a plus
Spanish language skill is a plus


Technical Knowledge
Strong skills in SAP/BW & SAP BW4/HANA, Query Design, SAP front-end tools
Advanced skills in modern Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, PBI)
Data analysis skills in R/Python are a strong plus

Additional Information
Primary work location is Barcelona. This position requires some light traveling. You can apply by clicking on the button "Apply online"

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:
Wide range of internal and external trainings
Ticket restaurant
Option to work remotely up to 50% of time weekly
Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company
Life Insurance
Exclusive employee discounts
Free English and Spanish classes depends on the business needs

Descripci√≥n:
Who We Are

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the worlds marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.

Overview

Building an advertising platform that answers our client marketing objectives requires strong product managers and great software developers, but it also demands excellence from the commercial and operations teams. To connect both product and operational worlds, Criteo can count on Product Experts whose goals are to ensure that products are best brought to market, correspond to client expectations and that their revenue grows.

The Creative Product Expertise team is, therefore, co-accountable for the customer success and growth of our products, with a particular mandate over the management of creative and analytical knowledge across our field operations teams as well as the collection of market feedback. As part of the Global Operations team, members build a relationship and have a direct line with product management and field operations, granting them great autonomy to influence the full cycle of a products life.

Every day, you will

Develop understanding and in-depth knowledge of the Criteos Creative Product, including technical inner workings of products, their business functionality and performance, their managed and self-service controls and best practices, and our product improvement strategy and roadmap.

Review the product line strategy, the Creative product roadmap and the R&Ds objectives and key results (OKRs),

Attend and participate in recurring discussions with Product Management, Product Analytics and other internal groups,

Assist Product Management in the writing of technical documentations in a way that is broadly digestible,

Dig into technical specifications and data models to get a complete understanding of the products underlying architecture.

Act as an analytical expert as well as a Creative product evangelist, providing support and opportunities to field creative consultants (CS), field analytics (AX), and advertising operations (AdOps) teams in order to converge toward the most successful use and extension of our Creative products.

Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, responding to business/creative product priorities.

Leverage your expertise to deliver actionable insights to the field.

Prepare operations team with trainings, processes and tools to build a product expertise on the field (i.e., in all our markets),

Collect and answer creative and analytical questions in a way that contributes to maintaining a global expertise,

Monitor, fix or escalate technical issues around existing creative product reports to maintain their performance,

Exchange and debate the need of new features that contribute to customer success and revenue,

Identify data storytelling opportunities that could solidify our products position on the market.

Become a trusted advisor to our product managers and product solutions strategists, best connecting our client marketing objectives with our services, increasing customer success and participating in the rollout, growth and maturity of products.

Challenge the roadmap to ensure that our products are performing and run smoothly,

Provide relevant inputs into product improvements with business cases collected from field teams,

Help in the design of new features, test new development releases and provide immediate feedback,

Track product performance, both adoption rate and outcome for clients, and look for levers of improvements.

In exchange, youll enjoy...

Competitive compensation, because youre the best

Career advancement and global mobility opportunities

Medical and dental insurance to maintain your client-facing smile

Generous vacation policy (although who wants to leave Spain?)

Game and sports area when you need a break

Daily lunch vouchers to keep you going

As for our dream candidate

A thoughtful communicator who is excellent at communicating through a variety of channels that require both written and verbal skills,

Passionate about innovative problem solving for customers and end users,

Self-motivated, eager to learn and thrive in a collaborative environment,

Capable of adapting quickly to changing priorities,

Familiar with customer and/or technical support by experience,

You are willing to grow your technical expertise. Proficiency in SQL, Tableau and Python is a plus.

Fluent in English as it would be the day-to-day working language.

At Criteo, we are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed.

By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenabling our customers to experience the world.

Get To Know Our Team

The Supply Optimization and Commercialization (SOCs) team sits within the Product Supply team at Agoda Bangkok. We work closely with the sales department (Partner Services) to identify and optimize growth opportunities on accommodations supply for the company and to set up experiments to measure and implement changes. The projects SOCs team works on directly impact Agoda‚Äôs bottom line and have long lasting structural impact to the business. We cover a range of topics including organizational efficiency, sales and product optimization, go to market strategies as well innovation and products. We collaborate with multiple departments and produce highly visible results backed up by experimentation and data. Utilizing powerful tools and possessing an end-to-end view of how Agoda works, the SOCs offers a team of learning and experience that will push you (and Agoda) into new territory.

The Opportunity

The SOCs Analytics team is a sub-team within the SOCs team and serve as subject matter experts on analytics, automation, business intelligence, data, and experimentation. We work closely with the other business, product, and analytics teams to develop and build analytical products, systems and automated processes, as well as drive analytical projects to improve organisational performance and drive revenue growth for the company.

In This Role, You‚Äôll Get To
Use and analyse data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and understand data flows across the entire organisation
Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at developing conceptual and data-modelled frameworks to optimise business performance on the Supply-side
Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organisational efficiency


What You‚Äôll Need To Succeed
A hacker‚Äôs mindset ‚Äì the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics or Mathematics
A strong understanding of statistics and the underlying mathematics behind Machine Learning/ Deep Learning techniques
A basic understanding of computer science and data, and the ability to implement this understanding in complex business situations


It‚Äôs Great If You Have
Experience with complex analytics and statistical/machine learning techniques using R/Python/Spark
Master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Operations Research, or Data Science

Auto req ID: 229879BR

Job Description

Purpose of the role
PepsiCo is a leading food and beverage company in Europe, with presence across many complex markets where we have a broad range of categories and products. This very successful business is launching a multi-year business transformation program which is relying on an SAP S4 backbone and other integrated strategic solutions being rolled out. The purpose of this role is to lead the SAP S4 data design and data conversion for the value stream Order to Cash (OTC) as part of Europe template deployment.

Our first program deployment is focusing on our UK and Poland business units with a project office near London, while our teams are based across multiple hubs around Europe and the World. The team consist of functional experts, business analyst and development/integration experts as well as vendor partners, consultants and internal/external service groups

The broader team
We are a diverse multi-cultural group of excited and purpose-driven professionals located across Europe, driving business transformation and collaborate across teams and functions. Our projects are often complex and challenging but always business driven and cross-functional. Our core values include transparency, inclusion, trust and to deliver as a team. We are agile, with a positive and innovative mindset and we find important to keep each-other energized and to have some fun on the journey.
The ideal Candidate
You drive your agenda with passion and pride, inspiring team members to grow. You set the agenda and embrace risks and ambiguity that comes from complex problems and the broader matrixed organization and continuously find mitigations and solutions to succeed. You set an example within your team with your own personal growth and you even influence peers and other teams with your proactivity and coaching approach. You can get things done with an effective combination of formal and informal collaboration across the organization. You have a sense of humour and you‚Äôre not afraid of using it.

Further Details of the role

Relationships
Reports to the SAP Business Data Lead
Works closely with project IT, Business and Value Streams
Partners with SAP Global Template teams
Partners and closely collaborates with business value stream teams
Deliverables:
Senior SAP Data Analyst will be primarily responsible for supporting the Data Collection and Cleaning activities working closely with Business and Project Team (Process Leads and Data Migration Team)
Oversees and ensures delivery of all aspects of QM and EAM data objects: data readiness, data quality issue resolution
Ensures compliance with SAP Global Template Data standards for business process areas: Quality Management and Enterprise Asset Management
Work with legacy IT system experts to understand legacy data designs
Accountabilities
Lead data readiness activities for respective area
Partner with process leads, migration and conversion team
Work with the Data Conversion & Readiness team to review results of legacy data profiling to identify data cleansing opportunities and optimized approach for cleansing
Supports data quality issue resolution during testing and migration activities
Ensure data is fit for purpose and aligned to business needs and PGT Design

Qualifications/Requirements
Minimum of 5 years of experience supporting or deploying SAP ERP (ECC or S/4) implementations, with a strong focus on the QM and EAM Value Stream area
Good understanding of following business process areas: Quality Inspections Processes, Plant Maintenance Process
Good understanding of Data Objects in QM Area: Inspection Plans, MICs, QMIR, Inspection Methods
Good understanding of Data Objects in EAM Area: Functional Locations, Measurement Points, Equipment BOM, Tasks etc
Strong analytical skills, as shown by the advanced use of data analysis tools and concepts, such as Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Access, Data Migration (ie: LSMW, Hana Cockpit)
Previous experiences of ERP Data analysis, Data Cleansing and migration activities is a must
Ability to understand complex data requirements, and be able to identify and offer multiple solution options to facilitate the best outcome (e.g. automated transformation vs. manual enrichment)
Strong influencing, facilitating, and consulting skills in working with stakeholders at all levels in the organization and across departments
Excellent oral and written skills to effectively communicate complex ideas and concepts, and provide clear documentation to the management and project leadership
Service oriented attitude balanced with ‚Äúdoing what is right for the project/business‚Äù, even if that is not a popular decision.
Ability to quickly adapt to changes in timelines and sequences, deal with ambiguity, and succeed against in a high-pressure environment
Knowledge and experience in the Agile Methodology and related tools (such as MS Azure DevOps) desired
Ability to work flexible hours based on varying business requirements
Knowledge and experience in the following tools, disciplines and processes are nice to have: SAP SolMan 7+ , MS Azure DevOps, HP ALM

Relocation Eligible: Not Applicable
Job Type: Pipeline
