Vistaprint‚Äôs Data and Analytics (DnA) organization is working to make our company one of the world‚Äôs most well-known and successful data-driven companies. The cross-functional team includes product owners, analysts, technologists, data engineers and more - all focused on providing Vistaprint with information and tools we can use to deliver jaw-dropping customer value. DnA team members are empowered to learn new skills, communicate openly and be active problem-solvers.

Do you want to be at the intersection of art and science? We are establishing a team to fuel the power of machine learning to innovate how customers will discover and build designs on our products! We are looking for an experienced analyst that will take the lead on generating insights on how should transform the Vistaprint customer experience! Join us on this journey as we take design to the next level!

What You Will Do
Be immersed in a diverse data product team where you will collaborate on data products and continually bring forward ideas and insights to drive value for our customers.
Data Exploration, Visualization, and Dashboarding. Identify trends and drivers, perform exploratory data analyses and present views that will provide visibility into our performance and opportunities in design.
Data Analysis and Modeling. Incorporate multiple data sources and methodologies to understand the impact of opportunities identified through insights tools.
Collaborate in a fast paced, agile environment that focuses on delivering customer value early and often.
Value driven impact partner for key business stakeholders, influencing strategy and growth opportunities.
Tackle challenges and seek sophisticated problems, drawing inferences from data, and using analytic skills to determine solutions and deliver results.
Be a game-changer. To innovate, we will be challenging how we have always thought of design and need to be ready for unchartered territory. and innovate on high value initiative in the full-spectrum design domain.

Your Qualifications
Experience with and proficiency in SQL.
Good understanding of exploratory analysis and statistical techniques and skilled in finding substantial patterns and trends in the data.
Excellent organizational skills, good attention to detail and ability to efficiently deliver on projects supporting multiple business partners.
Experience partnering with versatile, multi-functional team members who come to the table with different perspectives and have a consistent record of developing creative approaches to solving problems.
4+ years in an eCommerce environment and a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or related field, with validated experience coaching and mentoring junior team members.

Nice To Have
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Looker
Other programming languages (e.g., Python, R)
Experience with web analytic tools (i.e., Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics)

Why You'll Love Working Here

Being at Vistaprint means that you don‚Äôt see work as just a building, a desk or a manufacturing floor. You see it as a chance to take a step forward in your career journey - and your life. We strive to give you everything you need to learn, grow, and succeed. Through innovation, collaboration, and perpetual exposure to what‚Äôs next, we‚Äôre always pushing boundaries and broadening our horizons. We embrace the chance to operate outside of our comfort zone to discover what we‚Äôre capable of. Some might call that a challenge; we just call it another great day at work.

Remote First-Culture

In 2020, Vistaprint adopted a Remote-First operating model and culture. We heard from our team members that having the freedom, autonomy and trust in each other to work from home and, the ability to operate when they are most productive, empowers everyone to be their best and most brilliant self. Vistaprint also provides collaboration spaces for team members to work physically together when it's safe to do so or believe in office working will deliver the best results. Currently we are enabled to hire remote team members in over 20 US States as well as several countries in Europe: Spain, Germany, UK, Czech Republic, the Netherlands and Switzerland.

About Us

As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vistaprint is a dynamic organization that maintains an exciting, entrepreneurial culture. With founder Robert Keane‚Äôs return as CEO, we‚Äôve renewed our focus on empowering and helping small businesses. To do this, we create customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We thrive on providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation and growth - for both our customers and our team.

At the SEAT:CODE we are constantly looking for talented people willing to join our projects. Our start-up environment is very open-minded, we love to test and implement new ideas. If you think you are ready to enjoy your work and be part of our big family, we invite you to keep reading what we think could be a good fit for our current needs. We are looking for a full-time DATA Analyst. You will work on a day-to-day basis in squads with talented designers, product owners & software developers to build a scalable and solid product.

The Data Analyst Role
These extravagant competencies are particularly distinctive:
Above-average team ability.
Above-average learning readiness.
To rethink the team's feedback to reflect within the framework of the Balanced Team Approach (Janice Fraser).
High degree of self-interest.
High analytical competence.
Your Experience
Ph.D. in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Engineering, Statistics, or other technical fields.
3+ years' experience in data science/quantitative analysis, etc.
Passionate about Big Data and its potential for the IoT / Smart Cities: user profiling, self-learning, pattern matching, fault prediction, and preventive and predictive maintenance, etc.
Understanding of statical analysis. Excellent data mining skills.
Expertise in predictive analytics, artificial intelligence, machine learning: supervised learning, clustering, and time series analysis.
Experience working with multiple data-sets.
Has an eye for data visualization and can demonstrate creativity.
Excellent problem-solving skills and proven technical leadership.
Programming experience in Python and/or with Java/Kotlin/R is a plus.
Experience with large scale data analysis frameworks (e.g. Spark, Hadoop/MapReduce).
Experience with all AWS Data related services (Athena, S3, Glue, API GW, kinesis, etc..).
Ability to extract business metrics/questions from data sets.
Ability to turn vague concepts and asks into well-documented and effective business metrics and insights.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills including the ability to identify and communicate data-driven insights in a clear and effective manner.
Bonus: experience in relevant vertical industries: consumer electronics, automotive, industrial, health.
Fluent in English and/or Spanish.
About The Team
Our technical Team loves to deliver really well-crafted solutions at a decent speed. We love tech so we really give great attention to the technology (Technology as the first-class Citizen).
We know that small, empowered, self-motivated teams can do big things.
We like to measure everything so we are always improving, for that we use the best tools on the market such as Datadog.
Finally, we promote a culture of no blame, trust, and learning, and we support the mantra ‚Äúif it hurts to do it more often‚Äù so good CI and CD are really key for us.

We're creating the automotive future and we know that we will only succeed if it's built with people from around the world, with gender diversity and with many different backgrounds.
People who like high quality software development, who appreciate simplicity, are used to good practices (TDD, DDD, KISS, ...) and to the culture of craftsmanship.

SGT is looking for a CYBER THREAT ANALYST, based in our MADRID office.

WHY YOU SHOULD CONSIDER THIS OPPORTUNITY

Would you like to be part of one of the largest transformations the World is experiencing in the past several decades? In Financial Services, consumer expectations are rising, and technological advances are enabling amazing customer experiences and new businesses not possible before. The emergence of disruptive platforms as a business model has reshaped other industries and is poised to do the same in financial services.

At Santander (www.santander.com) we embrace this change. 

Santander is proud of being an organization where there are equal opportunities regardless of gender identity, culture and disability. Our mission is to contribute to help more people and business prosper. You can click here Why Santander to watch a short clip and learn why banking is still exciting. 

Santander Global Technology (SGT) is the team of technology and operations at Santander. We are convinced of the importance of technology that is aligned with the requirements of the business and that out work not only brings value to users, people and communities but also fosters individual creativity. Our team of over 2,000 people in 7 countries (Spain, Portugal, UK, USA, Mexico, Chile and Brazil) develops and/or implements financial solutions across a broad spectrum of technologies (including Blockchain, Big Data and Angular among others) on all kinds of on-premise and cloud-based platforms.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

As a Cyber Threat Analyst your mission will be to manage cyber security in the company, being responsible for execution and follow up of cyber projects, controls, and business as usual activities, helping to strengthen our defenses against internal and external threats.    

We need somebody like you to help us in different fronts:
-    Manage cyber security controls looking for continuous improvement and threat containment, reduce risk vectors mitigation, and identify residual cyber risk
-    Analyze cyber events to detect and respond in time to prevent business impact, identify root cause, propose controls to prevent same events in future
-    Threat intelligence feeds analysis helping in the proactive identification of entity threats or risk vectors
-    Analyze vulnerabilities that could impact business, working with technical teams to prioritize remediation
-    Enable Defend services our company, with the primary function to prevent cyber attacks
-    Ensure relevant information and events being generated, captured and delivered to the central detect systems in a timely manner
-    Manage global cyber projects, identifying key actions and implement based on entity needs
-    Security culture and people behavior: drive cyber security awareness and behaviors to build a security culture
-    Group Cyber security and strategy implementation: participate in the adoption of Global Controls minimum requirements in alignment with Business risk appetite as part of the cyber strategy
-    Cyber technology risk management: help the adoption of Cyber Framework, Cyber & Technology Risk policies and procedures


Aptitudes y experiencia deseadas


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

EXPERIENCE
-    + 3 years‚Äô experience in Cyber Security in financial sector
-    Experience working in cyber security sector

EDUCATION
-    Information security/risk management certification such as CEH, CISA, CISSP

SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE
-    Expertise in managing cyber events and incidents
-    Excellent expertise in cyber controls implementation and oversee
-    Knowledge of vulnerability management lifecycle and frameworks
-    In depth knowledge of information technology, security solutions and frameworks
-    Understanding of technical and human aspects of cyber threats and security
-    Ability to understand the business context and technology manage uncertainty
-    Excellent technical understanding of IT and Information Security solutions, processes and systems
-    Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
-    Strong problem solving and innovative mind-set to ensure a clear focus on the forward agenda
-    Knowledge of information technology and security solutions and frameworks, such as  Cyber Security Framework from NIST

WHAT WE OFFER YOU

Welcome to #TheSantanderEffect. Here, with only a small action or a simple idea, you can do great things. We offer you the advantages and the means to contribute to the progress of more than 140 million people around the world. These are the key factors that multiply the actions of all our employees:

-    Meaningful Impact - Where the effect of your work makes a difference and helps people to prosper 
-    Personal and Professional Growth - The chance to develop through world-class training, challenging work, and different roles 
-    Respect - Be part of an organization that cares ‚Äì about its people, its wider community, and the environment
-    Co-worker quality - Work with inspiring professionals who are leaders in their field
-    Global stability - Work for a solid global organization that has successfully reinvented itself many times in its 160- year history.

If you want to know more about us, follow us on https://es.linkedin.com/company/banco-santander

Description

Amazon‚Äôs European Fashion team is looking for an exceptionally motivated and talented Customer Insights and Marketing Analyst (m/f/d) with strong customer obsession and relentless focus on improving the customer experience. This role can be based in Germany, the UK, France, Italy or Spain.

Are you analytically sharp, keen to make a difference? Would you love to take on the challenge to drive customer demand for some of Amazon‚Äôs most diverse and challenging product categories? You will become part of the wider marketing team supporting the Fashion Category teams across Europe, including Apparel, Shoes & Bags and Jewelry. Thereby, you will work closely with other Business Analysts and Business Intelligence Engineers across the Fashion team. This role exists in a challenging environment with responsibility for five countries, within a fast-growing office.

As a Customer Insights and Marketing Analyst you will help us make effective decisions based on data from multiple sources, compiling it and triangulating it into a digestible and actionable format. In this highly visible role, you will use and create reports to analyze data, make sense of the results and be able to explain what it all means to key stakeholders. You will analyze large amounts of data, discover and solve complex business problems and build metrics and business cases around key performance of the business. By combining your findings with qualitative research you can develop an even deeper and holistic understanding of customer behavior. The ideal candidate will use a customer backwards approach in deriving insights and proactively identifying actions we can take to improve the customer experience and conversion.

Scope
Work as a business partner with marketing, finance and category teams in order to tackle customer-related business challenges and evaluate marketing performance with a data driven approach.
Leverage marketing and customer reporting tools to generate customer insights that can be used by the marketing team and key stakeholders. Analyze data and perform root cause analyses to understand customer behavior and engagement while leveraging ETL and SQL when necessary.
Partner with your teammates and relevant stakeholders to combine the generated data with external and qualitative data from market research and marketing agencies to understand and explain the ‚ÄúWhy‚Äù of customer behavior.
Maintain a deep understanding of business drivers and an innate grasp of customer metric definitions, and interact with business leaders to give context and support them in interpreting reporting data.
Conceptualize and run analyses that generate insights on customer behavior and customer needs to help further develop and improve our value proposition and marketing strategy.
Provide an insightful interpretation of results, pro-actively generate ideas, formulate and communicate recommendations that drive action. This way, enable the marketing team to improve the customer experience and our customer relationship management (acquisition, engagement and reactivation).
The ability to identify and scope a problem, formulate relevant questions, draw relevant data and provide insights from the data is critical for the role. The ideal candidate (f/m/d) would also have an excellent business acumen to be able to interpret the data in context, a restlessness to answer ‚Äúwhy?‚Äù questions, excellent analytical abilities, strong technical skills and excellent written and verbal communication skills.

For This Position, We Expect

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
This position requires a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in mathematics, statistics, operational research, economics or related quantitative discipline.
Multiple years of relevant employment experience.
Expert in writing SQL scripts.
Solid communication skills and team player.
Capable of investigating, familiarizing and mastering new data sets quickly.
Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
Ability to display complex quantitative data in a simple, intuitive format and to present findings in a clear and concise manner.
Further Qualifications Would Be a Plus

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Several years of relevant experience in a business analyst, data analyst or statistical analysis role.
Advanced technical or business degree (MS or MBA).
Experience with large-scale datasets.
Experience in developing requirements and formulating business metrics for reporting, familiarity with data visualization tools, e.g. Tableau/Quicksight.
Familiarity with AWS & redshift environment.
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts.
Desire to work in a fast-paced, highly ambiguous entrepreneurial culture.
Strong drive for results and ability to take calculate risks.
Ability to work in a diverse team
Are you interested? We look forward to receiving your application. Please submit your online application including your CV and covering letter in English.

We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation or any other assistance, please let the recruiting team know and they will support you with the necessary actions throughout the interview process.

As a Business Analyst you will provide accurate financial reporting in Spain & Portugal. You will manage and prepare month end management accounts and make accounting adjustments as required. You will integrate into each SBU leadership team and will become the main point of contact for all finance issues. Upon guidance from the GBFS Manager, and in partnership with EMEA SBU Analysts, produce annual budgets, control budget against actuals, and lead on the monthly forecasting processes. Work alongside the Market Director and Commercial Excellence Manager to improve business finance support to all SBUs within scope.


Key Responsibilities

1. Reporting
Collaborate in the monthly closing process and prepare the monthly reporting and interpret financial results against Profit Plan and Prior Year. Provide financial information in a form and content to drive business decisions
Drive initiatives to ensure financial reporting accuracy; Provide financial analysis to assess business investments
Implement standard reporting tools that will ensure an efficient analysis of performance; Support implementation of new IT tools or system as far as the financial aspects are concerned
Develop an ongoing approach of strong financial management working within the local teams. Understand business cost drivers in detail and collaborate with our BRNO Financial Center
Understand PPG Corporate reporting requirements and provide support to implement Corporate policies; ensure that accounting practices are aligned with PPG and SOX internal control requirements in a timely and correct manner; improve internal controls and internal processes
Help to build & maintain a well-adapted and controlled account reconciliation process with support of Brno (quarterly AA, monthly analysis, BS analysis etc); Perform quality check (audit) on balance sheet reconciliation.

2. Internal control & audit
Support interim, year-end US Gaaps & statutory audits as required, depending on annual scoping.
Support annual update of the AICC (PPG‚Äôs internal controls certification tool)

3. Other
Assist in implementation of projects and provide local support and drive cost reduction action plans
Supervise inventory monitoring, adjustments and annual physical inventory
Working with the credit organization with the scope to create further improvement in the main metrics focusing on underperforming areas


Qualifications
The position requires accounting experience, a strong finance background, a high degree of planning, analytical and interpersonal abilities.
Functional/Technical Skills & Knowledge:
University degree in Finance with validated accounting background
Proven track record in Finance reporting and controlling
Proficient expertise in IT tools (e.g. Oracle, Access, Word, Excel, Hyperion)
Outstanding analytical skills in order to produce financial analysis on business performance.
Adaptability to change and drive continuous performance and efficiency improvements.
Proficient in English language
Flexible - Outstanding communication - Extraordinary Teammate
Willing to travel (below 20%)

Job Description Summary

The role of the MES EDHR Senior Business Analyst within TGS Central teams is to serve as the person responsible for analyzing demand as well as the delivery of Technology & Global Services (TGS) solutions for the Manufacturing Execution System (MES) Electronic Device History Records (EDHR) area globally.

This role is responsible for driving and shaping demand, as well as ensuring the delivery of Technology & Global Services (TGS) solutions to manufacuturing enabling business adoption of the MES tools to digitize site manufacturing and quality processes to collect, store, analyze, and respond to, data recorded to ensure that products are being manufactured in accordance to our policies, procedures, and applicable regulations.

This individual will conduct analysis, prepare appropriate solution direction, and deliver the work. Above all, this individual will be required to collaborate with internal and external experts to ensure that business priorities are shaped, prioritized, and delivered. This is a great opportunity for someone to facilitate bringing the appropriate technology, process, and workplace solutions together to contribute to the manufacturing digitalization agenda for the Operations and Quality business functions.

This position reports directly to the Global Business Partner for MES.

Job Description

The objective of this role is to actively partner with the business Operations and Quality teams (including the business process networks) to understand their strategic priorities and work to identify ways that TGS can support and advance those objectives. Primary responsibilities will include:
Developing a deep knowledge of BD‚Äôs Production & MES environment, including key driver goals, short- and long-term roadmaps, key personnel, etc.
Establishing value-adding, strategic partner relationships for themselves and for the entire TGS function
Define the standard capabilities and solutions used to facilitate EDHR for manufacturing sites, ensuring BD‚Äôs MES design contains appropriate functionality to enable manufacturing sites to achieve the company‚Äôs manufacturing operations and digitalization objectives.
Partner with the SMEs in the Operations and Quality teams to plan new joint initiatives, evaluate proposals, and determine how they fit into roadmaps and priorities
Foster and maintain a network of MES EDHR process integrators across BD within plants and WW business units, including training, coaching and supporting associates implementing MES solutions.
Identify and define new opportunities to leverage technology and/or process re-design to advance business strategies that directly contribute to driving revenue growth, cost optimization and/or risk mitigation and compliance.
Develop strategies for optimal deployment and adoption of new technology capabilities, services and solutions across the business and/or the end-customers.
Work with other TGS Business Partners and TGS‚Äô Core Areas of Delivery to ensure that solutions are not siloed and that they are informed by, and are integrated with, BD‚Äôs enterprise roadmaps
Ensure projects and initiatives are delivered, providing consistent and effective communication on status and managing escalation and avoiding risk.
Build Knowledge and capability in MES technologies and processes in emerging technology, as well as improvements to existing investments, by keeping abreast of industry trends and Subject matter expertise in usage of new trends such as AI and ML in the context of Manufacturing and Industry 4.0 initiatives.
Support the business in the strategy and startup of their Manufacturing digitalization journey to facilitate EDHR and Manufacturing analytics capability.
Measure and communicate value realized on a periodic basis through defined and agreed upon metrics and supporting analysis.
Provide support for site manufacturing, quality and engineering related activities including master data, transaction processing, and data interface between MES and Control Systems working with worldwide and local engineering, operations, continuous improvement and plant IT teams.
Serve as a continuous connector. Energized by a role that is focused on partnership and facilitation. Operates through the lens of what can we do to simplify and improve things.
Working with our IT partners to coordinate MES functional support and resolution of critical tickets.
Understand and leverage the Idea to Realization (I2R) process for IT solution delivery including demand management, change control, project management, software validation and the whole System Development Lifecycle (SDLC).
Train, coach and support plant associates implementing the standard MES solutions, working with them to plan, schedule, and execute MES implementations and upgrades.
Work with IT and Security teams to ensure system implementations are compliant to latest standards and policies for secure industrial networked systems.
Understand sites use of SAP and other ERPs related to manufacturing, and integration with MES.
Identify opportunities to leverage technology to reduce the burden of manual entry of data.
Must be willing to travel in US and internationally.

Qualifications
Must be willing to travel up to one week per month (international & domestic)
The ideal candidate will bring a combination of strategic understanding, both business and technology experience, exceptional relationship building skills and solution-oriented mindset together. In addition, this person should also possess:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience.
Accomplished in multiple process and technology capabilities across the Manufacturing, and Quality functions, ideally in the Med device sector.
SAP Production Planning, Execution & Quality functional experience
Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) implementation and support experience required
Familiarity of Manufacturing Batch/Device History Records, ideally in the Med device sector.
Knowledge of FDA 21CFR Part 11, understanding of System Development Life Cycle and software validation procedures: IQ, OQ, PQ.
Passion for forward thinking digital transformation.
Ability to map joint organizational vision and long-term thinking, imagination, and idea generation
Ability to communicate complex business / technical challenges in a simplified manner
Must be a leader who can influence stakeholders in written and oral communications
Must have experience and knowledge of change management principles and methodologies and can formulate new programs to generate excitement and engagement
Familiarity with continuous improvement and project management approaches, tools, and phases
Exceptional ability to lead change using positive and collaborative methods
Highly collaborative work style which includes working effectively across all organizational levels
Experience working in a highly matrixed organization and in overcoming ambiguity
Leading by example, mentoring, and motivating others all around you
Superior analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities
Excellent judgment and decision-making
Able to align and work with diverse global stakeholders
Strong humility, listening, creativity, and negotiation skills
Accepts ownership
Ability/experience to work in a multinational, multicultural business environment

Other Desirable Skills/Experience
5+ years experience working in a highly automated manufacturing environment
Industrial networking and connectivity to PLCs for data acquisition, VLANs, Firewalls.
Programming skills in some of the following; Apriso Process Builder, SQL, JavaScript, Microsoft .Net, HTML & XML are a plus
Understanding of big data technologies, data analytics, automation, cloud computing.

About IT In Nestl√©

Nestl√© Business Excellence (NBE) was created in 2014 to lead a major transformation in the Nestl√© Group, which aimed at providing fuel for growth through the optimization of End to End (E2E) flows, the delivery of best in class business services and the support to demand focused organizations.

  GENERAL OBJECTIVE AND JOB ENVIROMENT 
Under the hierarchical supervision of the Head of ARHP, who at this time is also the Deputy Director of Operations, and under the functional supervision of the Head of Medico-legal Unit of the Intersectional Legal Department (ILD), the legal officer on the one hand is dedicated to providing direct legal support to operational teams on medical issues confronting teams on the ground. She/he may also be asked to support on Protection issues, particularly when involving patients, caretakers etc. The medical legal side of the role amount to half of the workload for this position.   
 The other half of the work load corresponds to work designated in line with his /her role as Humanitarian affairs advisor/analyst in the Centre for Applied Reflection on Humanitarian Practice. (ARHP). This work will essentially be to research, analyse, reflect and produce directly or indirectly potential avenues of action i.e positionings, lobbying or negotiation inputs, advocacy etc. He/She may do this work alone, with the field, cell or with other colleagues in the ARHP.  
 (S)he also works in a team with other legal advisors of the Intersectional Legal Department based in OCBA and in other OCs to ensure that OCBA and all sections receive uniform quality support.  
  MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES 
 Medico-legal issues 
√º Assists cells and field teams with the legal management of victims of violence and all patients‚Äô in conflict and non-conflict affected countries.  
√º Provides medical ‚Äì legal support to field teams regarding violence/proceedings against MSF structures and patients (security incidents, arrests, notification obligations, medical confidentiality, specific considerations concerning minors, legal proceedings etc.)  
√º Research on domestic legislation in relation with medical activities, esp. on consent, interruption of pregnancy, confidentiality and obligation to report.  
√º Draft of country summaries on the medical-legal framework 
√º Supports if required, the implementation of tools to improve the documentation of protection cases in line with OCBA protection policy 
√º Participates and follows up the implementation of archiving system (e.g. for SV medico legal certificates) and medical data protection 
√º Trains MSF teams on relevant medico-legal issues geared to active prevention and or support in case management.  
√º Participates and contributes to the intersectional working group on medico-legal issues.  
√º Could be requested to participate in the investigation after a critical event which would include(i) supervising the gathering of evidence, (ii) analysing the data, (iii) producing the report (establishing the facts, lessons learnt, identification of messages and advocacy plan) 
√º May be asked to support the IHL and Senior Humanitarian Affairs advisor/analyst.  
 Humanitarian Affairs advisor/analyst 
√º Under the direct management of the Head of the ARHP, this position will:  
√º Carry out deep level research on a range of themes and topics relevant to OCBA operations and the challenges, dilemmas and issues confronting the opening up and maintenance of medical- humanitarian space in conflict zones. 
√º Produce quality analysis and reflection on a wide range of operationally relevant themes and issues.  
√º Ability to support field, cells and Dir Ops on following of major to minor crises as they emerge and evolve. 
√º Scans contexts and context markers for anticipatory flagging of macro trends.  
√º Networks with a designated typology of actors to produce differential and nuanced analysis and reflection regarding humanitarian affairs, aid sector, things hitting aid sector etc.  
√º Works to be informed on contexts where OCBA has operations to be in a position to support field and to bring quality argumentation to in- team (ARHP) debates, in ops, in house sparring and discussions.  
√º Peer reviews team members work in order to boost quality and rigour of analyses and reflections produced.  
√º Can be asked to support cell based HAA on specific matters.  
√º Can be asked to support work loads on other ARHP members of Head of ARHP. 
√º This position will also contribute to Protection initiatives/cases when needed for people affected by violence 
    SELECTION CRITERIA  
 ¬∑     Education, skills and experience  
¬∑     Essential  
¬∑     Master degree in law, human rights or international relations.  
¬∑     Outstanding analytical and advisory skills  
¬∑     Ability to translate an operational negotiation into legal language and ability to explain legal concerns and their operational implications to field teams 
¬∑     Ability to analyse complex operational environments and synthesise the core elements into conclusions and recommendations for MSF operations. (analysis, reflection and subsequent outputs)  
¬∑     Good research and extraction skills. 
¬∑     Good with data understandings and interpretations. 
¬∑     Precise understanding of medical humanitarian work with regards to the management of patients & victims of violence.  
¬∑     Ability to understand medical data and epidemiological analysis  
¬∑     Excellent verbal and written communication skills ‚Äì must be a good writer particularly in English 
¬∑     Sufficient emotional intelligence and interpersonal skills to navigate complex organisational structures. 
¬∑     Computer proficiency 
¬∑     Minimum 3 years of professional experience including as legal advisor or in a legal unit 
¬∑     Field experience in MSF or other humanitarian organizations in the areas of protection of victims of violence in zones of armed conflict or other crisis situations.   
¬∑     Fluency in English and French (oral and written) 
¬∑     Knowledge of the practical workings of the humanitarian and wider aid system in acute and protracted conflict (including UN coordination structures, international NGOs, integrated peacekeeping missions, donors and the role of host governments)  
 Competences  
¬∑      Commitment to MSF‚Äôs principles  
¬∑      Cross-cultural awareness  
¬∑      Behavioural flexibility  
¬∑      Strategic vision  
¬∑      Results and quality orientation  
¬∑      Service orientation  
¬∑      Planning and organising  
¬∑      Initiative and innovation  
¬∑     Teamwork and cooperation  
¬∑     Leadership  
¬∑     Security awareness and management  
 CONDITIONS  
Position based in any MSF OCBA Hub (Barcelona, MSF-Spain office delegations, Buenos Aires, Amman, Dakar or Nairobi).
Full time position based in any MSF OCBA operational hub. 
Annual gross salary (divided in 12 monthly payments)+ secondary benefits based on MSF OCBA Reward Policy.
Start Date: Immediately  
  HOW TO APPLY
To apply, please, submit yourCV and cover letter.
  Closing date: March 14th , 2021, 23:59 CET (Central European Time).

We believe this approach enhances our work and we are committed to equity in employment. Position Summary

The Thycotic Team is looking for an experienced and highly motivated Senior Marketing Manager to lead our Marketing Strategy and vision in our core Emerging Markets. The region includes Southern Europe, Middle East, Eastern Europe and Africa.

The candidate will work closely with senior stakeholders across sales and channel functions to develop regional strategies and techniques and define successful go to market marketing strategy and achieve lead and opportunity creation goals and ensure improved and reliable conversion rates supporting the development of healthy and consistent sales pipeline.

The successful Senior Marketing Manager will have a management and team leadership experience in marketing and business operations in the region. This role requires strategic marketing skills combined with tactical approach, cross-team and organizational collaboration.

Reporting to the Senior International Marketing Director, the Senior Marketing Manager is responsible for defining, leading and executing the regional strategies, defining targets to meet revenue targets and understanding the market and sales challenges faced within focused geographies.

We are looking for a marketing professional with experience in demand generation, PR/AR, corporate, channel, and marketing communications for the IT industry. Resourceful, creative, and proactive with a proven ability to produce innovative and complex projects and programmes. An enthusiastic team player, able to lead and motivate teams to deliver results.

Identify and contact potential partners for new business opportunities
Coordinate with partners to create and execute business plans to meet sales goals

Drive joint planning with sales and channel leadership to define investment priorities across various segment teams
Develop and manage marketing budget, measuring and optimizing marketing programs to ensure activities are effective, efficient, and demonstrate ROI
Lead the team to build out and coordinate a calendar of content, campaigns, and other programs across marketing channels to deliver predictable lead generation and progression through funnel stages toward close
Localise existing campaigns and create new, local initiatives to increase revenue opportunities in the Emerging Markets
Lead and coordinate the channel marketing strategy and collaborate with focused distributors to enable partners and generate channel opportunities
Lead the PR and social strategy to increase the brand recognition in the region
Definite the regional events strategy and work with the events team to build presence at conferences and speaking events that will help drive leads and brand awareness
Partner with sales ops on marketing technologies, data infrastructure, and analytics, ensuring that all demand generation activities are underpinned with clear data and insights
Use tools like Salesforce, Pardot, Tableau to analyse lead flow while constantly exploring and testing new ways to drive more leads and more conversions
Reporting on lead generation and trial generation in the region
ROI and budgeting of marketing activities
Reporting on campaigns progress to Senior Marketing Director, International

Required Skills And Qualifications
7+ years marketing experience, including team management in high-growth technology companies
Solid marketing campaign management background within B2B, technology industry. Cybersecurity sector experience is a plus
Experience across marketing disciplines in Emerging Markets, particularly end user demand generation, digital and communications. Channel marketing experience is a plus
Strong ability to define local marketing strategy while also driving exceptional execution
Experience leading and working with a global marketing team
First-class presentation and communication skills, able to liaise effectively with customers, partners and colleagues at all levels

Ideally based in Madrid with a mix of office and remote work (other locations for consideration)

Sector: Internet Marketing y publicidad Medios de comunicaci√≥n en l√≠nea
Descripci√≥n:
Who We Are

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the worlds marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.

Overview

Building an advertising platform that accurately answers our client marketing objectives requires strong product managers and great software developers, but it also demands excellence from the commercial and operations teams. To best connect both worlds, Criteo can count on Product Solutions Strategists, Product Marketing Managers, Product Sales Specialists, and Product Experts whose common goals are to ensure that products are best brought to market, correspond to client expectations and that their revenue grows they work in close collaboration to achieve this jointly.

The Product Expertise team is, therefore, co-accountable for the customer success and growth of our products, with a particular mandate over the management of technical and analytical knowledge across our field operations teams as well as the collection of market feedback. As part of the Global Operations team, members build a relationship and have a direct line with product management and technical experts on the field, granting them great autonomy to influence the full cycle of a products life.

Every day, you will

Develop understanding and in-depth knowledge of the Criteos Web & Video product line, including technical inner workings of products, their business functionality and performance, their managed and self-service controls and best practices, and our product improvement strategy and roadmap.

Review the product line strategy, the product roadmaps and the R&Ds objectives and key results (OKRs),

Attend and participate in recurring discussions with Product Management, Product Analytics and other internal groups,

Assist Product Management in the writing of technical documentations in a way that is broadly digestible,

Dig into technical specifications and data models to get a complete understanding of the products underlying architecture.

Act as a product evangelist as well as a technical and analytical expert, providing support and opportunities to field engineering, field analytics, and advertising operations teams in order to converge toward the most successful use and extension of our Web products.

Provide documentations and training to build a product expertise on the field (i.e., in all our markets),

Prepare operations team with processes and tools to most appropriately setup products with clients,

Collect and answer technical and analytical questions in a way that contributes to maintaining a global expertise,

Fix or escalate technical issues that directly relate to your portfolio of products to maintain their performance,

Exchange and debate the need of new features that contribute to customer success and revenue,

Leverage your expertise to deliver actionable insights to the field and to build relevant reports and tools.

Become a trusted advisor to our product managers and product solutions strategists, best connecting our client marketing objectives with our services, increasing customer success and participating in the rollout, growth and maturity of products.

Challenge the roadmap to ensure that our products are performing and run smoothly without hiccups,

Provide relevant inputs into product improvements with business cases collected from field teams,

Help in the design of new features, test new development releases and provide immediate feedback,

Track product performance, both adoption rate and outcome for clients, and look for levers of improvements.

In exchange, youll enjoy...

Competitive compensation, because youre the best

Career advancement and global mobility opportunities

Medical and dental insurance to maintain your client-facing smile

Generous vacation policy (although who wants to leave Spain?)

Game and sports area when you need a break

Daily lunch vouchers to keep you going

As for our dream candidate

A thoughtful communicator who is excellent at communicating through a variety of channels that require both written and verbal skills,
Passionate about creative problem solving for customers and end users,
Self-motivated, eager to learn and thrive in a collaborative environment,

Capable of adapting quickly to changing priorities,

Familiar with customer and/or technical support by experience,
You are willing to grow your technical expertise. Proficiency in SQL, Tableau, Python is a plus.
Fluent in English.
At Criteo, we are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed.

Teleperformance is a worldwide leader in customer experience management and contact centre business process outsourcing. Our company employs around 300.000 people working in over 265 dialects and languages, in 80 countries, operating across all business sectors and all continents on behalf of major international companies.

At Teleperformance, we do business with people, for people. We want our employees to be inspired and motivated. Our main goal is to make them proud to belong to Teleperformance through job satisfaction and a great work environment.

Teleperformance Spain, with more than 4,700 employees in 10 sites (certified with Great Place to Work, AENOR and Top Employer), is currently looking for a Quality Analyst with native level of French, eager to develop his/her career with the worldwide leader in outsourced omnichannel customer experience management.

This role requires a professional with a keen eye for details who can work resourcefully and efficiently to assure quality of programs, software and systems.

Your Main Responsibilities Will Be
Performs call, secure email and chat reviews using established quality monitoring forms.
Reviews for compliance with policies and procedures, ensures staff are providing accurate information.
Reviews After Call Surveys.
Prepares quality reports and performance trends.
Provides management with daily and month end call management and department performance reports.
Works on a variety of assigned special projects.

Native level of French and fluent in English
Professional verbal and written communication skills
Ability to use procedures to make decisions and logic to identify needed exceptions

A permanent presence of coaches who will facilitate your personal and professional development

Puesto ofertado: Business Analyst, MES (Manufacturing Execution Systems) - OPEN TO LOCATION
Sector: Biotecnolog√≠a Servicios m√©dicos Investigaci√≥n
Descripci√≥n:
Job Description Summary

The role of the MES Business Analyst within TGS Central teams is to serve as the person responsible of understanding and influencing the provision of demands delivered with Technology & Global Services (TGS) solutions for the Manufacturing Execution System (MES) applications globally.

This role is responsible for ensuring that the delivery of Technology & Global Services (TGS) solutions to manufacuturing are consistently modelled and architected to enable the business adoption of the MES tools to digitize site manufacturing and quality processes to collect, store, analyze, and respond to, data recorded to enable continuous improvement and ensure that products are being manufactured in accordance to our policies, procedures, and applicable regulations.

The individual will conduct analysis, prepare appropriate solution direction, and liaise with the solution delivery teams to deliver the work. Above all, this individual will be required to collaborate with internal and external experts to ensure that solutions meet business objectives and align with TGS strategy. This is a great opportunity for someone to facilitate bringing the appropriate technology, process, and workplace solutions together to contribute to the manufacturing digitalization agenda for the Operations and Quality business functions.

This position reports directly to the Global Business Partner for MES.

Job Description

The objective of this role is to actively partner with the business Operations and Quality teams (including the business process networks) to understand their strategic priorities and work to identify ways that TGS can support and advance those objectives. Primary responsibilities will include:
Developing a deep knowledge of BD‚Äôs MES environment, including key driver goals, short- and long-term roadmaps, key personnel, etc.
Partner in the definition of the standard capabilities and solutions used to facilitate digitalization for manufacturing sites, ensuring BD‚Äôs MES design contains appropriate functionality to enable manufacturing sites to achieve the company‚Äôs manufacturing operations and digitalization objectives.
Partner with the SMEs in the Operations and Quality teams to plan new joint initiatives, assess proposals, and determine how they fit into roadmaps and priorities
Foster and maintain strong relations with the solution delivery organisation and our external partners.
Identify and define new opportunities to leverage technology and/or process re-design to advance business strategies that directly contribute to driving revenue growth, cost optimization and/or risk mitigation and compliance.
Develop strategies for optimal deployment and adoption of new technology capabilities, services and solutions across the business and/or the end-customers.
Manage and facilitate TGS‚Äô partner teams to ensure delivery provides the desired outcomes
Work with other TGS Business Partners and TGS‚Äô Core Areas of Delivery to ensure that solutions are not siloed and that they are informed by, and are integrated with, BD‚Äôs enterprise roadmaps
Ensure projects and initiatives are delivered, providing consistent and effective communication on status and managing escalation and avoiding risk.
Build Knowledge and capability in MES technologies and processes in emerging, as well as improvements to existing, investments by keeping abreast of industry trends and Subject matter expertise in usage of new trends such as AI and ML in the context of Manufacturing and Industry 4.0 initiatives.
Support the business in the strategy and startup of their Manufacturing digitalization journey and Manufacturing analytics capability.
Coordinate and support resolution of critical tickets

Qualifications & Experience

The ideal candidate will bring a combination of strategic understanding, both business and technology experience, exceptional relationship building skills and solution-oriented mindset together.

In Addition, This Person Should Also Possess
5+ years of working experience in a technology function
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in technology, engineering, business or a related field is strongly preferred. Educational certificate or training in a process methodology is a plus
Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) implementation and support experience
Knowledge of FDA 21CFR Part 11, understanding of System Development Life Cycle and software validation procedures: IQ, OQ, PQ.
Highly collaborative work style which includes working effectively across all organizational levels
Experience working in a highly matrixed organization and in overcoming ambiguity
Superior analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities
Able to align and work with diverse global stakeholders
Strong humility, listening, creativity, and negotiation skills
Accepts ownership
Ability/experience to work in a multinational, multicultural business environment
Industrial networking and connectivity to PLCs for data acquisition, VLANs, Firewalls.
Programming skills in some of the following; Apriso Process Builder, SQL, JavaScript, Microsoft .Net, HTML & XML
Understanding of databases and big data technologies, data analytics, automation, cloud computing.

Descripci√≥n:
At Domestika we‚Äôre looking for a Promotional Content Director.

We are looking for a highly experienced Promotional Content Director to manage our in-house creative content production team (designers, copywriters, video editors, etc.) and to help them produce high-quality content, specially designed for SEM, Paid Social and CRM, that promotes Domestika‚Äôs online courses and communication campaigns.

You will be in charge of developing creative assets based on a global brand strategy, measuring performance and ensuring world-class creative work in the most efficient manner possible. This is an essential role responsible for managing Domestika‚Äôs internal creative resources, and developing best-in-class production processes to support scaling for our promotional content studio globally and to meet marketing strategies and objectives in every channel: Paid, CRM, Social Media, Affiliates, etc.

Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as an online forum and a small yet dynamic showcase for creative professionals designed to help them connect and learn from each other.

Years later, sprouting from the seed of this core value, Domestika broadened its scope by designing and producing online courses for anyone who wanted to learn and improve professionally with top-notch instructors. The community has grown to more than 5 million members who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.

Today, Domestika produces online courses. We share editorial content for and with the best creative people in the world. We hold creative events where teachers, creative professionals, and students all have the chance to share experiences, ideas, and projects.

Responsibilities
Lead the overall development of our promotional content production.
Manage Domestika‚Äôs internal creative resources, and develop best-in-class production processes to support scaling for our promotional content studio globally.
Participate in strategic and tactical meetings to create promotional content that meets marketing strategies and objectives.
Responsible for hiring new team members.
Monitor content performance in order to identify insights to continually improve future project deliveries and execution.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Planning, CRM Managers, PAID Managers, Data Analyst) to plan, facilitate, and develop content Analytics projects.
Responsible for brand consistency across promotional content activity.
Mentor and coach a team while promoting a high-performance culture.
Manage and communicate project timelines, deliverable types, resourcing and budgeting needs.
Effectively manage operative and large-scale projects from brief through delivery.
Facilitate and manage alignment between project needs and other external departments.

Requirements
5+ years of experience in a Project Management, Studio Manager or Operations Manager role with an agency or in-house studio in the digital field. Preferably in e-commerce companies.
Experience in marketing content and video production for different markets.
Experience prioritizing, managing and tracking a high volume of creative projects simultaneously with the ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
Proven expertise creating content for SEO/SEM, paid social, CRM, affiliates and other direct response channels.
Demonstrated experience working in cross-cultural and international environments across time zones.
Able to work with project management, resource planning and digital asset management tools with experience building processes and systems for scaling.
Strong operational skills and ability to thrive in ambiguity at times.
Passionate about branded content creation and data.
Able to understand the brand value, tone, and language.
Highly proactive, organized, solutions-driven, digitally focused, a great team player.
Able to communicate clearly and passionately when leading a team.
Excellent people skills to cultivate a high-performance team.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to work both independently and with cross-functional teams.
Fluent in English.

It‚Äôs a Plus
Other languages (Spanish, Portuguese, French, Italian & German).
Experience in an e-commerce company.
What do we offer?
Work in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
A fast-moving environment in which you can hone your skills, learn alongside your colleagues, and grow professionally.
An honest salary based on your experience and profile.

Descripci√≥n:
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

We are a product centred company and all of our teams rely heavily on data to drive product development. By experimenting with features in different markets, testing hypotheses and UI/UX changes through A/B testing and tracking success metrics continuously, the Product Analytics team is strategic for the development cycle of our apps in Glovo.

As a Data Analyst in the Product team you will be responsible for using data to uncover usage and behavioral patterns and provide actionable insights that guide product development teams. We are looking for a product savvy analytics professional with the same passion that we have for using data as the main driver of product innovation and business growth.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Work closely with product managers and development teams to define, monitor and give visibility of product metrics and KPIs.
Design and analyze product experiments (A/B tests, multivariate test, etc) that will directly impact the backlog.
Translate product questions and hypothesis into analysis and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and dashboards.
Align with engineering teams to ensure data availability/quality of new features and data sources.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology and the business.


You Have
2-4 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role: product preferred
Background studies in Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics.
Good understanding of software development and agile methodologies.
Excellent SQL skills
Redshift experience is highly valued.
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledgeable and preferably experienced in designing and analysing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualisation tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview.
Ability to juggle multiple strands of work and priorities on complex projects.
Ability to communicate and present complex ideas to stakeholders and get buy-in thanks to ability to understand business needs.
Ability to build relationships with key stakeholders across the teams.
Excellent spoken and written English.


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Spanish lessons
Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment


What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.


If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. Descripci√≥n:
It's rewarding to work at a company where YOU make a difference! If you're passionate about the ever-changing IT industry and enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative progressive environment, you'll thrive at Tech Data! Join our team to connect the world with the power of technology!

eCommerce environment

Tech Data offers several eCommerce solutions to allow its customers to purchase manage and resell Software products and Cloud Services. These solutions include online configuration and ordering tools, but also an integrated solution (e-business). Tech Data sells over 1Billion USD software through these eCommerce solutions. Our latest releases include a marketplace for Cloud Services, a White Labelled eCommerce solution, and an API platform for both customers and vendors.

Job Purpose

The Cloud Systems & Services team is responsible to optimize the business processes required for these businesses. This includes offering shared services through Tech Data owned Shared Service Center outsourced to service partners in EMEA.

The Marketplace and Process Analyst will work on projects designed to improve quality, reduce errors and design new operational business processes. She /he will work with management, local sales teams, internal departments, platforms owners, IT teams, customers and vendors to gather and analyse information and make recommendations. An important role for this consultant will be to work closely with Tech Data Country sales teams to ensure appropriate service levels are provided to Super Users, End Users, and Customers. The consultant will also work closely with vendors to ensure appropriate understanding, documentation, and use of their platforms as applicable. Other project orientated duties may be assigned as needed.

The Process analyst can be called upon to design new processes, such as a new automated system for billing and procurement or a new support service for a new platform. She/he should be able to analyse existing processes to reduce errors and breakdowns and improve quality. Process analysts also work on quality improvement projects and document business processes.

Responsibilities :
Mapping of process flows across Operations teams, the collection, documentation and analysis of data, the identification of process gaps and support of process improvement initiatives to increase operational efficiencies.
Create process maps and document key business requirements needed to evaluate opportunities.
Create value stream maps to identify and highlight potential areas of improvement.
Coordinate and facilitate cross-functional / cross-organization meetings between stakeholders on various end-to-end business processes.
Conduct root cause analysis of process inefficiencies by examining material flow, scheduling, production capacity, constraints.
Document Operational ‚ÄúAs-is‚Äù processes and the desired ‚ÄúFuture State‚Äù processes.
Define SLAs and measure results.
Deploy new operational processes and escalate them as needed.
Maintain, manage and constantly improve central processes
Document all process accordingly: Ensure all necessary procedures and management processes are implemented to guarantee homogeneous and up-to-standard across locations within regional scope.
Ensure appropriate training and self‚Äìactualization of skills for all staff for new processes or with outsourced parties.
Manage constant communication with countries and other stakeholders around processes.
Ensure relationship with countries and other stakeholders under excellency metrics

Knowledge Skills And Experience

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.
Solid understanding of eCommerce
Experience with evaluating ROI is a plus but not mandatory.
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to work autonomously and independently
An out of the box thinking mentality
Exceptional customer service orientation.
Be proficient in the use of analytic tools such as data gathering and analysis, spreadsheets, flow-charting and process diagramming.
Comfortable working in an international result driven project organisation.
Project Experience of Software Licensing, Support, or Customer Service functions definite advantage. Understanding of the IT Software / Services / SaaS industry are helpful
Technical Know-how / understanding on Tech Data tools such as: SAP, MS office products, hardware, and operating systems as well as knowledge of programming languages, diagnostic utilities, monitoring tools, etc is a plus.
IT Channel experience, Pan European distributors or Software vendor are a definite advantage
Significant experience working with large multinational accounts
Exceptional written and oral communication and presentation skills in English language, additional European languages being a plus.
Intercultural experience is a plus
Excel advance knowledge considered a plus but not mandatory
Working Conditions :
Occasionally travel within Europe.
Normal, professional office environment

Description

Junior Data Analyst
We are hiring for several shifts: Monday to Friday morning and Monday to Friday afternoon.

Are you passionate about leveraging data to deliver actionable insight that impacts daily business decision of Amazon in a promising new market segment?
Does the prospect of dealing with massive volume of data excite you?
Amazon is seeking a Transportation Performance Analyst to join Amazon's European Special Handling (EU SH) team. EU SH team is responsible for the end-to-end Heavy/Bulky journey in the fulfilment, supply chain and transportation daily business and its strategic vision in Europe.
Amazon has culture of data-driven decision-making, and demands business intelligence that is timely, accurate, and actionable. During our day to day operations, tons of data is generated which is leveraged to take our important business decisions.
Our ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, relishes working with large transactional volumes and big data, enjoys the challenge of highly complex business contexts (that are typically being defined in real-time), and, above all else, is passionate about data and analytics.
As an Analyst you will be developing SQL/ETL queries, accessing data warehouse and redshift clusters, creating automated reports through macros, creating relevant KPIs and metrics for performance of team as well as for transportation operations. Publish daily/weekly performance reports. You will give us business insights based upon data to further improve our operations and processes.

A successful candidate knows and loves working with business intelligence tools, is comfortable accessing and working with big data from multiple sources, and passionately partners with the business to identify strategic opportunities and deliver results.

You should have an internal drive to answer ‚Äúwhy?‚Äù questions, excellent analytical abilities and strong technical skills.

Create metrics, performance dashboards and reports
Drive root cause analysis
Engage with cross-functional teams and/or carriers/vendors for implementation of project/program requirements
Managing multiple projects/initiatives
Communication at all levels with the ability to present information professionally & concisely with supporting data
Basic Qualifications
VBA, SQL or other coding experience to support automation initiatives
Working experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Quicksight.

Who We Are

Vistaprint‚Äôs CFO Organization empowers teams to focus on their domain and serve customers. Clear guardrails pave the way for strong engagement and efficiency in our lines of business, regional operations and central functions. Team members work cross-functionally, impacting every area of the company - from human resources, communications and real estate to finance, controllership and legal services. The CFO team makes critical capabilities accessible, delivering services and information that every employee needs to succeed in their role.

Positioning ourselves centrally and globally, we offer opportunities to scale processes and ideas, facilitate feedback loops across Vistaprint‚Äôs organizations and build a team of world-class talent, with specialized skill sets.

We are growing our team in Barcelona, Spain. We are seeking a highly motivated and driven Senior Data Analyst. This newly crafted position, working with the Global Finance Data Lead, will be assisting and supporting the Finance team with coordination of the strategic business planning process, reporting, consolidation in business performance and analytics globally. This is a key role within Vistaprint that will help craft the future of the business and the overall finance organization.

As a Senior DA, you will be focused on enabling data driven decision making through the development of analytical tools and conducting ad-hoc analysis to formulate hypotheses and recommendations. You will work within the Global Finance Data team, but also specifically as part of the Finance organization. This structure offers the support and access to the analytical resources, tools and techniques that both Finance and Analytics provide.

What You Will Do
Drive the budget, forecast, and financial reporting for Vistaprint Business Lines.
Collaborate in a fast paced, agile environment that focuses on delivering value to our customers early and often
Immersed within the Finance data you will turn business questions into functional analysis and lead exploratory analyses to uncover insights and find opportunities to improve key metrics and optimize revenue and profit
Design, execute, analyze and report out on sophisticated analytics models as well as partner with other analytics leads to advise the development, maintenance, and improvement of tools for analyzing and executing tests
Build and maintain standardized reports and dashboards across multiple platforms and data sets to provide accurate data and insight for teams on an ongoing basis
Build and package management reports; analyzing and interpreting data and historical trends. Reporting on and delving into findings as needed

Your Qualifications
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or related field, along with shown experience and skills in data analytics using SQL in a multi-channel e-commerce environment
A passion and strong orientation for data and technology. You are comfortable with exploratory analysis, statistical techniques, with curiosity and adaptability complemented by a results-oriented personality to drive insights
Experience in data analysis (Cohort Analysis, Recency, Frequency, Price Volume Mix), and with the following tools: Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Web Analytic tools (i.e., Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Adobe Site Catalyst or Core-Metrics) desired
Proficient in SQL (Python and/or R is a plus), and in data visualization in Tableau or Looker is also a plus
Proven experience translating business objectives into quantitative insights and implementing tracking into scalable reporting.
Strong communication to enable delivery of technical concepts to non-technical business partners, and collaboration skills, giving and receiving feedback, ability to work in cross functional teams, shared ownership of projects.
Excellent organizational skills, good attention to detail, and the ability to effectively run and prioritize multiple concurrent tasks and initiatives
Ability to think outside the box, think creatively about approaching analytical questions

Why You‚Äôll Love Working Here

At Vistaprint, we put excellent importance into the wellbeing of our employees, which is why we offer perks that ensure an extraordinary work/life balance. Perks include work from home capabilities and very flexible time-off opportunities.

About Us

As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vistaprint is a dynamic organization that maintains an exciting, results-oriented culture. Empowering and helping small businesses is our core focus, with an emphasis on crafting customer value (and delight) through accessible, ground breaking technology. We grow with providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation and growth - for both our customers and our team.

Job Purpose

The Cloud Systems & Services team is responsible to optimize the processes required for these businesses. This includes offering shared services through Tech Data owned Shared Service Center outsourced to service partners in EMEA.

An important role for this Analyst will work on projects to design and implement a scalable central operational processes and monitoring service aligned to Tech Data‚Äôs Cloud support services offerings as well as interacting with applicable Services providers. The Analyst will identify specific customer requirements and ensure that our IT Service Providers are able to fulfill these requirements based upon an appropriate service catalogue. The Analyst will participate on projects, briefings and progress updates. The analyst will collaborate with Tech Data's selling Business Units to develop the right sales strategies and to assist in launch of products/services/programs/campaigns across EMEA. Other project orientated duties may be assigned as needed.

The team is also responsible to roll-out Cloud solutions and Services to all Tech Data entities in Europe (21 countries +). The team will collaborate with all of Tech Data's Business Unit leaders and their key partners, to develop the right strategies, and strive to deliver best in class systems with maximum impact and synergy across Europe.
