Puesto ofertado: Senior Business Analyst, MES (Manufacturing Execution Systems) - OPEN TO LOCATION
Sector: Biotecnolog√≠a Servicios m√©dicos Investigaci√≥n
Descripci√≥n:
Job Description Summary

The role of the MES EDHR Senior Business Analyst within TGS Central teams is to serve as the person responsible for analyzing demand as well as the delivery of Technology & Global Services (TGS) solutions for the Manufacturing Execution System (MES) Electronic Device History Records (EDHR) area globally.

This role is responsible for driving and shaping demand, as well as ensuring the delivery of Technology & Global Services (TGS) solutions to manufacuturing enabling business adoption of the MES tools to digitize site manufacturing and quality processes to collect, store, analyze, and respond to, data recorded to ensure that products are being manufactured in accordance to our policies, procedures, and applicable regulations.

This individual will conduct analysis, prepare appropriate solution direction, and deliver the work. Above all, this individual will be required to collaborate with internal and external experts to ensure that business priorities are shaped, prioritized, and delivered. This is a great opportunity for someone to facilitate bringing the appropriate technology, process, and workplace solutions together to contribute to the manufacturing digitalization agenda for the Operations and Quality business functions.

This position reports directly to the Global Business Partner for MES.

Job Description

The objective of this role is to actively partner with the business Operations and Quality teams (including the business process networks) to understand their strategic priorities and work to identify ways that TGS can support and advance those objectives. Primary responsibilities will include:
Developing a deep knowledge of BD‚Äôs Production & MES environment, including key driver goals, short- and long-term roadmaps, key personnel, etc.
Establishing value-adding, strategic partner relationships for themselves and for the entire TGS function
Define the standard capabilities and solutions used to facilitate EDHR for manufacturing sites, ensuring BD‚Äôs MES design contains appropriate functionality to enable manufacturing sites to achieve the company‚Äôs manufacturing operations and digitalization objectives.
Partner with the SMEs in the Operations and Quality teams to plan new joint initiatives, evaluate proposals, and determine how they fit into roadmaps and priorities
Foster and maintain a network of MES EDHR process integrators across BD within plants and WW business units, including training, coaching and supporting associates implementing MES solutions.
Identify and define new opportunities to leverage technology and/or process re-design to advance business strategies that directly contribute to driving revenue growth, cost optimization and/or risk mitigation and compliance.
Develop strategies for optimal deployment and adoption of new technology capabilities, services and solutions across the business and/or the end-customers.
Work with other TGS Business Partners and TGS‚Äô Core Areas of Delivery to ensure that solutions are not siloed and that they are informed by, and are integrated with, BD‚Äôs enterprise roadmaps
Ensure projects and initiatives are delivered, providing consistent and effective communication on status and managing escalation and avoiding risk.
Build Knowledge and capability in MES technologies and processes in emerging technology, as well as improvements to existing investments, by keeping abreast of industry trends and Subject matter expertise in usage of new trends such as AI and ML in the context of Manufacturing and Industry 4.0 initiatives.
Support the business in the strategy and startup of their Manufacturing digitalization journey to facilitate EDHR and Manufacturing analytics capability.
Measure and communicate value realized on a periodic basis through defined and agreed upon metrics and supporting analysis.
Provide support for site manufacturing, quality and engineering related activities including master data, transaction processing, and data interface between MES and Control Systems working with worldwide and local engineering, operations, continuous improvement and plant IT teams.
Serve as a continuous connector. Energized by a role that is focused on partnership and facilitation. Operates through the lens of what can we do to simplify and improve things.
Working with our IT partners to coordinate MES functional support and resolution of critical tickets.
Understand and leverage the Idea to Realization (I2R) process for IT solution delivery including demand management, change control, project management, software validation and the whole System Development Lifecycle (SDLC).
Train, coach and support plant associates implementing the standard MES solutions, working with them to plan, schedule, and execute MES implementations and upgrades.
Work with IT and Security teams to ensure system implementations are compliant to latest standards and policies for secure industrial networked systems.
Understand sites use of SAP and other ERPs related to manufacturing, and integration with MES.
Identify opportunities to leverage technology to reduce the burden of manual entry of data.
Must be willing to travel in US and internationally.

Qualifications
Must be willing to travel up to one week per month (international & domestic)
The ideal candidate will bring a combination of strategic understanding, both business and technology experience, exceptional relationship building skills and solution-oriented mindset together. In addition, this person should also possess:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience.
Accomplished in multiple process and technology capabilities across the Manufacturing, and Quality functions, ideally in the Med device sector.
SAP Production Planning, Execution & Quality functional experience
Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) implementation and support experience required
Familiarity of Manufacturing Batch/Device History Records, ideally in the Med device sector.
Knowledge of FDA 21CFR Part 11, understanding of System Development Life Cycle and software validation procedures: IQ, OQ, PQ.
Passion for forward thinking digital transformation.
Ability to map joint organizational vision and long-term thinking, imagination, and idea generation
Ability to communicate complex business / technical challenges in a simplified manner
Must be a leader who can influence stakeholders in written and oral communications
Must have experience and knowledge of change management principles and methodologies and can formulate new programs to generate excitement and engagement
Familiarity with continuous improvement and project management approaches, tools, and phases
Exceptional ability to lead change using positive and collaborative methods
Highly collaborative work style which includes working effectively across all organizational levels
Experience working in a highly matrixed organization and in overcoming ambiguity
Leading by example, mentoring, and motivating others all around you
Superior analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities
Excellent judgment and decision-making
Able to align and work with diverse global stakeholders
Strong humility, listening, creativity, and negotiation skills
Accepts ownership
Ability/experience to work in a multinational, multicultural business environment

About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo is looking for a world-class Business Analyst for Glovo‚Äôs Partner Operations team. Are you able to translate data into actionable insights? Are you looking for a challenging experience in the fastest growing startups of Barcelona - helping build a product that will disrupt the on-demand market? If your answer is YES we are looking forward to meeting you.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Understand business needs and provides data led insights to enable decision making process for the Project Management team
Act as an internal consultant to translate business questions into insights
Identify opportunities to improve dashboards, tools and data handling processes to improve productivity
Lead high priority program of reporting and insights for Partners
Liaise with the product and central BI team - you will play a central, pivotal role in building reliable sources for data and insights
Propose strategic changes to the way we track, maintain and use data


You Have
2-3 years of work experience as a business analyst
High Excel and SQL proficiency. Experience with Python/R is a plus
Demonstrated project management skills
Problem-solving attitude and ability to prioritize effectively with solid backing of data
Great communication skills and ability to influence different stakeholders
Fluency in English. Spanish is a plus but not mandatory


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food

Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment


What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of 2020, we‚Äôre currently present in more than 22 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

Be the engine that powers Accenture, a $30 billion company that provides consulting and outsourcing services to more than 40 industries--including 89 of the FORTUNE 100, and governments around the world. Our Corporate Functions people offer the essential expertise that enables our more than 336,000 employees to deliver high performance to our clients. Whether you work directly with clients or manage important internal initiatives and efforts, you‚Äôll find amazing opportunities to make a measurable difference. Build a career at a company that can take you anywhere‚Äîjoin the Accenture Adventure.

Human Resources professionals develop and execute HR strategies, programs and services across one or more parts of the employee lifecycle to attract, develop and retain a highly engaged and differentiated workforce that enables the execution of human capital and business strategies.


Job Description


A professional at this position level within Accenture will be first point of contact for employees and teams in terms of Talent.

Key Responsibilities

Overall

You will work with the HR Business Partner and Talent Strategy team to help implement innovative solutions to address work priorities and to contribute to a positive work environment through the implementation of people/talent programs and initiatives.

Adapt local and global HR programs to the needs of each entity at the same time to make known the global programs for the adaptation to the needs of geography in a joint way.

Help organize specific training & development initiatives, identifying actions and programs needed for employee‚Äôs development. Sometimes, participate in the design of contents.

Offer feedback to HRBP`s and to Talent Strategy, about the implementation of any talent program.

Your role includes some ra ll of the following key responsibilities. You should review these in conjunction with career level guidelines to gain a clear understanding of the expectations for your role.

Career Level Expectations

Complexity

Interaction with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors or direct supervisors. Interaction with other internal areas and/or Accenture management.

Authority

Requires medium instruction on daily work tasks and a moderate level of instruction on new assignments. You will be able to perform your talks with enough autonomy and self-confidence, obtaining support and feedback from the HR business partner.

Impact or Decision Impact

Decisions impact own work and may impact the work of others

Scope

Individual contributor and/or oversees a small work effort and/or team


Qualifications & Professional Skill Requirements

Experience in Human Resources (at least 3 years of experience)

Good communication level

Ability to organize and prioritize tasks

Understand strategic direction

Interact with peers and management levels within Accenture.

Talent Management

Able to work in both written and spoken Spanish & English.

Full-time availability

Location in Madrid preferably

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. Get To Know Our Team

The Supply Optimization and Commercialization (SOCs) team sits within the Product Supply team at Agoda Bangkok. We work closely with the sales department (Partner Services) to identify and optimize growth opportunities on accommodations supply for the company and to set up experiments to measure and implement changes. The projects SOCs team works on directly impact Agoda‚Äôs bottom line and have long lasting structural impact to the business. We cover a range of topics including organizational efficiency, sales and product optimization, go to market strategies as well innovation and products. We collaborate with multiple departments and produce highly visible results backed up by experimentation and data. Utilizing powerful tools and possessing an end-to-end view of how Agoda works, the SOCs offers a team of learning and experience that will push you (and Agoda) into new territory.

The Opportunity

The SOCs Analytics team is a sub-team within the SOCs team and serve as subject matter experts on analytics, automation, business intelligence, data, and experimentation. We work closely with the other business, product, and analytics teams to develop and build analytical products, systems and automated processes, as well as drive analytical projects to improve organisational performance and drive revenue growth for the company.

Use and analyse data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and understand data flows across the entire organisation
Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at developing conceptual and data-modelled frameworks to optimise business performance on the Supply-side
Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organisational efficiency


What You‚Äôll Need To Succeed
A hacker‚Äôs mindset ‚Äì the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics or Mathematics
A strong understanding of statistics and the underlying mathematics behind Machine Learning/ Deep Learning techniques
A basic understanding of computer science and data, and the ability to implement this understanding in complex business situations


It‚Äôs Great If You Have
Experience with complex analytics and statistical/machine learning techniques using R/Python/Spark
Master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Operations Research, or Data Science

Descripci√≥n:
Description
EU COUNTRY LOCATION FLEXIBLE***
Amazon is a company of builders. A philosophy of ownership carries through everything we do ‚Äî from the proprietary technologies we create to the new businesses we launch and grow. You‚Äôll find it in every team across our company; from providing Earth‚Äôs biggest selection of products to developing ground-breaking software and devices that change entire industries, Amazon embraces invention and progressive thinking. Amazon is continually evolving; it‚Äôs a place where motivated employees thrive, and ownership and accountability lead to meaningful results. It‚Äôs as simple as this: we pioneer.

Driving all of our businesses are talented employees who are strong owners, have the highest standards, and obsess over our customers. If your technical expertise are data and people then this is the role for you! In this role you will build, manage and scale the reporting and forecasting capabilities of the EU ATS HR team for them to engage, develop and delight employees across 5 EU countries. The role will influence the HR and Operations leadership by helping filter the signals from the noise ‚Äì insights rather than just data. As a data analyst you will build reports, compile metrics, own ad hoc analysis, and work with HR teams to communicate insights to key stakeholders. You will not only execute on the required skills but also be able to influence, educate, and drive results in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment

Key Responsibilities Include
Build, maintain and automate recurring metrics and reports using SQL, Excel and/or other scripting languages. Build insightful visualizations using Tableau, QuickSight etc.
Complete ad hoc data retrieval and analysis using relational databases, Excel and other data management systems.
Monitor existing metrics, develop and propose new metrics, and identify new, actionable risk signals.
Design and implement reporting solutions enabling stakeholders to manage the business and make effective decisions.
Support cross-functional teams on the day-to-day execution of projects and initiatives.
Help gather requirements and specifications with business and development teams.

Basic Qualifications

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

Do you want to be a part of a fast-paced company? We are looking for a Business Data Analyst, this is a great opportunity for you!

At Packlink, we aim to be the fastest-growing global provider of shipping services and technology.

We're building the ideal shipping platform for private customers and businesses. Shipping is a complex endeavor and small to midsize companies need to be able to easily handle the shipping needs of their day-to-day work. With our technology, SMBs can improve their shipping experience and deliver a premium service to their customers.

Operating in more than 10 countries, our passion for getting shipping right means we support our customers every step of the way, making shipping simple and transparent.

Our employees work on interdisciplinary teams with clearly defined responsibilities that maximise individual talents to further common goals.

Is it the right fit?

This time we are looking for a talented, highly motivated and data-driven Pricing Data Analyst to join our Pricing Team.

As a Collaborative Team Player You Will Be

Delivering on our budget targets. In the Pricing team our main KPIs and daily obsessions are Revenue and Gross Profit. You will analyse performance, define optimisation measures and implement them through A/B tests. New tools: we have ambitious plans to revamp our Pricing tool and to develop state-of-the-art dynamic Pricing capabilities. You will contribute to the definition of those new tools and use them once developed by our Pricing tech team. Benchmark: we are setting up an automated price benchmark and need to develop an analytical framework around this data. Revenue diversification: you will contribute to revenue diversification initiatives (e.g. Insurance). What we're looking for? An appetite for solving Business problems with data. 3-5 years of experience as a Business Analyst (preferably in Pricing / Revenue management). An entrepreneurial spirit (the team is just starting and there is an exciting challenge ahead!). Some knowledge of SQL / BigQuery. Professional proficiency in English. A very strong Analytical mind. What we offer ?? Competitive salary package: The salary range for this position is 35.000-40.000 + Bonus.

About Accenture

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services at scale in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all off these services.

We combine unmatched experience and specialized capabilities across more than 40 industries ‚Äì powered by the world‚Äôs largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers.

With 513,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture brings continuous innovation to help clients improve their performance and create lasting value across their enterprises.

Working closely with clients our Strategy & Consulting professionals help transform the world‚Äôs leading organizations, working across the C-suite to capitalize on disruption, enable competitiveness, and drive growth and profitability via continuous innovation.

About Supply Chain And Operations Applied Intelligence

Part of Accenture Strategy and Consulting, we help our clients grow their business in entirely new ways. Artificial Intelligence and Analytics enable our clients to achieve high performance through insights from data - insights that inform better decisions and strengthen customer relationships.

The Barcelona Innovation Center has been at the forefront in helping clients from around the globe and across industries under the umbrella of intelligent operations for the last 15 years. We develop cutting-edge assets and solutions to reduce costs and improve supply chain processes, such as optimization of stock levels, demand planning and forecasting, automated warranty solutions, and predictive asset maintenance.

Our team is composed of over 90 data scientists and Data Engineers with specialized background in Supply Chain & Operations, 20% of which are PhD‚Äôs in the areas of Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or Statistics. All that knowledge, combined with Accenture‚Äôs business experience, fosters an environment that allows us to quickly react to changing business conditions and provide tailored solution for our client‚Äôs needs.

Data Engineer role

Introduction

You will have the opportunity of being part of the Data Analyst group, working for our top clients in the evolution of their core systems and the implementation of new digital architectures. As part of the group, you will be trained on new Data architecture, and you can take part of certification processes for those technologies.

Your role

To grow up your skills working on challenging and innovative solutions

Working in new technologies with demanding clients and growing your expertise
Working in highly skilled teams advising and supporting our clients through the data and technology revolution

Working in partnership with global clients and large public/private sector organizations

Work with client teams to design and implement modern, scalable data solutions using a range of new and emerging technologies.

A drive to keep up with new and/or up and coming data technologies, especially open-source frameworks

Key Responsibilities

Design and implement the data architecture for our clients based on new data technologies.

Design the integration with legacy data sources.

Define the standards and best practices to develop applications using new architectures.

Using good communication skills to understand and deliver client requirements.

Bring your experience and ideas to innovative engineering, design and strategy.

Contribute to our internal networks and special interest groups.

Recommend ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality

Collaborate with data architects, modelers and IT team members on project goals

Build high-performance algorithms, prototypes, and proof of concepts

Skills You Will Need

Programming in tools like R, PYTHON, C++, JavaScript, C#, Java, PHP.

SQL-based technologies, e.g. PostgreSQL and MySQL

NoSQL technologies, e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB

Other database tools, e.g. SCADA

Knowledge in Bid Data Frameworks, e.g. Hadoop (Especially HBase, Spark, MapReduce, Hive, HDFS

Knowledge of the ELK stack (exposure preferred)

Unix and Unix-like systems

Knowledge of cloud-based solutions, e.g. AWS, Azure, Google Cloud

Data modeling tools, e.g. ERWin, Enterprise Architect, and Visio

Knowledge in Data Base tools like Redshift (AWD), Casandra DB, Mongo DB, SQL Database, Hadoop, SCADA.

Data Ingestion/transformation tools like Alteryx, Talend, SQL, J2EE, Big Query

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenabling our customers to experience the world.

Get To Know Our Team

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

The Opportunity

As a Manager/Senior Manager, CRM you will be at the forefront of Agoda‚Äôs communication and engagement efforts. You will lead a team of 2 and own, plan and deliver large scale campaigns reaching millions of Customers, analyzing and leveraging rich datasets to build new innovative products and flows.

And on top of that you will be working with some of the smartest people in the industry not just in Marketing but also in Product, IT, Partner Services, etc.

This Role Is Good For You If You
Value independence and ownership: you will get goals and projects, not tasks
Have the ambition to make a difference: innovation and drive are necessary to succeed
Want to be a great coach: your contribution scales when you teach others
Are ready to challenge anything: data matter, not opinions, seniority or common knowledge


In This Role, You‚Äôll Get To
Lead: you will work together with 2 Analyst/Campaign managers who will help you manage and execute on new ideas and projects, many of which cross-functional and that will require you to be the representative for Customer Marketing there.
Analyze: new ideas come from data and tests. Segment the userbase, understand their patterns, react to change in demand and identify new opportunities to deliver value.
Test: prove your findings by A/B testing changes to any of our communication products. Define your hypothesis, design the framework, launch the campaign, collect and analyze the results of large scale, quick delivery tests.
Innovate: Learn and develop new features, develop models we can use for optimization, build business cases for completely new implementations, and help us push the boundaries a little further every day.


What You‚Äôll Need To Succeed
4+ years of Digital Marketing, Consulting or Strategy/Business Operations experience
Ability to communicate fluently in English
At least a basic understanding of SQL
Good numerical reasoning skills
Intellectual curiosity


It‚Äôs Great If You Have
At least 1-2 years of people management experience
Experience in the Travel space and/or in a CRM function
Master‚Äôs Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative or marketing subject (statistics, engineering, digital marketing, financial modelling, etc.)

Job Purpose:
To support the IPP Analyst team in maintaining and strengthening trading relationships with all relevant vendors and with Product Marketing to obtain competitive advantage for Tech Data via professional inventory planning and procurement.
Responsibilities:
Placing orders based on profiles produced by the IPP Analyst team taking into account any logistics efficiency requirements (i.e. pallet, layer, carton etc.).
Back to back ordering of products with no established run rate.
Place direct ship purchase orders on vendors. To check order confirmations for correct product, quantity, pricing and delivery dates and to invoice customers on receipt of proof of shipment or delivery.
Ensure that all purchase orders raised are within authorised and agreed sign off limits.
Check vendor order confirmations for correct product, quantity, pricing and delivery dates, and updating system (SAP) accordingly.
Expedite all open orders to maximise customer satisfaction and take responsibility for highest degree of due date accuracy in SAP. Supporting texts to be added if necessary for POD (proof of delivery) requests and queries.
To assist the IPP Analyst team with vendor price changes by ensuring correct cost prices are reflected within SAP.
Stock Rotation: a) request authorisation reference from the vendor for either contractual or negotiated terms within prescribed timescales b) once reference obtained, raise Return to Vendor quotation order and record on central database c) validate all stock is returned to vendor in accordance with RMA.
Support IPP Analyst team in resolution of Logistics (primarily Goods In) and Finance queries within prescribed timescales.
To work within set policies and procedures and to continually review and update where necessary.
To own and manage through until completion, any ad hoc projects as defined by IPP Management.
Provide high level of service, support and accuracy to the IPP team
To consistently achieve set targets
Represent Tech Data at all times in an efficient and professional manner
Deliver maximum stock availability, minimise customer backlog and inventory depreciation costs, whilst maintaining stock levels in line with our key performance indicators.
Provide a first class and high availability stock profile (best in Group/IT distribution) with justified commercial risk and cost.
Knowledge Skills and Experience
Effective communication with internal & external partners
Must be proactive and self-motivated
Strong attention to detail
Ability to organise and prioritise daily routine to support a rapidly changing environment
Solid working knowledge of current IT technologies
Good working knowledge of MS Office tools (Outlook, Excel, Word) and inventory replenishment systems (SAP R3) would be advantageous.
Commercial and financial acumen - to balance inventory value and recovery margin.
Good analytical skills - to analyse data and take appropriate action.
Must have a focused, pro-active and committed attitude - to set and achieve action plans.
Sound knowledge of basic purchasing and inventory principles and practices.

Descripci√≥n:
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

We are looking for a creative problem solver to join our Barcelona HQ. Working in the Global Supply Excellence team you will be focused on improving courier quality and behaviours. You will be the one to deep dive into the operational issues and processes, understand the root causes and come up with solutions to help couriers get the most out of the platform, while delivering the best customer and partner experience. Your responsibilities will also include finding scalable approaches to automate tasks, in a way that they can remain adaptable to local needs and practices, while minimising manual work. This role will require an ability to think outside of the box when normal methods don‚Äôt work to complete a task. The knowledge and previous experience working with automation and programming languages such as Python, SQL, JavaScript are highly desirable.

The Global Supply Excellence team is at the center of working with regional and local operations and Glovo product teams, which will give you a chance to learn a lot about various aspects of Glovo business and make a difference. We are looking for curiosity and desire to continuously improve our platform.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Deep dive into Glovo operational metrics and processes to understand behavioural patterns of the couriers and the areas for improvement
Build the operational tools and design processes from scratch
Run A/B tests fast and smartly to get new insights
Be in touch with our Data/Tech team to request and implement new product features
Make good use of internal data to build dashboards that measure and track the impact of your actions
Roll out the tools you build to different markets, adapting them to local need


You Have
Background studies in Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics
2-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role: operations preferred
Excellent SQL skills
Redshift experience is highly valued.
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledgeable and preferably experienced in designing and analysing experiments (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualisation tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview.
Strong analytical knowledge and experience with reporting, driving insights, and data-driven optimisation
You are able to act as an owner / lead for large scale and complex data analysis projects that impact global, strategic business roadmaps & operations
Hands-on: you are willing to get your hands dirty and are looking to bring your ideas to life and find a way to get things done
You have an amazing attention to detail and a great appetite to learn
You have strong organisational skills, ability to prioritise and multitask, work well under pressure, handle multiple issues simultaneously in a dynamic environment
Good communication skills: you are able to manage various stakeholders and know how to structure the information
Strong drive for continuous improvement
Proficiency in English


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment


What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of 2020, we‚Äôre currently present in more than 22 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://jobs.glovoapp.com/en/careers

As part of the group, you will be trained on new Data, and you can take part of certification processes for those technologies.

Your Goals

Your objective would be to re-imagine the future of the industry, and the next generation of predictive process control

Your role will require the extraction, wrangling and enrichment of data from one or multiple sources, online or offline

Develop innovative thought leadership and contribute to the creation of points of view on re-usable models in Supply Chain.

Key Responsibilities

Responsible for the development of predictive models and the generation of data-driven insights to solve industrial problems or challenges.

You‚Äôll be responsible for development, training and validation of mentioned models, and the visualization of the data and model results through dynamic dashboards.

Manage and manipulate data sets, including: variables definition, performing calculations and summarizations, and creating solutions to address client business needs.

Outline and structure the project tasks and best approach, along with team senior members, from the detailed understanding of client‚Äôs problem statement and their specific business requirements.

Description

Work schedule will be Mon-Sun 5 days per week in 8-hour rotating Morning-Afternoon.

Do you want to learn how the most complex transportation network is managed on a daily basis?

Amazons business is focused on delighting our customers. We strive to stay agile from the second an order is placed online and throughout the seamless coordination of that order behind the scenes. You will‚Ä¶
As a logistics scheduler within the Central Operations team your role will focus on forecasting, scheduling and routing, playing a key role in our delivery stations operations. You will be responsible for executing daily forecasts, labour scheduling and routing, affecting tens of thousands of packages. This will be done through the use of tools and coordination within the station, you will be accountable for cost, customer experience, and delivery partner experience. In addition, you will be instrumental in developing best practices and standard work for the network. You will ensure that targets and service deadlines are met, according to regulatory requirements.
You will play a proactive role in written and verbal communication with various departments, as you maintain Amazon‚Äôs exceptionally high levels of service, both for our customers and suppliers. The Matching team is responsible for improving time efficiency for our couriers, while guaranteeing low delivery times for our customers. The team leverages machine learning, combinatorial mathematics, and operations research techniques to build services that make smart matching decisions and minimize the staleness of the fleet.

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US

At Santander, you can be part of one of the largest transformations the World is experiencing in the past several decades. We are transforming our Technology function, with 500+ new hires planned for this 2020. And we are changing how we work and how we design and develop products and services globally.

This change is only possible with people like you, who will help us to raise the bar. We aim to bring technologists, passionate professionals who live and breathe technology, who will be constantly seeking different ways of doing things, learn a new language every year, keep old computer parts and reuse them in strange projects around the house, continually tinker with electronic gadgets of all sorts, and be considered the geekiest person around by all their friends and family. That might be a bit of exaggeration, but you get the idea of what we are looking for.

And on top of a meaningful job, we care about you. At Santander, this means creating a workplace that respects your individuality and supports you to enjoy life outside work. You will enjoy flexible working conditions, a global well-being program, BeHealthy, and will be entitled to spend a certain number of hours each month volunteering.

What You Will Be Doing

We are looking for a person with solid technical and statistical background and able to understand cybersecurity concepts and develop detection algorithms.

As a Data Analyst/Scientist, you will be responsible for clean, prepare and manipulate the data, build and train the analytic models, test and improve the resulting data. It is necessary to have basic knowledge of different big data tools for data management and data bases as well as good programming skills .

We need somebody like you to help us in different fronts:

Some experience on Data Modelling (from row data to structured data). Data Preparation (Cleansing and Standardization). Use of programming tools to transform, clean and store data in different formats. Analytic models: proven knowledge and experience on classical models (classification, regression, time series, clustering, etc.) Experience on data ingestion processes and transformation scripts will be considered an interesting added value Development of services enabling users to access and consume data

Cybersecurity

Basic security concepts (OS, Networking, User Authentication, Firewalls, etc.) WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

Experience & Education

Technical Upper Grade Educational Cycle 2+ years on Data Modelling and Data Preparation (Cleansing and Standardization) SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE

Required

Big Data: some experience working with: HDFS and Spark (desirable Kafka, Hive) SQL and No SQL databases General knowledge of Public Cloud Services (knowledge of AWS/Azure services) Programming Languages: comfortable with Java and Python (optionally Scala, R) High level of English.

What We Offer You

Flexiworking: we have more than 10 flexibility measures to facilitate the balance between professional and personal life, such as flexible entry/exit time or telecommuting. Daily lunch grant: you can have your meal at the restaurants of Santander Group City or use the take out option. You will be part of ‚ÄúFamilia Santander‚Äù: with special financing conditions in mortgages and other financial products. Access to ‚ÄúSantander Contigo‚Äù program: to help you and your family when you need it giving support on different issues such as legal and emotional advice or management, up to a 24-hour personal assistant. Flexible Benefits Plan: you can advantageously obtain different benefits such as health insurance, kindergarten, training courses/masters or the Public Transport Card of Madrid. Prime office space, with on premise gym, hairdresser, convenience store and many other amenities. Multiple discounts for e-commerce, trips or restaurants with Santander Benefits platform. Life insurance Parking , which includes places for bicycles and electric cars. Equality Plan And more important: a team proud of diversity and concerned about sustainability. ABOUT US

We are the Technology and Operations team for Santander Group. We are convinced of the importance of technology that is aligned with the requirements of the business and that our work not only brings value to users, people and communities but also fosters individual creativity. Our team of over 2,000 people in 7 countries (Spain, Portugal, UK, USA, Mexico, Chile and Brazil) develops and/or implements financial solutions across a broad spectrum of technologies (including Blockchain, Big Data and Angular among others) on all kinds of onpremise and cloud-based platforms

These Are The Key Factors That Multiply The Actions Of All Our Employees

At Santander you will enjoy #TheSantanderEffect. Here, with only a small action or a simple idea, you can do great things. We offer you the advantages and the means to contribute to the progress of more than 140 million people around the world.

Meaningful Impact - Where the effect of your work makes a difference and helps people to prosper Personal and Professional Growth - The chance to develop through world-class training, challenging work, and different roles Respect - Be part of an organization that cares ‚Äì about its people, its wider community, and the environment Co-worker quality - Work with inspiring professionals who are leaders in their field

CCC is currently looking for a Data Analyst. You will be performing data analysis and turning data into information to understand strengths or shortcomings and improve our business. The Data Analyst will retrieve data sets from a variety of sources (e.g., the operational databases of our products, our data warehouses, as well as third party systems such as Salesforce) and study multiple aspects of these data in the various contexts of our business. Another aspect could be the ability of a particular data set to provide appropriate answers in an operational business context. Yet another need could be the interpretation of patterns in the data and the discovery of trends to provide insights. Apart from the ability to manage and analyze data, the Data Analyst is expected to create narratives using visualizations and other reporting techniques to inform our business. This position requires a blend of analytic mindset, communication, and business acumen along with critical thinking.

What You Will Be Doing

Respond to business inquiries by providing analysis for specific business questions

Work with team members (e.g., Business Units, Product Management, Engineering) to collect and analyze data

Identify and interpret patterns in the data and discover trends in various business areas (e.g., Customer Support, Client Engagement, Operations)

Create reports for internal teams and/or external clients

Use dashboards, graphs, infographics and other methods to visualize data

Report against established KPIs to establish baselines and measure the effectiveness of business decisions

What You Need To Have
Programming skills in one of the major programming languages such as C/C++, Java, Python
Good knowledge of SQL
Programming skills specifically for data analysis in any language or environment
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Clear verbal and written communication skills
Good knowledge of ETL techniques
Reporting and data visualization skills
Degree in Engineering, Science or other relevant fields; advanced degree preferred but not required
Copyright Clearance Center (CCC) clears the path to integrated data and information, accelerates knowledge and advances copyright. With a history of innovation and growth in a dynamic market, a passionate and dedicated team, and a deep commitment to building next-generation content and licensing solutions using the very best technology and talent available, we offer the stability of an ongoing business in an entrepreneurial culture‚Äîall while providing very competitive benefits. CCC‚Äôs success starts with our team - smart, dynamic, talented professionals whose contributions matter.

As a global leader in voluntary collective licensing with 40+ years of industry experience, CCC sets the standard for an efficient global rights marketplace. We continue to build unique solutions that help organizations navigate vast amounts of data to discover actionable insights, enabling them to make informed decisions. We‚Äôre always learning, developing new skills, and exploring new and better ways to help society clear a path to information, discovery and the next big idea.

Descripci√≥n:
Job Purpose:
To support the IPP Analyst team in maintaining and strengthening trading relationships with all relevant vendors and with Product Marketing to obtain competitive advantage for Tech Data via professional inventory planning and procurement.
Responsibilities:
Placing orders based on profiles produced by the IPP Analyst team taking into account any logistics efficiency requirements (i.e. pallet, layer, carton etc.).
Back to back ordering of products with no established run rate.
Place direct ship purchase orders on vendors. To check order confirmations for correct product, quantity, pricing and delivery dates and to invoice customers on receipt of proof of shipment or delivery.
Ensure that all purchase orders raised are within authorised and agreed sign off limits.
Check vendor order confirmations for correct product, quantity, pricing and delivery dates, and updating system (SAP) accordingly.
Expedite all open orders to maximise customer satisfaction and take responsibility for highest degree of due date accuracy in SAP. Supporting texts to be added if necessary for POD (proof of delivery) requests and queries.
To assist the IPP Analyst team with vendor price changes by ensuring correct cost prices are reflected within SAP.
Stock Rotation: a) request authorisation reference from the vendor for either contractual or negotiated terms within prescribed timescales b) once reference obtained, raise Return to Vendor quotation order and record on central database c) validate all stock is returned to vendor in accordance with RMA.
Support IPP Analyst team in resolution of Logistics (primarily Goods In) and Finance queries within prescribed timescales.
To work within set policies and procedures and to continually review and update where necessary.
To own and manage through until completion, any ad hoc projects as defined by IPP Management.
Provide high level of service, support and accuracy to the IPP team
To consistently achieve set targets
Represent Tech Data at all times in an efficient and professional manner
Deliver maximum stock availability, minimise customer backlog and inventory depreciation costs, whilst maintaining stock levels in line with our key performance indicators.
Provide a first class and high availability stock profile (best in Group/IT distribution) with justified commercial risk and cost.
Knowledge Skills and Experience
Effective communication with internal & external partners
Must be proactive and self-motivated
Strong attention to detail
Ability to organise and prioritise daily routine to support a rapidly changing environment
Solid working knowledge of current IT technologies
Good working knowledge of MS Office tools (Outlook, Excel, Word) and inventory replenishment systems (SAP R3) would be advantageous.
Commercial and financial acumen - to balance inventory value and recovery margin.
Good analytical skills - to analyse data and take appropriate action.
Must have a focused, pro-active and committed attitude - to set and achieve action plans.
Sound knowledge of basic purchasing and inventory principles and practices.

Puesto ofertado: Senior Business Analyst ‚Äì Partner Programs (Bangkok based, relocation provided)

Descripci√≥n:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenabling our customers to experience the world.

Get To Know Our Team

Partner Programs and Display Network is fast growing and dynamic team within Strategic Partnerships department of Agoda. The team is responsible for developing and scaling a range of marketing solutions for accommodation partners focusing on growth, visibility and conversion, as well as advertising and display marketing solutions for businesses and travel organizations. The team scope includes business development and sales, project management, trainings, contracting operations, risk assessment and collections operations, product development work and data analytics.

The Opportunity

Business Analysts in the Partner Programs team play an integral part by supporting decisions and projects with actionable data insights, reports and tools used by thousands of account managers and business development managers, as well as hotels worldwide.

In This Role, You‚Äôll Get To
Performance tracking and modeling: Analyze data generated by supply and supply teams, develop models we can use for performance tracking and optimization, draw recommendations on your analysis.
Support and participation in projects: Provide input on initiatives to reach business targets of the strategic projects you will be working on, run and then assess your proposed actions in collaboration with the relevant teams
Building tools: Create and deliver dashboards, automated reports, calculators and data feeds to optimize and improve processes related to our products and operations


What You‚Äôll Need To Succeed
Minimum 2 yearsof experience working in business analysis / data analytics / business intelligence/ consulting or financial modelling roles in e-commerce, tech, consulting or financial services companies
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or higher from a top university in a business analytics, engineering, statistics, quantitative, data or finance subject (e.g., BI, science, math or financial analysis)
Ability to communicate fluently in English
Familiarity with SQL, Tableau, advanced Excel skills, which you were using on real work projects before.
Proven track record in using data to measure performance, build reports and tools and make decisions
Intellectual curiosity, ability to learn fast
Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced/rapidly changing environment


It‚Äôs Great If You Have
Experience with complex analytics and statistical/machine learning techniques using R/Python/Spark
Experience building automated analytical processes and functionality
Master‚Äôs degree in statistics, operations research, or data science

Descripci√≥n:
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Cook Room is our delivery-only kitchen vertical: we provide a shared-kitchen infrastructure solution to our partner restaurants to expand their operations fast and lean and make delicious and diverse types of cuisines available for our customers!

As a result of our growth, we are looking for a Cook Room Business Analyst that will support us in growing this exciting vertical! The successful candidate must be a self-starter, results-oriented and analytical, and be passionate about innovation and entrepreneurship.

Do you want to evolve in one of the fastest growing Start-ups of Barcelona, building a product that will change people¬¥s day-to-day and disrupt the on-demand market?

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Analyse our vertical performance in growth and profitability
Analyse our partners performance and happiness
Identify growth opportunities within our existent cook rooms and in new markets
Assist in the launching of new pilots with other teams
Assist in building tools and insights to help our local teams grow cook room faster
Get to know the market and our customers in detail and thus have comprehensive information on trends, opportunities and challenges


You Have
1-2 years of work experience leading analysis and turning insights into actions
Strong business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management
Strategic and 360 mindset
Hands-on attitude: you‚Äôll have to roll up your sleeves!
Strong project management skills
Ability to think big
Excel proficiency


Nice-to-haves
Experience in setting up strategy and growth models for new businesses
Passionate about analytics: you enjoy deep diving into problems to find the root cause
Ability to influence stakeholders


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Attractive Relocation package (if applicable ;))
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment


What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of 2020, we‚Äôre currently present in more than 22 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. Take ownership of analytical projects end to end from extracting and exploring data, generating hypothesis, building a structured analysis, and rigorously evaluating methods and results

Communicate findings and propose actionable recommendations to address the problems

Proficient in business intelligence tools and data warehouse i.e. SQL, Tableau and MS Excel
Must be data savvy and love crunching numbers

Fluent in English with strong communication skills (both written and verbal)


It‚Äôs Great If You Have

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenabling our customers to experience the world.

Get To Know Our Team

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

The Opportunity

As a Manager/Senior Manager, CRM you will be at the forefront of Agoda‚Äôs communication and engagement efforts. You will lead a team of 2 and own, plan and deliver large scale campaigns reaching millions of Customers, analyzing and leveraging rich datasets to build new innovative products and flows.

And on top of that you will be working with some of the smartest people in the industry not just in Marketing but also in Product, IT, Partner Services, etc.

This Role Is Good For You If You
Value independence and ownership: you will get goals and projects, not tasks
Have the ambition to make a difference: innovation and drive are necessary to succeed
Want to be a great coach: your contribution scales when you teach others
Are ready to challenge anything: data matter, not opinions, seniority or common knowledge


In This Role, You‚Äôll Get To
Lead: you will work together with 2 Analyst/Campaign managers who will help you manage and execute on new ideas and projects, many of which cross-functional and that will require you to be the representative for Customer Marketing there.
Analyze: new ideas come from data and tests. Segment the userbase, understand their patterns, react to change in demand and identify new opportunities to deliver value.
Test: prove your findings by A/B testing changes to any of our communication products. Define your hypothesis, design the framework, launch the campaign, collect and analyze the results of large scale, quick delivery tests.
Innovate: Learn and develop new features, develop models we can use for optimization, build business cases for completely new implementations, and help us push the boundaries a little further every day.


What You‚Äôll Need To Succeed
4+ years of Digital Marketing, Consulting or Strategy/Business Operations experience
Ability to communicate fluently in English
At least a basic understanding of SQL
Good numerical reasoning skills
Intellectual curiosity


It‚Äôs Great If You Have
At least 1-2 years of people management experience
Experience in the Travel space and/or in a CRM function
Master‚Äôs Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative or marketing subject (statistics, engineering, digital marketing, financial modelling, etc.)

About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

We're looking for a passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on professional to support our Supply Cash department in our headquarters in Barcelona. You will act and operate as a startup within a startup, providing both strategic thinking and analytical skills to help improve and automate our current processes.

Glovo currently holds cash operations across all the countries where we are present through a complex cash management system, impacting our customer‚Äôs experience, our couriers and partners, as well as most of our teams.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Break down processes, technical constraints and data into actionable insights to make a Global impact.
Improve current processes through automatization and simplification.
Build new bots and automations to improve our cash operations for couriers and partners.
Become a reference expert on Glovo‚Äôs cash management system, from both an operational and a technical perspective.
Build dashboards to give visibility to regional and local teams.
Act as a consultant and advisor to regional and local teams on cash operations best practices, building strong relationships with multiple stakeholders.


You Have
1+ years of experience as a consultant or business analyst
Degree in Engineering, Economics or similar
Expertise with SQL, Redshift is a plus
Coding skills, preferred expertise with Python.
Strong analytical skills are a must
Strategic thinking: you go beyond day to day tactical actions to long-term, game changing ideas
Result oriented mindset: you‚Äôre focused on independently delivering high quality content on every project you‚Äôre involved
Attention to detail, great appetite to learn and drive to get your hands dirty
Exceptional verbal and written English communication skills


Nice-to-haves
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI...)
Experience with version control systems like GitHub.
Experience with EC2 AWS
Knowledge of ML techniques


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Attractive Relocation package (if applicable ;))
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment


What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of 2020, we‚Äôre currently present in more than 22 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

The Growth Analytics team at Glovo is looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to support our Retention & Engagement squad by analyzing and visualizing data to make more educated decisions on how to successfully nurture long-term customer relationships with a focus on lifetime value, across our various global loyalty programmes and channels (email, push, in-app and promotions).

You will interact with stakeholders across all levels of the organization on a regular basis and hence require the ability to compartmentalize requests and formulate applicable data-driven solutions. You will require a sharp business focus, a collaborative style of working, and a proactive and critical mindset. Excellent interpersonal, communication, and writing skills are crucial, as is the ability to synthesize complex issues, drive desired outcomes.

Glovo is a fast moving, dynamic environment where flexibility and adaptability are key attributes. The successful candidate is a self-starter with a passion for data analytics and continuously demonstrates an ability to tackle complex problems and implement solutions.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Drive strategic thinking and cross-functional alignment around data-driven approaches to optimize product and marketing efforts (inclusive of experimentation) based on customer segments, lifecycle stages, and other critical customer attributes
Lead deep exploration of customer data and spearhead customer segmentation, retention modeling, and other actionable analysis/modeling
Partner with cross-functional stakeholders to better understand our users and create a single, accurate view of a customer across businesses to make decisions about how best to acquire/retain them, segment, identify high potential value, and proactively interact with them
Provides guidance and support to business leaders and stakeholders on how best to harness available data in support of critical business needs and goals
Drive clarity and solve ambiguous, challenging business problems using data-driven approaches


You Have
At least 2 years of work experience providing internal teams with the necessary data to make the right decisions
Background studies in Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or Economics.
Good understanding of software development and agile methodologies.
Excellent SQL skills
Redshift experience is highly valued.
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Ability to juggle multiple strands of work and priorities on complex projects.
Ability to communicate and present complex ideas to stakeholders and get buy-in thanks to ability to understand business needs.
Ability to build relationships with key stakeholders across the teams.
Excellent spoken and written English.


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Flexible compensation - transport, childcare, restaurants etc via our 3rd party company called Cobee
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment
Flexible Time Off

Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.

About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

We are looking for a world-class Promotions Sr Analyst to become part of our Global Loyalty & Promotions team. Are you able to translate data into actionable insights? Are you looking for a challenging experience in the fast and rapidly changing environment helping to build a product that will disrupt the On-demand market? If your answer is YES we are looking forward to meeting you.

As a Promotions Sr Analyst in L&P (Loyalty & Promotions), you will lead the Promotions strategy and execution at Glovo for a set of regions and functions. You will be the driving force that maximizes the impact of Promotions by partnering with Product, Data, CRM and local Growth teams. You will obsess with turning Promotions into a vital engagement lever for us with outstanding performance metrics.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Work alongside another Promotions Program Manager
Define and execute the strategy behind our promotions program
Interpret what drives customer invites and turn data insights into action
Define an action plan involving CRM, Product, and Growth teams
Align promotion-specific budgets with all the markets and the controlling team


You Have
Preferably a degree in Administration, Economics, Information Technology, Engineering or equivalent (Master's Degree would be advantageous)
Analytical mindset
SQL working expertise
2-3 years experience in: (1) Business Analytics; (2) Project management and delivering projects
Great communication skills (presentations are your thing) and people skills
Fluency in English (written and spoken). Spanish is a plus
Ease in learning fast and adapting yourself to different business situations
Problem-solving and results-driven attitude. You have the ability to work independently and have outstanding stakeholder management skills.


Nice-to-haves
Experience in startups or technological platforms
Understanding of growth / loyalty / retention on food delivery companies
Background in technological consultancy firms as functional/business analyst
Familiarity with AB Testing frameworks
Experience in international environments

Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment


What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. As a Manager/Senior Manager, CRM you will be at the forefront of Agoda‚Äôs communication and engagement efforts. Value independence and ownership: you will get goals and projects, not tasks

Master‚Äôs Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative or marketing subject (statistics, engineering, digital marketing, financial modelling, etc.)

Job Purpose:
To support the IPP Analyst team in maintaining and strengthening trading relationships with all relevant vendors and with Product Marketing to obtain competitive advantage for Tech Data via professional inventory planning and procurement.
Responsibilities:
Placing orders based on profiles produced by the IPP Analyst team taking into account any logistics efficiency requirements (i.e. pallet, layer, carton etc.).
Back to back ordering of products with no established run rate.
Place direct ship purchase orders on vendors. To check order confirmations for correct product, quantity, pricing and delivery dates and to invoice customers on receipt of proof of shipment or delivery.
Ensure that all purchase orders raised are within authorised and agreed sign off limits.
Check vendor order confirmations for correct product, quantity, pricing and delivery dates, and updating system (SAP) accordingly.
Expedite all open orders to maximise customer satisfaction and take responsibility for highest degree of due date accuracy in SAP. Supporting texts to be added if necessary for POD (proof of delivery) requests and queries.
To assist the IPP Analyst team with vendor price changes by ensuring correct cost prices are reflected within SAP.
Stock Rotation: a) request authorisation reference from the vendor for either contractual or negotiated terms within prescribed timescales b) once reference obtained, raise Return to Vendor quotation order and record on central database c) validate all stock is returned to vendor in accordance with RMA.
Support IPP Analyst team in resolution of Logistics (primarily Goods In) and Finance queries within prescribed timescales.
To work within set policies and procedures and to continually review and update where necessary.
To own and manage through until completion, any ad hoc projects as defined by IPP Management.
Provide high level of service, support and accuracy to the IPP team
To consistently achieve set targets
Represent Tech Data at all times in an efficient and professional manner
Deliver maximum stock availability, minimise customer backlog and inventory depreciation costs, whilst maintaining stock levels in line with our key performance indicators.
Provide a first class and high availability stock profile (best in Group/IT distribution) with justified commercial risk and cost.
Knowledge Skills and Experience
Effective communication with internal & external partners
Must be proactive and self-motivated
Strong attention to detail
Ability to organise and prioritise daily routine to support a rapidly changing environment
Solid working knowledge of current IT technologies
Good working knowledge of MS Office tools (Outlook, Excel, Word) and inventory replenishment systems (SAP R3) would be advantageous.
Commercial and financial acumen - to balance inventory value and recovery margin.
Good analytical skills - to analyse data and take appropriate action.
Must have a focused, pro-active and committed attitude - to set and achieve action plans.
Sound knowledge of basic purchasing and inventory principles and practices.
