About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

We are looking for a creative problem solver to join our Barcelona HQ. Working in the Global Supply Excellence team you will be focused on improving courier quality and behaviours. You will be the one to deep dive into the operational issues and processes, understand the root causes and come up with solutions to help couriers get the most out of the platform, while delivering the best customer and partner experience. Your responsibilities will also include finding scalable approaches to automate tasks, in a way that they can remain adaptable to local needs and practices, while minimising manual work. This role will require an ability to think outside of the box when normal methods don‚Äôt work to complete a task. The knowledge and previous experience working with automation and programming languages such as Python, SQL, JavaScript are highly desirable.

The Global Supply Excellence team is at the center of working with regional and local operations and Glovo product teams, which will give you a chance to learn a lot about various aspects of Glovo business and make a difference. We are looking for curiosity and desire to continuously improve our platform.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Deep dive into Glovo operational metrics and processes to understand behavioural patterns of the couriers and the areas for improvement
Build the operational tools and design processes from scratch
Run A/B tests fast and smartly to get new insights
Be in touch with our Data/Tech team to request and implement new product features
Make good use of internal data to build dashboards that measure and track the impact of your actions
Roll out the tools you build to different markets, adapting them to local need


You Have
Background studies in Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics
2-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role: operations preferred
Excellent SQL skills
Redshift experience is highly valued.
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledgeable and preferably experienced in designing and analysing experiments (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualisation tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview.
Strong analytical knowledge and experience with reporting, driving insights, and data-driven optimisation
You are able to act as an owner / lead for large scale and complex data analysis projects that impact global, strategic business roadmaps & operations
Hands-on: you are willing to get your hands dirty and are looking to bring your ideas to life and find a way to get things done
You have an amazing attention to detail and a great appetite to learn
You have strong organisational skills, ability to prioritise and multitask, work well under pressure, handle multiple issues simultaneously in a dynamic environment
Good communication skills: you are able to manage various stakeholders and know how to structure the information
Strong drive for continuous improvement
Proficiency in English


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment


What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

About Accenture

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services at scale in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all off these services.

Description

Logistics Planner - Barcelona
Work schedule will be Mon-Sun 5 days per week in 8-hour rotating Morning-Afternoon.

Do you want to learn how the most complex transportation network is managed on a daily basis?

Amazons business is focused on delighting our customers. We strive to stay agile from the second an order is placed online and throughout the seamless coordination of that order behind the scenes. You will‚Ä¶
As a logistics scheduler within the Central Operations team your role will focus on forecasting, scheduling and routing, playing a key role in our delivery stations operations. You will be responsible for executing daily forecasts, labour scheduling and routing, affecting tens of thousands of packages. This will be done through the use of tools and coordination within the station, you will be accountable for cost, customer experience, and delivery partner experience. In addition, you will be instrumental in developing best practices and standard work for the network. You will ensure that targets and service deadlines are met, according to regulatory requirements.
You will play a proactive role in written and verbal communication with various departments, as you maintain Amazon‚Äôs exceptionally high levels of service, both for our customers and suppliers. Your Work-life Opportunity

Reporting to Global Head of Customer Experience (CX), you will be part of a small A-team of super-achievers, aiming to deconstruct, synthesize, and deploy initiatives to drive best-in-class customer experience. Ownership and Responsibilities will be given to you since Day 1. You will be 'thrown' at different tasks and problems that are identified as key areas for improvement that affects customer happiness. Learning curve will be steep as this role entails understanding all the touch points (and pain points) of the whole customer journey and be able to identify root causes and solutions to execute. Able to quickly grasp different process workflows, visualizing impact of different policies, and prioritize effectively amid converging needs, are therefore crucial for the role.

The team is by nature cross-functional, so most of the time and energy are spent collaborating with multiple departments from Operations and Customer Service to Finance and Tech. Specifically this role will require a heavy collaboration with the Growth team for consumer/market research.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Manage & analyze customer feedback from multiple channels, e.g. NPS, Ratings & reviews, social media reviews, surveys, interviews, inbound customer interactions, etc,. to generate insights on customers‚Äô pain points and map them across the customer journey
Translate business needs to insightful analyses for the Customer Experience team to make the right decision
Identify opportunities to increase our customer experience at Glovo
Liaise with the data science team - you will play a central, pivotal role in building reliable sources for data and insights
Propose strategic changes to the way we track, maintain and use data


You Have
2-5 years of work experience in a top-tier consulting firm, or in high-growth start-ups
SQL proficiency as mandatory requirement and Amazon Redshift experience as highly valued; Knowledge in R, Python, looker, Google Analytics, BI Tools are considered a plus
Demonstrated project management, market/consumer research & presentation skills
Experience on market/consumer behavior research and surveys (online, offline surveys, focus group interviews, etc)
Problem-solving attitude, great communication and stakeholder management skills
Entrepreneurial drive and the ability to achieve goals in a fast paced environment complete your profile
Curiosity by nature, have great attention to detail, and have the attitude and aptitude to make things better
Fluency in English; any other language from EU, MENA, SSA is considered a plus

About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day. We currently deliver over +100M annual orders and operate in 22 countries, and in over +300 cities.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo is looking for a world-class Data & Operations Research Analyst to work in our Barcelona office. Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on? Do you want to evolve in one of the fastest growing startups of Barcelona, building a product that will change people's day-to-day lives and disrupt the on-demand market?

The Matching team is responsible for improving time efficiency for our couriers, while guaranteeing low delivery times for our customers. The team leverages machine learning, combinatorial mathematics, and operations research techniques to build services that make smart matching decisions and minimize the staleness of the fleet.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Work closely with product managers and engineering teams to define, monitor, and provide visibility of product metrics and KPIs.
Optimize and tune new product‚Äôs features to improve team performance and Glovo‚Äôs KPIs using mathematical optimization and simulation techniques.
Design experiments and interpret the results to draw detailed and actionable conclusions.
Generate, prototype, and execute on ideas for product discovery to shape future projects and provide recommendations for actions.
Create dashboards and reports to regularly communicate results and monitor key metrics


You Have
Background studies in Engineering, Operations Research, Physics, Economics, Computer Science, or Mathematics (MSc is preferred)
2-4 years of experience in mathematical optimization (metaheuristics, linear optimization, constraint programming, etc) and discrete-event simulation would be very beneficial
Ability to manipulate and analyze large amount of data, using analytical tools such as: Python, R, Julia (knowledge in SQL is desired)
Ability to communicate and present complex ideas to stakeholders and get buy-in thanks to ability to understand business needs.
Ability to juggle multiple strands of work and priorities on complex projects.
Fluent spoken and written English

The primary purpose and function of the Senior Analyst is to act as Workday subject matter expert and HR processes designer, to lead Workday system configuration, enhancement, and deployment efforts. Additionally, this individual will serve as the liaison between Tier 1 team and third party vendors for other HR applications (e.g. Greenhouse).

The Senior Analyst will demonstrate HR systems maintenance experience as well as proficiency in analytics and reporting, processes analysis and design, and configuration.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Be Glovo‚Äôs HR Process and Technology expert in order to build scalable HR tools that will address all our business & employees‚Äô needs.
Configure, enhance, and support selected Workday modules, e.g. Core HR, Performance Management, Onboarding, Compensation, Learning.
Maintain and administer Workday security groups.
Partner closely with business and Tier 1 team to understand system end-user needs and provide recommendations to keep Workday processes simple and efficient.
Take ownership of reporting of KPIs by creating customised tools or using the available ones.
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date.
A/B test the launch of new features.
Conduct and/or support continuous improvement projects.
Provide end-user troubleshooting, issue remediation, technology request assistance and escalation management. Monitor reoccurring issues, system/data or process gaps and proactively identify potential sources of increased efficiency and enhancements.
Work closely with other team members to brainstorm, strategize and complete ad hoc requests creatively, effectively and efficiently.
Design and document HR processes (Process Flows, SOPs, Job Aides).
Build Training materials and train users on Workday and HR processes.


You Have
At least 3 years of experience with configuring and maintaining HRIS/HCM system, with focus point on Workday.
Experience in designing and documenting HR processes.
Bachelor degree in quantitative field and/or human resources.
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office, especially Excel, PowerPoint and Word.
Detail-oriented thinking, exhibiting strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills.
Team spirit by contributing valuable ideas and feedback.
Ease in working with ambiguity, shifting priorities and rapid change.
Ability to work with sensitive employee data, maintaining confidentiality in all situations with a keen eye for detail, quality and accuracy.
Proficiency in English.
Workday Certification & API experience as a strong plus.

Data Analyst/Scientist - SGT (

N√∫mero De Puesto

2100000K )

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US

At Santander, you can be part of one of the largest transformations the World is experiencing in the past several decades. We are transforming our Technology function, with 500+ new hires planned for this 2020. And we are changing how we work and how we design and develop products and services globally.

This change is only possible with people like you, who will help us to raise the bar. We aim to bring technologists, passionate professionals who live and breathe technology, who will be constantly seeking different ways of doing things, learn a new language every year, keep old computer parts and reuse them in strange projects around the house, continually tinker with electronic gadgets of all sorts, and be considered the geekiest person around by all their friends and family. That might be a bit of exaggeration, but you get the idea of what we are looking for.

And on top of a meaningful job, we care about you. At Santander, this means creating a workplace that respects your individuality and supports you to enjoy life outside work. You will enjoy flexible working conditions, a global well-being program, BeHealthy, and will be entitled to spend a certain number of hours each month volunteering.

What You Will Be Doing

We are looking for a person with solid technical and statistical background and able to understand cybersecurity concepts and develop detection algorithms.

As a Data Analyst/Scientist, you will be responsible for clean, prepare and manipulate the data, build and train the analytic models, test and improve the resulting data. It is necessary to have basic knowledge of different big data tools for data management and data bases as well as good programming skills .

We need somebody like you to help us in different fronts:

Some experience on Data Modelling (from row data to structured data). Data Preparation (Cleansing and Standardization). Use of programming tools to transform, clean and store data in different formats. Analytic models: proven knowledge and experience on classical models (classification, regression, time series, clustering, etc.) Experience on data ingestion processes and transformation scripts will be considered an interesting added value Development of services enabling users to access and consume data

Cybersecurity

Basic security concepts (OS, Networking, User Authentication, Firewalls, etc.) WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

Experience & Education

Technical Upper Grade Educational Cycle 2+ years on Data Modelling and Data Preparation (Cleansing and Standardization) SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE

Required

Big Data: some experience working with: HDFS and Spark (desirable Kafka, Hive) SQL and No SQL databases General knowledge of Public Cloud Services (knowledge of AWS/Azure services) Programming Languages: comfortable with Java and Python (optionally Scala, R) High level of English.

What We Offer You

Flexiworking: we have more than 10 flexibility measures to facilitate the balance between professional and personal life, such as flexible entry/exit time or telecommuting. Daily lunch grant: you can have your meal at the restaurants of Santander Group City or use the take out option. You will be part of ‚ÄúFamilia Santander‚Äù: with special financing conditions in mortgages and other financial products. Access to ‚ÄúSantander Contigo‚Äù program: to help you and your family when you need it giving support on different issues such as legal and emotional advice or management, up to a 24-hour personal assistant. Flexible Benefits Plan: you can advantageously obtain different benefits such as health insurance, kindergarten, training courses/masters or the Public Transport Card of Madrid. Prime office space, with on premise gym, hairdresser, convenience store and many other amenities. Multiple discounts for e-commerce, trips or restaurants with Santander Benefits platform. Life insurance Parking , which includes places for bicycles and electric cars. Equality Plan And more important: a team proud of diversity and concerned about sustainability. ABOUT US

We are the Technology and Operations team for Santander Group. We are convinced of the importance of technology that is aligned with the requirements of the business and that our work not only brings value to users, people and communities but also fosters individual creativity. Our team of over 2,000 people in 7 countries (Spain, Portugal, UK, USA, Mexico, Chile and Brazil) develops and/or implements financial solutions across a broad spectrum of technologies (including Blockchain, Big Data and Angular among others) on all kinds of onpremise and cloud-based platforms

These Are The Key Factors That Multiply The Actions Of All Our Employees

At Santander you will enjoy #TheSantanderEffect. Here, with only a small action or a simple idea, you can do great things. We offer you the advantages and the means to contribute to the progress of more than 140 million people around the world.

Meaningful Impact - Where the effect of your work makes a difference and helps people to prosper Personal and Professional Growth - The chance to develop through world-class training, challenging work, and different roles Respect - Be part of an organization that cares ‚Äì about its people, its wider community, and the environment Co-worker quality - Work with inspiring professionals who are leaders in their field

Descripci√≥n:
CCC is currently looking for a Data Analyst. You will be performing data analysis and turning data into information to understand strengths or shortcomings and improve our business. The Data Analyst will retrieve data sets from a variety of sources (e.g., the operational databases of our products, our data warehouses, as well as third party systems such as Salesforce) and study multiple aspects of these data in the various contexts of our business. Another aspect could be the ability of a particular data set to provide appropriate answers in an operational business context. Yet another need could be the interpretation of patterns in the data and the discovery of trends to provide insights. Apart from the ability to manage and analyze data, the Data Analyst is expected to create narratives using visualizations and other reporting techniques to inform our business. This position requires a blend of analytic mindset, communication, and business acumen along with critical thinking.

What You Will Be Doing

Respond to business inquiries by providing analysis for specific business questions

Work with team members (e.g., Business Units, Product Management, Engineering) to collect and analyze data

Identify and interpret patterns in the data and discover trends in various business areas (e.g., Customer Support, Client Engagement, Operations)

Create reports for internal teams and/or external clients

Use dashboards, graphs, infographics and other methods to visualize data

Report against established KPIs to establish baselines and measure the effectiveness of business decisions

What You Need To Have
Programming skills in one of the major programming languages such as C/C++, Java, Python
Good knowledge of SQL
Programming skills specifically for data analysis in any language or environment
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Clear verbal and written communication skills
Good knowledge of ETL techniques
Reporting and data visualization skills
Degree in Engineering, Science or other relevant fields; advanced degree preferred but not required

About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Central Business Intelligence team. The role is responsible for data analysis, identifying data impact of engineering projects, coding data transformations and designing KPIs.

Central BI lead strategic data projects for Glovo. As well as our Enterprise Data Warehouse and Data Quality programmes, they work with Engineering teams to identify the data impact of upcoming projects and manage the changes needed to keep company reporting up and running. They're also the center of excellence for BI Engineering and Analytics, offering support and mentorship to our data community.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Work closely with departmental analysts and BI data engineers to define company KPIs and write the SQL required calculate to them in our data pipelines.
Design data quality measurements, writing queries that can identify when data is missing, and working out the thresholds for alerts.
Work with back end Engineering teams to understand the impact of upcoming projects on our data, and with stakeholders to design the data transformations needed to keep our reports running.
Run SQL training sessions and help junior analysts optimize slow running queries.
Create Looker dashboards for teams that don't have analysts of their own.
Bring a quality-first approach to everything you build, carrying out rigorous testing and writing good documentation.


You Have
2-4 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role.
Excellent SQL skills.
Solid proficiency in Python and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Jupyter/iPython notebooks.
AWS experience is highly valued.
Knowledge of visualisation tools, Looker preferred.
Good understanding of software development and agile methodologies.
Ability to juggle multiple strands of work and priorities on complex projects.
Ability to communicate and present complex ideas to stakeholders and get buy-in thanks to ability to understand business needs.
Ability to build relationships with key stakeholders across the teams.
A Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics or similar.
Excellent spoken and written English is a must, Spanish is a plus.


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Spanish lessons
Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment


What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.


If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we‚Äôre currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenabling our customers to experience the world.

Get To Know Our Team

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In This Role, You‚Äôll Get To
Take ownership of analytical projects end to end from extracting and exploring data, generating hypothesis, building a structured analysis, and rigorously evaluating methods and results
Provide analytical and valuable insights for decision-making support for key projects and management
Work closely with various business functions to identify opportunities, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets using different techniques and tools such as R studio or Tableau
Communicate findings and propose actionable recommendations to address the problems


What You‚Äôll Need To Succeed
Bachelor Degree in Computer Science/Statistics/Math or Engineering or Economics and Finance
5+ years in Data Analyst position or otherwise in projects involving big data
People management and strong commercial acumen
Proficient in business intelligence tools and data warehouse i.e. SQL, Tableau and MS Excel
Must be data savvy and love crunching numbers
Strong analytical and statistical analysis skills in order to extract insights and recommendations
Fluent in English with strong communication skills (both written and verbal)


It‚Äôs Great If You Have
Experience in R studio, data modeling, hypothesis testing is a plus

Puesto ofertado: Senior Data Analyst - Global Supply Operations (Courier Quality)
Sector: Marketing y publicidad Internet Servicios financieros
Descripci√≥n:
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo is a global marketplace, making items from anywhere in your city accessible in under 40 minutes. We launched in March 2015 and now operate in 22 countries. One of the key actors of the platform are the riders, Glovers as we like to call them. They are the core of the supply department, and one of the three pillars of our platform, along with Partners and Customers.

We are looking for a creative problem solver to join our Barcelona HQ. Working in the Global Supply Excellence team you will be focused on improving courier quality and behaviours. You will be the one to deep dive into the operational issues and processes, understand the root causes and come up with solutions to help couriers get the most out of the platform, while delivering the best customer and partner experience. Your responsibilities will also include finding scalable approaches to automate tasks, in a way that they can remain adaptable to local needs and practices, while minimizing manual work. This role will require an ability to think outside of the box when normal methods don‚Äôt work to complete a task. The knowledge and previous experience working with automation and programming languages such as Python, SQL, JavaScript are highly desirable.

The Global Supply Excellence team is at the interception of working with regional and local operations and Glovo product teams, which will give you a chance to learn a lot about various aspects of Glovo business and make a difference. We are looking for curiosity and desire to continuously improve our platform.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Own the courier quality metrics, deep-diving on route causes and defining strategies for improvement
Design processes from scratch
Build operational tools and roll them out in different markets, adapting them to local needs
Deep dive into Glovo operational metrics and processes to understand behavioral patterns of the couriers and the areas for improvement
Run A/B Tests fast and smartly to get new insights
Be in touch with our Data/Tech team to request and implement new product features
Make good use of internal data to build dashboards that measure and track the impact of your actions


You Have
Degree in Engineering, Economics or similar
2-5 years of previous experience in analytics / optimization / automation-related roles
Strong analytical knowledge and experience with reporting, driving insights, and data-driven optimization
You are able to act as an owner / lead for large scale and complex data analysis projects that impact global, strategic business roadmaps & operations
Hands-on: you are willing to get your hands dirty and are looking to bring your ideas to life and find a way to get things done
You have an amazing attention to detail and a great appetite to learn
Ability to adapt in an ever-changing environment - balancing intense attention to detail with swift turnaround while working in a collaborative, positive manner
You have strong organisational skills, ability to prioritise and multitask, work well under pressure, handle multiple issues simultaneously in a dynamic environment
Good communication skills: you are able to manage various stakeholders and know to structure the information
Strong drive for continuous improvement
Proficiency in English

Puesto ofertado: Senior Data Analyst - Lead Generation & Tiering
Sector: Marketing y publicidad Internet Servicios financieros
Descripci√≥n:
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Are you looking for a career where you can innovate, fail, learn and GROW! If that‚Äôs your case, Glovo is your place. Glovo is amongst the highest growing startups in the world and expanding very fast.

Glovo is a hyperlocal marketplace featuring the most trendy places in each city, and delivers their products in less than 45 mins. The Commercial team is directly responsible for partnering with both local stores and with bigger brands to display them in the Glovo platform. At Glovo, it is in our DNA to do more with less and your job will be to optimize the sales department across all regions.

You will be a key member in the Commercial Intelligence Team, working hand-by-hand with Global Commercial, Regional and Head of Sales and AMs of each different market. Concretely, The Lead Generation and Tiering sub department is responsible for finding all the potential partners in the cities we operate, classify & prioritize them accordingly to the business needs.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Be part of the Commercial Data team
Be key in the Lead Generation and Tiering projects
Define and develop tools and processes to improve our lead generation process. Your processes will ensure enough pipeline to our sales teams
Define and develop tools and processes to improve our pre-processing tiering. Your processes will ensure that we are pitching best leads in all our cities. Leads prioritization is a must to improve our teams productivity and efficiency
Automate manual processes. You are going to be the owner of sources integration: Amazon redshift to Salesforce, S3 buckets processes,...
Be a Lead Generation Project management support
Find new BI tools or processes to improve our processes
Be proactive proposing new Leads sources
Be key in our competitors analysis (benchmarking and data processing will be key for the Data team)
Understanding the behavior and expectations of new markets


You Have
Bachelor in Engineering, Maths, Physics or Informatics
Master degree in Data Analytics, Data Science or Programming languages is a plus.
+3-4 years experience in Analytics or Data Science positions
+2 year of experience in Python coding (Proficiency level in: data cleaning, Numpy, Pandas and Other sources connections as Salesforce, Amazon S3)
Machine Learning experience is a plus
Other Programming languages required: SQL. Other codes knowledge are a plus
Marketing intelligence or Sales Analytics experience is a plus
Knowledge of Business Intelligence tools: Data Studio, Qlik, Board or similar
Salesforce or other CRM knowledge is required
Experience with Google APIs is a plus
Proactive, organised, and obsessed with detail and accuracy
Have excellent communication skills. Detail oriented, strong grammar and writing skills
Self-starter who is able to work in a highly demanding environment.
Preferably with experience in a high-growth digital startup business


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Spanish lessons
Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment


What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.


If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we‚Äôre currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo is looking for a world-class Workday Senior Analyst to join our People Team in our Headquarters. Are you ready to bring your ideas into life, apply your technical skills into the HR field and have a global impact immediately? Join Glovo!

The primary purpose and function of the Senior Analyst is to act as Workday subject matter expert and HR processes designer, to lead Workday system configuration, enhancement, and deployment efforts. Additionally, this individual will serve as the liaison between Tier 1 team and third party vendors for other HR applications (e.g. Greenhouse).

The Senior Analyst will demonstrate HR systems maintenance experience as well as proficiency in analytics and reporting, processes analysis and design, and configuration.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Be Glovo‚Äôs HR Process and Technology expert in order to build scalable HR tools that will address all our business & employees‚Äô needs.
Configure, enhance, and support selected Workday modules, e.g. Core HR, Performance Management, Onboarding, Compensation, Learning.
Maintain and administer Workday security groups.
Partner closely with business and Tier 1 team to understand system end-user needs and provide recommendations to keep Workday processes simple and efficient.
Conduct and/or support continuous improvement projects.
Provide end-user troubleshooting, issue remediation, technology request assistance and escalation management. Monitor reoccurring issues, system/data or process gaps and proactively identify potential sources of increased efficiency and enhancements.
Work closely with other team members to brainstorm, strategize and complete ad hoc requests creatively, effectively and efficiently.
Design and document HR processes (Process Flows, SOPs, Job Aides).
Build Training materials and train users on Workday and HR processes.


You Have
At least 3 years of experience with configuring and maintaining HRIS/HCM system, with focus point on Workday.
Experience in designing and documenting HR processes.
Bachelor degree in quantitative field and/or human resources.
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office, especially Excel, PowerPoint and Word.
Detail-oriented thinking, exhibiting strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills.
Team spirit by contributing valuable ideas and feedback.
Ease in working with ambiguity, shifting priorities and rapid change.
Ability to work with sensitive employee data, maintaining confidentiality in all situations with a keen eye for detail, quality and accuracy.
Proficiency in English.
Workday Certification & API experience as a strong plus.

Descripci√≥n:
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

As a Demand Planner, you will be responsible for delivering a forecast model for all the cities in Iberia. Also contribute to define the best fleet size to accomplish the best operations and engaging with and retaining couriers (glovers, as we like to call them). The Glovers, are a key player in Glovo‚Äôs marketplace and you will need to ensure the long-term sustainability of the fleet, as well as its daily performance.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Improve the country operations (ensuring targets)
Analyze in detail all the cities that we operate in (+400 cities) so as to extract local peculiarities that the system should consider.
Develop demand forecasts at multiple levels of aggregation for multiple time horizons as part of the demand planning function.
Run an efficient continuous improvement by understanding which assumptions have been generating the biggest demand plan error and bias.
Review historical sales trends, research demand drivers, prepare forecast data, develop statistical forecast models, and evaluate forecast results.
Hold profitable conversations with the commercial and Marketing teams (challenging them required).
Own all dashboards and build new tools to improve the visibility of metrics in the department.
Coordinate cross-functional research activities to reconcile significant variances and refine the forecast model to reflect updated sales and marketing assumptions.
Utilise a collaborative and consensus approach by working with Sales, Marketing, and Finance to understand demand forecast drivers and to ensure that current and accurate information is used for demand forecasts.

Perform analysis to come up with some insights to help improve forecast accuracy, reduce operational errors and costs and to innovate by creating new services that improve the customer experience.
Understand the operations model in Glovo to provide advice to the team.
Give life to your craziest ideas and have an immediate impact.
Commit to contributing to Glovo‚Äôs growth globally, getting the job done.


You Have
A degree (or equivalent) in a related discipline such as business administration or supply chain management.
1-2 years working experience acquired in consumer goods, pharmaceutical or healthcare companies with demonstrable knowledge in the areas of demand management, forecasting and launch planning.
Demonstrated strong analytical skills and advanced Excel skills.
Demonstrated proficiency in statistics, forecasting and forecasting methods with an understanding of their financial and operational impacts.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Data-driven decision making.
Ability to present data. You know how to explain things in an understandable way.
Proficiency in English.
Ability to manage the big picture, and the smallest details. You're always on top of your deadlines and an organization freak.
Ability to take initiative in a constantly changing work environment.


Nice-to-haves
Knowledge of visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau or QlikView.
Professional experience in a business analyst, data analyst, data scientist or similar.
SQL experience.
Machine Learning understanding.

About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

We are a quickly growing data driven company where our marketing teams rely on data solutions to inform and drive marketing investment & strategy. By deep diving into data to explore new opportunities, measure outcomes, create large scale marketing experiments and optimise marketing campaigns, the Acquisition Analytics/Performance team is strategic for the growth and future of Glovo.

As a Data Analyst on the team you will work alongside performance marketers, data engineers & data scientists and be responsible for using data to proactively uncover untapped opportunities, measure & monitor performance and optimise all aspects of Glovos marketing efforts.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Provide internal stakeholder support on all data related queries
Conduct exploratory analysis via SQL or statistical packages
Assist in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B testing, dif. in dif. etc.)
Design, publish and maintain dashboards and visualization tools to facilitate reporting and campaign optimization
Translate data insights into quantifiable business opportunities
Manage customer requests, which includes verifying data quality, analyzing data, isolating and diagnosing the problem and resolving the issue with pragmatic solutions.


You Have
3+ years work experience in data analyst, engineering or other technical positions
BS/MS in Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics or other disciplines with demonstrated technical exposure
Strong analytical mindset to deliver effective & pragmatic solutions
Excellent attention to detail - you are methodical and thorough in your analyses (problem statement, data discovery to result communication). Excellent communication, visualization & storytelling with data skills to both scientific and business audiences.
Strong SQL skills - able to extract, manipulate, transform and analyse large volumes of data with a high level of accuracy
A strong grasp of statistical concepts, especially those related to experiment design and analysis


Nice-to-haves
Solid proficiency in statistical programming with Python/R (Python prefered) and experience working with popular tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Git, Jenkins etc
Experience with mobile, display ad serving or search marketing
Experience in the online advertising industry
Understanding of attribution and tagging platforms

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenabling our customers to experience the world.

Get To Know Our Team

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In This Role, You‚Äôll Get To
Take ownership of analytical projects end to end from extracting and exploring data, generating hypothesis, building a structured analysis, and rigorously evaluating methods and results
Provide analytical and valuable insights for decision-making support for key projects and management
Work closely with various business functions to identify opportunities, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets using different techniques and tools such as R studio or Tableau
Communicate findings and propose actionable recommendations to address the problems


What You‚Äôll Need To Succeed
Bachelor Degree in Computer Science/Statistics/Math or Engineering or Economics and Finance
5+ years in Data Analyst position or otherwise in projects involving big data
People management and strong commercial acumen
Proficient in business intelligence tools and data warehouse i.e. SQL, Tableau and MS Excel
Must be data savvy and love crunching numbers
Strong analytical and statistical analysis skills in order to extract insights and recommendations
Fluent in English with strong communication skills (both written and verbal)


It‚Äôs Great If You Have
Experience in R studio, data modeling, hypothesis testing is a plus

Descripci√≥n:
About The Role

This Data Analyst will work with the Ads & Growth team at TKWW. They will help the team understand performance by developing analytical tools and performing ad-hoc analysis. They will assist with product testing, modeling, data investigations, and visualizations. They will be a valued partner and trusted advisor.

Responsibilities
Analyze TKWW user behavior and identify growth opportunities to drive acquisition and product engagement
Identify key trends and areas of opportunity for product and business teams
Help provide data and insights to drive up revenue mix by investigating and optimizing the funnel
Assist with setting up, conducting, and interpreting outcomes of A/B testing and other forms of experimentation
Create and manage reports and data assets in dashboarding tools like Metabase, Google Sheets, Google Data Studio, Excel and develop presentations to keep the team apprised of key trends
Communicate, collaborate and present results to clients within TKWW
Explore novel ways to look at our data
Assist with development of metrics and goals
Successful Data Analyst Candidates Have
Background working within a team in a data-driven environment
SQL and database experience
Experience with Google Analytics and BigQuery or other event tracking
Experience with financial modeling
2-3 years of hands-on web analytics or business intelligence
Commitment to timelines, accuracy, and professionalism
Ability to work in a fast paced environment and shift gears quickly
Excellent communication and project management skills
You have a Bachelor or Master's Degree
Proficiency with R or Python is a plus

About Returnly:At Returnly, we help brands that care about shopper loyalty offer better product returns. We are a financial technology services company that builds award-winning products that drive repurchase behavior and customer loyalty. We‚Äôre backed by smart money VCs in Fintech including some prominent members of the Paypal Mafia. Our headquarters are in San Francisco Financial District and we have offices in Chicago and Madrid. We are on a mission to de-risk online commerce and are building a team of amazingly talented people to help us do it.About the role:At Returnly, we value you as a whole person. We care about the skillset you bring to the table, but more importantly, we care about the kind of person you are and the culture and attitude that you bring. As a Lead Analyst, you will work with our Product, Marketing, Data Science, Sales, Customer Success, and Finance teams to define and create meaningful analyses to help drive revenue, fix processes, and monitor impact.

You will become an expert in our merchant and shopper data and seek to use that knowledge to provide an enhanced product experience using tools such as SQL, Python, Looker, statistics, machine learning, etc. This is a cross-functional role in which you‚Äôll work with the Director of Analytics as well as the CEO, CTO and other members of Leadership to help prioritize the data projects that will have the biggest impact for Returnly merchants and shoppers.About you:Here‚Äôs what we look for in the attitude department:You are a seasoned and versatile analytics leader who is passionate about your workYou have a strong sense of ownership and accountabilityYou are proactive and adaptableYou like to solve problems and to fill in the gaps where there are unknownsYou have your own opinions and you are not shy about them, but you also value consensus and strive to achieve itYou lead your teammates by example, you‚Äôre the ‚Äúgo to‚Äù individualYou‚Äôre not afraid to change your mind given new facts, nor are you afraid to admit your mistakes You thrive in a semi-structured start-up environment with ample opportunity and also plenty of ambiguityYou can wear multiple hatsYou have excellent communication skills and are able to explain your ideas clearly and concisely and enjoy sharing themYou are very serious about the quality of your work and you ask no less from your colleaguesYou understand and are interested in both big picture and nitty-gritty detailsWhat you'll doSolve new and challenging data problems around eCommerce returns, payments, credit issuance and settlement, fraud detection, economics of SaaSServe as an analytics domain expert: help the team size and prioritize work, identify foundational infrastructure, and communicate across time zones Be a thought partner to other departments and drive data-informed decisions across the companyBuild reports and dashboards that empower stakeholders, enabling them to access data and draw insights in a self-serve mannerDeeply understand our users and their actions; be their advocate and suggest and champion features to help our users have the best possible experienceHelp develop data-driven products and services, such as client-facing analytics insights and personalized experiencesBe able to simplify and communicate complex topics to non-technical audiencesElevate the entire business (Product, Sales, Marketing, Engineering, and Customer Support teams) by analyzing and leveraging data to make recommendations and improvementsWork with other analysts and data science to support business intelligence work from SQL pipelines (Snowflake and DBT) to presentation (Looker)Mentor and support other analystsWhat we're looking for6+ years industry experience and expert knowledge of SQLExpert level usage of BI tools (Looker, Tableau, or similar) & Excel/Google SheetsAnalytics experience across multiple company domains such as Product, Sales, Marketing, Customer Service, and FinanceExperience with databases using columnar storage such as Snowflake or RedshiftExperience with web analytics and optimization tools (Mixpanel, Google Analytics, etc.)Experience in designing and setting up experiments to analyze the impact of new products and features a plus (hypothesis testing, multivariate analysis, or Bayesian)Experience working with developersExperience with Python or some other programming or scripting languageFamiliarity with version-control systems such as Git Experience with a BI transformation tool such as DBT a plusFamiliarity with *nix environment including Descripci√≥n:
Do you want to be part of a worldwide mobile games leader? We are an international team of more than 330 talented SocialPointers , based in sunny & cosmopolitan Barcelona . We create amazing games, positioned in the top rankings of both iOS & Android, that are played & loved by over 50 million fans all over the world.
In 2017 we were acquired by Take Two Interactive (GTA, Bioshock, Red Dead Redemption, NBA, XCom...) & we have been expanding our activities ever since, as well as creating exciting new opportunities for super talented people to join our teams!
Join the challenge & help us make this year the breakout year in mobile social gaming.
We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Game Data Analyst/Scientist in our Analytics team , where you will work to understand our gamers‚Äô behaviour, work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion.
Applying quantitative analysis, statistics & programming , you‚Äôll draw business insights that add real value to Socialpoint. To truly make an impact you‚Äôll need to learn quickly & work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with our Game Teams & Heads of Product.
What will you do in Socialpoint?
Work with the Game Teams to provide insights into user behaviour and answer key business questions.
Perform hands-on research, data exploration and analysis .
Communicate, define and visualize analysis and results to senior stakeholders, including: Head of Analytics, VPs of Product, the CEOs and other C-level executives.
Acting as the liaison between product, game developers, data engineers and data scientists to ensure our data is precisely specified, understood and consistent.
Team up with other data scientists to lead projects on machine learning, behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Using predictive analytics to predict how users will react to changes in the Games.
What are we looking for?
3+ years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value, preferably in a mobile B2C business.
A Masters degree in a quantitative subject area (such as Statistics, Maths, or Social Sciences) from a leading university.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis.
Experience implementing data science models with Python, R or Matlab.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, experience presenting to business stakeholders.
A passion for turning data into actionable insights.
You are fluent in written and spoken English.
Solid skills visualising findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau, Looker or Chartio.
And you are ......
A passionate gamer, this is a must!
Creative and innovative, always looking for better ways to achieve our goals.
A fast learner, highly meticulous, a consummate professional. You bring value into any conversation you have.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win
Able to operate sensitively in multi-cultural environments and build effective working relationships.
What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?
Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we are working remotely until further notice. However, this hasn‚Äôt stopped us from offering these great benefits!
You‚Äôll get the newest & most powerful devices & equipment to work with , along with a Spotify Premium account.
An impressive 25 days annual leave, not including public holidays!
Private medical insurance , just in case!
Free Language Lessons.
People development is key for us: an amazing training budget just for you & our internal mobility program offers real growth opportunities!
Drop by our hairdresser ‚Äôs for a trim (& forget your wallet).
And whenever we go back to the office....
Monday breakfast + delicious daily lunch menus!
Want to stay in shape? We have a brand new gym, football & basketball teams along with a fantastic physiotherapist.
‚ÄúAn apple a day keeps the doctor away‚Äù so we get fresh fruit at the office every day!
Monthly events are there to get you to know your colleagues.
If you are new to sunny Barcelona you can also join our Newbies Club: we offer weekend activities once a month, Spanish lessons & help with all your boring paperwork!
The list just goes on & on... so get your game on & apply now!
Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You‚Äôre welcome on the team no matter where you‚Äôre from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It‚Äôs a trick question ‚Äì mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

Sector: Videojuegos
Descripci√≥n:
Do you want to be part of a worldwide mobile games leader? We are an international team of more than 330 talented SocialPointers , based in sunny & cosmopolitan Barcelona . We create amazing games, positioned in the top rankings of both iOS & Android, that are played & loved by over 50 million fans all over the world.

In 2017 we were acquired by Take Two Interactive (GTA, Bioshock, Red Dead Redemption, NBA, XCom...) & we have been expanding our activities ever since, as well as creating exciting new opportunities for super talented people to join our teams!

Join the challenge & help us make this year the breakout year in mobile social gaming.

We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Game Data Analyst/Scientist in our Analytics team, where you will work to understand our gamers' behaviour, work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion.

Applying quantitative analysis, statistics & programming, you'll draw business insights that add real value to Socialpoint. To truly make an impact you'll need to learn quickly & work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with our Game Teams & Heads of Product.

What will you do in Socialpoint?

Work with the Game Teams to provide insights into user behaviour and answer key business questions.
Perform hands-on research, data exploration and analysis .
Communicate, define and visualize analysis and results to senior stakeholders, including: Head of Analytics, VPs of Product, the CEOs and other C-level executives.
Acting as the liaison between product, game developers, data engineers and data scientists to ensure our data is precisely specified, understood and consistent.
Team up with other data scientists to lead projects on machine learning, behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Using predictive analytics to predict how users will react to changes in the Games.


What are we looking for?

3+ years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value, preferably in a mobile B2C business.
A Masters degree in a quantitative subject area (such as Statistics, Maths, or Social Sciences) from a leading university.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis.
Experience implementing data science models with Python, R or Matlab.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, experience presenting to business stakeholders.
A passion for turning data into actionable insights.
You are fluent in written and spoken English.
Solid skills visualising findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau, Looker or Chartio.

And you are ......

A passionate gamer, this is a must!
Creative and innovative, always looking for better ways to achieve our goals.
A fast learner, highly meticulous, a consummate professional. You bring value into any conversation you have.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win
Able to operate sensitively in multi-cultural environments and build effective working relationships.

What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?

Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we are working remotely until further notice. However, this hasn't stopped us from offering these great benefits!

You'll get the newest & most powerful devices & equipment to work with , along with a Spotify Premium account.
An impressive 25 days annual leave, not including public holidays!
Private medical insurance , just in case!
Free Language Lessons.
People development is key for us: an amazing training budget just for you & our internal mobility program offers real growth opportunities!
Drop by our hairdresser 's for a trim (& forget your wallet).

And whenever we go back to the office....

Monday breakfast + delicious daily lunch menus!
Want to stay in shape? We have a brand new gym, football & basketball teams along with a fantastic physiotherapist.
"An apple a day keeps the doctor away" so we get fresh fruit at the office every day!
Monthly events are there to get you to know your colleagues.
If you are new to sunny Barcelona you can also join our Newbies Club: we offer weekend activities once a month, Spanish lessons & help with all your boring paperwork!

The list just goes on & on... so get your game on & apply now!

Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You're welcome on the team no matter where you're from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It's a trick question - mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

Job purpose

Tech Data is at the forefront of enabling the IT channel transformation in how cloud is bought and sold in the small, medium and enterprise sized business segments. As a Business Analyst you will have the exciting opportunity to deliver on our cloud platforms strategy by identifying, vetting, and addressing business needs across Tech Data regions and empowering stakeholders by delivering documentation, demonstrations and training.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Capture, triage and document business needs by connecting with business stakeholders across regions.
Understand new business needs, quantify ROI and manage prioritization across multiple stakeholder requests.
Provide feedback on feature design during grooming, development and post-deployment.
Document functionality for business audiences, including Tech Data vendors and partners.
Create training material and deliver training sessions on new functionalities
Define UAT Test scenarios to be executed during Change Management activities and support business teams during UATs.
Support Product Marketing and Technical Writers with communications around new features.
Provide pre-sales support along with platform and vendor specialists. This including platform presentations to large partners and vendors in front of C-level audiences.

What You Will Need To Succeed In This Role
Experience and knowledge of software design methodologies and tools.
Excellent communication skills, with emphasis on written communications.
Able to work in a fast-paced and multi-tasking environment.
Comfortable working in an international, results driven organisation.
Ability to work effectively at all levels in an organization.
Ability to work as part of a team as well as independently.
Strategic and analytical skills.
Experience with the IT software distribution channel a plus (including large ISVs such as Microsoft, AWS, IBM, etc.)
Experience in e-commerce a plus.
Project management experience a plus.

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree preferred
3+ years of similar experience in a multinational environment.

Working Conditions
Occasional travel within EU and US.
Mostly a remote working position. 100% Remote working at this stage due to Covid.
The statements above are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. Other duties may be assigned as needed.

Cultural Competency Requirements
Within Tech Data diversity is one of our fundamental shared values. We are a multi-cultural environment and we pride ourselves on being a welcoming place of work where we celebrate inclusion and champion people from a multitude of backgrounds.

Join our team to connect the world with the power of technology!

It's rewarding to work at a company where YOU make a difference! If you're passionate about the ever-changing IT industry and enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative progressive environment, you'll thrive at Tech Data! Join our team to connect the world with the power of technology! Job Purpose
The Cloud Systems & Services team is responsible to optimize the business processes required for these businesses. This includes offering shared services through Tech Data owned Shared Service Center outsourced to service partners in EMEA.

The Marketplace and Process Analyst will work on projects designed to improve quality, reduce errors and design new operational business processes.

She /he will work with management, local sales teams, internal departments, platforms owners, IT teams, customers and vendors to gather and analyse information and make recommendations.

An important role for this consultant will be to work closely with Tech Data Country sales teams to ensure appropriate service levels are provided to Super Users, End Users, and Customers. The consultant will also work closely with vendors to ensure appropriate understanding, documentation, and use of their platforms as applicable. Other project orientated duties may be assigned as needed.

The Process analyst can be called upon to design new processes, such as a new automated system for billing and procurement or a new support service for a new platform. She/he should be able to analyse existing processes to reduce errors and breakdowns and improve quality. Process analysts also work on quality improvement projects and document business processes.

Solid understanding of eCommerce
Experience with evaluating ROI is a plus but not mandatory.
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to work autonomously and independently
An out of the box thinking mentality
Exceptional customer service orientation.
Be proficient in the use of analytic tools such as data gathering and analysis, spreadsheets, flow-charting and process diagramming.
Comfortable working in an international result driven project organisation.
Project Experience of Software Licensing, Support, or Customer Service functions definite advantage. Understanding of the IT Software / Services / SaaS industry are helpful
Technical Know-how / understanding on Tech Data tools such as: SAP, MS office products, hardware, and operating systems as well as knowledge of programming languages, diagnostic utilities, monitoring tools, etc is a plus.
IT Channel experience, Pan European distributors or Software vendor are a definite advantage
Significant experience working with large multinational accounts

Excel advance knowledge considered a plus but not mandatory

For this position, you will be expected to understand, communicate, and collaborate effectively with people across various identities and cultures.

Company DescriptionYouGov is an international research and data, analytics group.
Our mission is to supply a continuous stream of accurate data and insight into what the world thinks so that companies, governments and institutions can better serve the people and communities that sustain them.
We have the best data and the best tools. We continuously challenge conventional approaches to research, and we disrupt our industry to ensure that our clients always get the best solutions.
We are driven by a set of shared values. We are fast, fearless and innovative. We work diligently to get it right. We are guided by accuracy, ethics and proven methodologies. We trust each other and bring these values into everything that we do.
Job DescriptionYou will help build some of the largest and most innovative research data products in the world. YouGov has 20 years of historical survey data including billions of data points across dozens of countries. In this position, you will own how we structure, standardize, process, and analyze that data internally ‚Äî so that we can then build cutting edge data products for our external customers. You‚Äôll be building data models for our users for the years to come.
If you think of yourself as a ‚Äúdata generalist‚Äù or a ‚Äúdata wrangler,‚Äù this position is a perfect fit for you. This isn‚Äôt a position for a pure statistician, data modeler, or a machine learning specialist.
Every day will be very different than the day before. An example day might be something like this:
The night before, a user opened a ticket with a puzzling question about some metadata. Your morning starts with data detective work to identify the issue, and you discover an anomaly. You realize there‚Äôs a historical inconsistency in some metadata, so you write code in Python or R to parse out that metadata, clean it, and standardize it. Then you update ETLs to Redshift to reflect the new metadata, and you add functionality to the web-frontend tool you built to allow users to search through that metadata in a new way.

Responsibilities

Collect data from various data sources including survey instrument, APIs, and relational databases, including the tens of thousands of survey questions and billions of answers
Perform exploratory data analysis
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques
Develop scripts, workflows, and ETL pipelines for data pre-processing, cleaning and model inputs.
Deploy statistical models developed by senior data scientists into production environments, with a focus on accuracy, speed, and efficiency.
Build and maintain summary dashboards of key survey information for tracking purposes
Develop and deploy processes and tools to monitor and analyze pipeline performance and data accuracy

QualificationsDemonstrated Knowledge And Experience

2 years of Data Science experience, with an engineering focus
Demonstrated experience working cross-functionally with engineering, product, and data science teams
Experience with polling, surveys, and public opinion analysis preferred but not required
Technical Skills
Experience using Python and SQL; R helpful as well
Experience using tools such as Pandas to manipulate data and draw insights from data sets rapidly
Preferably, experience working as a data engineer/analyst in a cloud-based environment, using AWS (preferred), GCP or Azure
Ideally experience building small tools or interfaces for less technical users to interact with data
Soft Skills
You‚Äôre resourceful
You deal well with open ended problems (i.e., figuring out the right questions to ask about a data set) rather than being told exactly what to analyze or how to analyze it
You consider yourself to be an excellent ‚Äúdata wrangler‚Äù
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
A collaborative mindsetAdditional InformationThis role can be 100% remote.

At Equifax, we believe knowledge drives progress. As a global data, analytics and technology company, we play an essential role in the global economy by helping employers, employees, financial institutions and government agencies make critical decisions with greater confidence.

We work to help create seamless and positive experiences during life‚Äôs pivotal moments: applying for jobs or a mortgage, financing an education or buying a car. Our impact is real and to accomplish our goals we focus on nurturing our people for career advancement and their learning and development, supporting our next generation of leaders, maintaining an inclusive and diverse work environment, and regularly engaging and recognizing our employees. Regardless of location or role, the individual and collective work of our employees makes a difference and we are looking for talented team players to join us as we help people live their financial best.

The Perks of being an Equifax Employee?
We offer excellent compensation packages with high-reaching market salaries, pension, along with the works: comprehensive healthcare packages, schedule flexibility, collaborative work spaces, work from home opportunities, and organisational growth potential
What You‚Äôll Do
Requirements documentation by conducting application demonstrations with the team, documentation analysis, requirements sessions, documentation and analysis of process maps and description, creation of user stories, analysis of business tasks.
Critically evaluate the information obtained from various sources, unify differences, break down the information obtained at a high level in the detail necessary for the understanding of the stakeholders to identify the necessary requirements.
Proactive and collaborative communication with internal and external customers to analyze functional needs and requirements for the delivery of implementations including documentation such as: Requirements documents, epic documentation, user stories, data models, data mapping and interface designs.

Ability to work simultaneously on several initiatives and provide a weekly report of the activities in the templates used by the company.

Great verbal and written communication skills and ability to interact professionally with interlocutors of different levels in the company (executives, managers and specialists)
Collaborate with development teams, testers, delivery teams, and specialists to define and analyze technical vision.

University degree.
Solid experience in the application development and testing cycle.
