About Glovo:We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day. Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.Your work-life opportunity:Reporting to Global Head of Customer Experience (CX), you will be part of a small A-team of super-achievers, aiming to deconstruct, synthesize, and deploy initiatives to drive best-in-class customer experience. Ownership and Responsibilities will be given to you since Day 1. You will be 'thrown' at different tasks and problems that are identified as key areas for improvement that affects customer happiness. Learning curve will be steep as this role entails understanding all the touch points (and pain points) of the whole customer journey and be able to identify root causes and solutions to execute. Able to quickly grasp different process workflows, visualizing impact of different policies, and prioritize effectively amid converging needs, are therefore crucial for the role.The team is by nature cross-functional, so most of the time and energy are spent collaborating with multiple departments from Operations and Customer Service to Finance and Tech. Specifically this role will require a heavy collaboration with the Growth team for consumer/market research.Be a part of a team where you will:Manage & analyze customer feedback from multiple channels, e.g. NPS, Ratings & reviews, social media reviews, surveys, interviews, inbound customer interactions, etc,. to generate insights on customers‚Äô pain points and map them across the customer journeyTranslate business needs to insightful analyses for the Customer Experience team to make the right decisionIdentify opportunities to increase our customer experience at GlovoLiaise with the data science team - you will play a central, pivotal role in building reliable sources for data and insightsPropose strategic changes to the way we track, maintain and use dataYou have:2-5 years of work experience in a top-tier consulting firm, or in high-growth start-upsSQL proficiency as mandatory requirement and Amazon Redshift experience as highly valued; Knowledge in R, Python, looker, Google Analytics, BI Tools are considered a plus Demonstrated project management, market/consumer research & presentation skillsExperience on market/consumer behavior research and surveys (online, offline surveys, focus group interviews, etc)Problem-solving attitude, great communication and stakeholder management skillsEntrepreneurial drive and the ability to achieve goals in a fast paced environment complete your profileCuriosity by nature, have great attention to detail, and have the attitude and aptitude to make things betterFluency in English; any other language from EU, MENA, SSA is considered a plusExperience our Glovo Life benefits:Enticing Phantom Shares planAttractive Relocation package (if applicable ;))Comprehensive Private Health InsuranceCobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and foodFree monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!Discounted Gym membershipsFlexible working environmentWhat you‚Äôll find when working at Glovo:Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. Descripci√≥n:
General Electric Logistics Application Advisor and Data Analyst Barcelona , Spain Apply Now

As a member of the Outbound Logistics team, the analyst will perform in a hybrid role to link the scopes of Transport Management software application advisory and detailed logistics data analytics.

Job Description

Transport Management Software advisory

Get and maintain detailed knowledge about tailor made transport management system (RenTM) ‚Äì features, structure, principles, links, interfaces

Receive, communicate and track application bugs with software developer, drive solutions, be first level support for RenTM users in Europe

Organize and lead trainings of RenTM for new users (internal, external) and refresher sessions

Assess RenTM, server structure performance, identify and solve performance issues

Attend ongoing, new RenTM application developments in liaison with Program Manager, Business contacts and software developer. Ensure system changes are properly scoped (requirement defined)

Support business process translation into system requirements

Data analytics

Gather, process and maintain relevant Outbound Logistics data (focus: time, costs, quality level)

Create and maintain data queries manually, but also in RenTM and ERP applications (Oracle, Unifier, Tableau).

Regularly report data analyses and KPI dashboard maintenance to logistics and project management

Automize data analytics within existing software environment

Re-examine current practices considering changing business environment, parameters and requirements

Qualifications / Requirements

Relevant work experience in software application advisory, preferably transport management systems

Relevant work experience in data mining and operations data analytics, preferably logistics data

Work experience in business process management and development for measuring processes

university degree in information technologies, logistics or related subject to demonstrate applicable knowledge base

Proficiency in ERP operations, preferably Oracle applications to gather and analyze data

Clear thinking mindset to understand complex context and act adequately

Self-confident and persistent characteristics to get users trained and software bugs fixed

High communication skills with the ability to work with and through global, cross-functional teams (internal, external)

Expertise in virtual communication (Microsoft Teams, Skype for Business) for providing trainings and giving ad-hoc support sessions to users

Proven presentation and coaching skills to efficiently lead training session

Demonstrated ability to multitask and prioritize diverse tasks with a proven ability to meet hard deadlines

Fluent verbal and writing skills in English, and German or Spanish

If Contracted In Spain

Non-national candidates are responsible to know the minimum documentation requirements to be able to be contracted in country: NIE- Social Security Affiliation Number in Spain (NAF) and Bank Account in Spain. They must be in possession of them at the time of start hiring. GE will not sponsor this requirement.

Desired Characteristics

Experience in working at GE, knowledge of GE processes and business operations

Experience with Oracle business suite, Tableau, Unifier software applications

We are looking for a Technical Business Analyst that shares the same values of pragmatism, professionalism and transparency that we do. Currently, we are all working remotely due to Covid-19. As things start to return to normal, any travel would be restricted to your main office branch (London, Manchester or Barcelona) - we‚Äôre not a typical consultancy and won‚Äôt be asking you to travel all over the place! Any client work that is outside of these locations would be undertaken remotely.As a Technical Business Analyst at Codurance, you will be working closely with the client (both stakeholders and team members) and our craftspeople, acting as the link between both to ensure successful outcomes for all involved. As a result, this role will suit someone who thrives on building trust and relationships with others and fostering a collaborative working environment.
You‚Äôll be facilitating meetings and gathering requirements from stakeholders. You‚Äôll spend time identifying and analysing the problem space that we are working in. For our Software Modernisation projects, you‚Äôll be working with Subject Matter Experts to develop a shared understanding of existing systems, modeling the data and business processes. You‚Äôll help shape the roadmap of the engagement, and work in a collaborative manner with the team to help the project progress and achieve our goals.
This role is a great opportunity for someone who would like to develop and hone their analytical skills while working alongside supportive engineers and colleagues.

RequirementsWe‚Äôd Love To Hear From You If You

Have experience working in Agile environments, ideally collaborating with QA professionals to refine user stories with acceptance criteria that supports Behaviour Driven Development
Have an understanding and awareness of how technology enables business - the ability to identify and understand how different businesses work, without the requirement for extensive domain knowledge
Are comfortable with technically oriented tasks, such as analysing relational databases and preparing test data

It Would Be An Added Bonus (but Not Essential) If You

Are an excellent communicator and listener. You‚Äôll be one of our key people on client projects, engaging with stakeholders and liaising with technical and non-technical peers.

Have prior experience within a consultancy environment
Are able to read Java code

Benefits

Transparency - all of our salary bandings and company finances are available to everyone from day one.
Autonomy - got an idea? Form an Initiative Circle, take ownership, run with it, and see it through to delivery.
Our People - You‚Äôll be working alongside Craftspeople who share your interest in learning, whether that‚Äôs on a client project or contributing to our internal projects.
Personal Learning Budget - Access to Learnerbly, our online learning & development tool, to support your personal development and career progression here.
Training - No fixed training budget. So long as the course is relevant for the company and you'll do a lightning talk on the subject, we‚Äôre happy to pay for it.
Books - Found something interesting to read that doesn‚Äôt already live in our office or digital library? We‚Äôll cover book expenses - and ask to read it after you as well!
Private medical and dental insurance
Ticket restaurants (retribuci√≥n flexible)
Gym discountsEveryone should have the right to bring their whole self to work and be celebrated for who they are. Clarity‚Äôs mission is to bring social impact to markets. Our disruptive tech tool allows systematic measurement and optimization of the social impact of investment portfolios, and our proprietary methodology provides a deeper understanding of the needs of the population and gives a comprehensive view of how those needs are covered by different economic actors. Together, the tool and the methodology will improve the allocation of the World‚Äôs capital to human needs.
Clarity is working to become a global standard in social and environmental impact measurement. That‚Äôs where you come in!
We are looking for a Data Research Analyst that will help us build a reliable and scalable data base of sustainability information, through research on Companies‚Äô CSR and ESG indicators methodology and quality assurance processes.
The role provides an opportunity to understand the reporting standards that exist and how companies sustainability performance is measured.
LOCATION
Madrid or remote (part-time or full-time)

Key Responsibilities

Working as a Data Research Analyst you will be responsible for ensuring that we have the most accurate data, in order to provide the most reliable sustainability impact measurements. The Data Research Analyst role will include, but not be limited to, the following activities:

Conduct frequent research for procuring, verifying and processing data on Sustainability trends by browsing through various financial, exchange and government regulator websites and materials.
Review company-level sustainability issues including environmental, social and corporate governance practices and synthesize these findings into broader frameworks.
Adhere to quality assurance (QA) and quality control (QC) processes
Perform ad hoc team projects as needed.

Requirements

QUALIFICATIONS

Excellent oral and written English communication skills. (Minimum C1 level-proficient user). Other languages are a plus
At least a Bachelor‚Äôs degree - Finance, Economics, Accounting, Environmental Studies or similar field of study.
Basic to intermediate knowledge of MS Excel and/or database applications.
Strong analytical, organizational, problem-solving skills, with clear attention to detail.
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact.
Ability to work with complex data sets with consistently high levels of comprehension and to apply defined methodologies appropriately.

Desired Experience

Ideally experience with data collection and validation
Prior knowledge of corporate governance, ESG and/or financial markets is an advantage.Apply Now at Mustakbil.comThis job was originally posted on Mustakbil.com

Descripci√≥n:
About Returnly:At Returnly, we help brands that care about shopper loyalty offer better product returns. We are a financial technology services company that builds award-winning products that drive repurchase behavior and customer loyalty. We‚Äôre backed by smart money VCs in Fintech including some prominent members of the Paypal Mafia. Our headquarters are in San Francisco Financial District and we have offices in Chicago and Madrid. We are on a mission to de-risk online commerce and are building a team of amazingly talented people to help us do it.About the role:At Returnly, we value you as a whole person. We care about the skillset you bring to the table, but more importantly, we care about the kind of person you are and the culture and attitude that you bring. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will work with our Product, Marketing, Data Science, Sales, Customer Success, and Finance teams to define and create meaningful analyses to help drive revenue, fix processes, and monitor impact.

You will become an expert in our merchant and shopper data and seek to use that knowledge to provide an enhanced product experience using tools such as SQL, Python, Looker, statistics, machine learning, etc. This is a cross-functional role in which you‚Äôll work with the Director of Analytics as well as the CEO, CTO and other members of Leadership to help prioritize the data projects that will have the biggest impact for Returnly merchants and shoppers.What do we offer?RemotenessWe have an office, and we prefer seeing each other often, but we already had a healthy WFH culture before Covid-19 came so when it happened, we just switched to every-day WFH. However, we would prefer if you live in or near Madrid so when we open the office again it won‚Äôt be a problem for you to enjoy it.ScheduleWe have a very flexible approach to working hours. You can stop to go to the gym, get your little ones to or from school, meditate or do whatever you need or want. There is a need for a certain amount of overlap with Pacific Coast working hours needed for meetings and collaboration that does not fit into asynchronous communications, however we try to prioritise those, and your main collaborators are based on Spain. The eCommerce Business Analyst reports to the Team Head of eCommerce. He/she utilizes broad IT & in-depth business knowledge to help deliver eCommerce solutions for the Sika Group and its companies around the World.

Throughout iterative planning and analysis of requirements, the eCommerce Business Analyst must constantly ensure that the features and changes requested by the eCommerce Solution Users align with the product's business goals. Therefore, this role requires frequent interaction with international Customers, work closely with upper management and in close partnership with the eCommerce Project Manager(s).

What We Offer You

Capture requirements via Elicitation activities such as Requirement Gathering Interviews & Workshops, etc. Responsible for the end-2-end Change Request Management process and for conducting functional govern-ance meetings with eCommerce Solution Users to gather and assess the value, urgency, and risks associated with the Change Requests. Be involved in demo and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) sessions to confirm the correctness of previously elic-ited requirements and suggest the most appropriate way to meet the business needs in case of conflict or change. Perform regular reviews and analyses of current processes and create informative, actionable and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant trends and opportunities for improvement.

We Need Your Skills

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science/Information Technology or other advanced Technology degree. Several years of experience as an Analyst in large-scale complex eCommerce B2B projects. Proven experience and knowledge working with pricing procedures, condition types, pricing fields, etc. Exceptional interpersonal and excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. Extremely detail oriented and organized with strong problem-solving and time-management skills. Experience with SAP Hybris / Commerce Cloud and knowledge of SAP Sales & Distribution and Logistics Execu-tion modules will be highly desirable. Previous experience as Senior Developer, Architect and/or Product Owner will be highly desirable. IIBA-certified Business Analyst will be considered as an advantage. Occasional travel could be necessary (up to 10%).

Building Trust Every Day

Trust is the most important thing for us. We trust in the capabilities of all our Sika team members and reward them with freedom and empowerment ‚Äì every day We offer intensive training and interesting perspectives for anyone who wants to build a career The chance to bring new ideas, interesting areas for development, and taking responsibility early on are some of the key factors that drive Sika's pioneering spirit

Puesto ofertado: Data Analyst / Scientist - F2P Mobile Games - Barcelona
Sector: Software Internet Videojuegos
Descripci√≥n:
Job ID: #24580 - Posted: 2 days ago

This vacancy may offer a work-from-home start until it‚Äôs safe to work in-house or relocate to the location.

OPM are proud to be working with one of the worldwide leaders in mobile games with an incredibly talented international team based in the diverse and beautiful city of Barcelona. They are looking for a Data Analyst / Scientist to join their team.

The successful candidate will work to understand their gamers‚Äô behaviour, work with the game teams to enhance the product, drive retention & user conversion. You will gain business insights that provide real value to the company by applying quantitative analysis, statistics & programming

Requirements

Strong experience utilising analytics to solve business questions and mine for insights that drive value, preferably in mobile games. A Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative subject area such as Statistics, Maths, or Social Sciences. Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics and experience in empirical analysis. Professional experience implementing data science models using Python, R or Matlab. Fluent English communication skills, with experience presenting to business stakeholders. Passionate about turning data into actionable insights. Strong ability with front-end visualisation tools like Tableau, Looker or Chartio. Deep passion for games and the games industry. Pragmatic, you know how to balance short- and long-term deliverables.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with Game Teams to provide insights into user behaviour and solve business questions. Perform hands-on research, data exploration and analysis. Communicate, define, and visualise analysis and results to senior stakeholders, including the Head of Analytics, VPs of Product, the CEOs, and other C-level executives. Act as the connection between product, game developers, data engineers and data scientists to ensure their data is precisely specified, understood and reliable. Cooperate with other data scientists to lead projects on machine learning, behavioural segmentation, and monetisation. Using predictive analytics to predict how users will react to adjustments in the Games.

25 days annual leave, not including public holidays. Private medical insurance. Monday breakfast and a delicious daily lunch menu. Brand new gym, football and basketball teams with onsite physiotherapist.

Descripci√≥n:
Landbot is a no-code communication automation platform that empowers non-technical users to automate business processes through conversational experiences. COVID19 is accelerating digitalization at both the consumer and enterprise level, so the adoption of communication automation solutions therefore is skyrocketing.

In three years Landbot has gone from a chatbot builder MVP to a product with thousands of recurring customers who use it daily to get more and better leads across the whole world. This is possible thanks to our builder, a centerpiece of the product, which allows non-technical people to build engaging conversational experiences.

What's the opportunity

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst to become a centerpiece in the company as the first member in the Business Intelligence Team.

You‚Äôll work together with all departments (Marketing, Sales, Product, Finance...) in order to build a data-driven culture and improve our performance.

You‚Äôre excited to switch between working with sales and customer success team to minimize churn one day, marketing to set up their attribution tracking systems the next, while structuring the product analytics team the other day.

You‚Äôre intimately familiar with the technical side of business intelligence work, but at the same time are able to think on a company-wide, strategic level.

You will be responsible to setup the foundation for data frameworks, resources and tools with freedom to define such centerpieces at the company level.

Understand the business needs and produce insightful analyses for sales, marketing and product teams. Act as an internal consultant to translate business questions such as "what is the effect of one product change over other KPI‚Äôs" into insights and opportunities. Build robust relationships with key business stakeholders. Help colleagues to access to the right data and understand what it reveals. Create hypothesis, collect data to either support or disprove the hypothesis and recommend solutions to help move a metric. Identify business opportunities based on a combination of internal and external data sets. Synthesize complex data and present clear recommendations to senior management.
Job requirements
4+ years in a similar role at a SaaS company. Deep understanding of SaaS business and metrics to provide KPI insights and data guidance. Degree ideally in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Computer Science or related degree or Economics/Business. Strong knowledge of SQL ‚Äì optimization of big data queries and Airflow are a plus. Knowledge of Data Modelling, be able to program in Python and/or R. Extremely organized with the ability to work on and manage multiple projects within tight timelines. Proven track record of defining and executing key analysis with minimal supervision. Strong attention to detail. The ability to data mine across a large and varied business area or key priority for the company. Great reporting skills being able to transform data into intuitive dashboards, reports and insights. Very strong communicator, both written & verbally. You are fluent in English and Spanish (it's a must). Eligibility to work in Spain

Descripci√≥n:
It's rewarding to work at a company where YOU make a difference! If you're passionate about the ever-changing IT industry and enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative progressive environment, you'll thrive at Tech Data! Join our team to connect the world with the power of technology!
E-commerce environment

Tech Data offers several e-commerce solutions to allow its customers to purchase manage and resell Software products and Cloud Services. These solutions include online configuration and ordering tools, but also integrated solution (e-business). Tech Data sells over 1Billion USD software through these e-commerce solutions. Our latest releases include a marketplace for Cloud Services, a White Labelled eCommerce solution, and an API factory for both customers and vendors.

Cloud Systems & Operations team

The Cloud Systems & Operations team is the owner of these e-commerce solutions. It is responsible to define the development roadmap and the operational processes for these systems. The team is also responsible to roll-out these solutions to all Tech Data entities in Europe (17 countries)

Job Purpose

The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible of defining; deploying, managing and optimizing the business processes required for all aftersales cloud services. The analyst will analyse and segment customers in country, the products they purchase, and establish an accurate tracking of migration activities for each customer group. This analyst will contribute to the offering of shared services through Tech Data owned Shared Service Center outsourced to service partners.

The team collaborates with all of Tech Data's Business Unit leaders and their key partners to develop the right strategies and strive to deliver best in class systems and operations with maximum impact and synergy across Europe.

Responsibilities
Assess business analysis needs along with TD stakeholders and cloud team mates.
Define, deploy, manage and optimize business analytics for TD Cloud Business across Europe (Order Monitoring, Credit Health, Vendor SLAs, Order Fixing, Billing, Reporting‚Ä¶)
Update, maintain and improve actual reports.
Create new reports, KPI, forecasts, etc. in order to fulfil business needs.
Document all processes accordingly.
Define KPIs/SLAs. Measure and share results.
Manage constant communication with vendors and TD stakeholders

Knowledge Skills and Experience

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.
Solid understanding of E-commerce
Solid MSFT Excel knowledge and experience.
Strategic, financial and analytical skills
Experience managing large amounts of data.
Strong statistical knowledge.
An out of the box thinking mentality
Capable of working independently, and having responsibility as an individual (ownership)
Comfortable working in an international results driven project organisation.
Able to work constructively under stress and pressure as well as in a multitasking environment.
Understanding of the IT Software / Services / SaaS industry are a definite advantage
Project Experience of Software Licensing and Cloud management sales tools a definite advantage
IT Channel experience, preferably in TD, IM, other Pan European distributors or Software vendor are a definite advantage
Working Conditions:
Occasionally travel within Europe.
Normal, professional office environment

Are you passionate about leveraging data to deliver actionable insight that impacts daily business decision of Amazon in a promising new market segment?Does the prospect of dealing with massive volume of data excite you?Amazon is seeking a Transportation Performance Analyst to join Amazon's European Special Handling (EU SH) team. EU SH team is responsible for the end-to-end Heavy/Bulky journey in the fulfilment, supply chain and transportation daily business and its strategic vision in Europe.Amazon has culture of data-driven decision-making, and demands business intelligence that is timely, accurate, and actionable. During our day to day operations, tons of data is generated which is leveraged to take our important business decisions.Our ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, relishes working with large transactional volumes and big data, enjoys the challenge of highly complex business contexts (that are typically being defined in real-time), and, above all else, is passionate about data and analytics.As an Analyst you will be developing SQL/ETL queries, accessing data warehouse and redshift clusters, creating automated reports through macros, creating relevant KPIs and metrics for performance of team as well as for transportation operations. Publish daily/weekly performance reports. You will give us business insights based upon data to further improve our operations and processes.A successful candidate knows and loves working with business intelligence tools, is comfortable accessing and working with big data from multiple sources, and passionately partners with the business to identify strategic opportunities and deliver results.You should have an internal drive to answer ‚Äúwhy?‚Äù questions, excellent analytical abilities and strong technical skills.Responsibilities:- Create metrics, performance dashboards and reports- Drive root cause analysis- Engage with cross-functional teams and/or carriers/vendors for implementation of project/program requirements- Managing multiple projects/initiatives- Communication at all levels with the ability to present information professionally & concisely with supporting dataBasic qualifications- VBA, SQL or other coding experience to support automation initiatives- Working experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Quicksight.Preferred qualification - Experience in business process improvement, Lean/Six Sigma- Proven independent decision making skills in an often times ambiguous environment.- Ability to think quantitatively and qualitatively about operating processes and outcomes- Previous experience within transportation or logistics.Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success.We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Descripci√≥n:
The vente-privee group has consolidated its various European brands, together made up of 6000 employees, under one unified conglomerate: Veepee. This coalescence marks a new chapter in its European history. With Privalia, vente-exclusive, Designer & Friends, Zlotewyprzedaze, Eboutic and vente-privee, Veepee achieved a 3.7 billion Euro turnover as of 2018. Present in 14 countries now, Veepee is taking a leading role in the European digital commerce landscape. Our 6000 employees have chosen a job at Veepee to spice up their daily lives! Our teams implement new technologies to fuel our strategies, offering our customers the best possible experience. Are you eager to learn? Veepee offers you a variety of trades to develop your career, enabling you to renew your skills constantly. Tech, logistics, sales, marketing, sales production: join us on an exciting, digital-centered journey. In 2018 we launched - the IT community of Veepee. Our teams are widely distributed within the offices in Paris, Lyon, Nantes, Nice, Barcelona, Brussels, Warsaw, Amsterdam and Tel-Aviv. Veepee is currently in a context of convergence of the three main IS of vente-privee, privalia and vente-exclusive. As a Business & Data Analyst in vpTech you will be a part of the Finance Tribe, to develop the new B2C billing factory and ensure the legacy one keeps on working properly. You will be in contact with: - business key users of Finance around EU to collect group and local requirements and use cases, provide data extracted for different systems, analyse issues and fix data - developers (based in France) to provide user stories and to test the deliverables Your main challenge will be to understand the current model, the group products organisation and their interactions to have a strong understanding about the context and be able to define and execute the roadmap of the product in coordination with the Product Owner.

Main Requirements
2 years of experience as a business analyst, Proxy Product Owner, project manager or developer
Redactional and organisational skills (backlog management, specifications, tickets creation, minutes of meetings, flow charts process designs)
Good knowledge of SQL (SQL Server, PostGreSQL) and reporting tools (SSRS)
To have a strong interest for analysis, identification of anomalies and research of solutions
Ability to challenge and find different ways to bring value to business areas
Proactive, organized and team player: you know how to make things happen and you have convictions
Strong interest for business flows, products and new technologies
Passionate and result oriented
Good english level - speaking and writing
Would Be a Plus
Knowledge of Atlassian suite (Jira, Confluence)
Accountancy basic knowledges (in particular in Account Receivables)
Background on Finance Tools
Knowledge of noSQL db (ElasticSearch)
Knowledge of product management and agile method
What we offer: Dynamic and creative environment within international teams The variety of self-education courses on our e-learning platform The participation in meetups and conferences locally and internationally Up to 2-3 days remote per week (now we are working remotely) Video games, beer and quizz parties with colleagues Offices in Barcelona Located in Poblenou @22 Flexible retribution package (including Medical Insurance) Autonomy is a key to success in . We are boosting the innovation at every step of product development inside Veepee. In order to reach the group goals in the best and the most efficient way, we stick to the feature team-based structure. Hence, most of our teams are autonomous and self-managed when it comes to choosing the tech stack and determining the road map. So, if you are driven by the quality and teamwork, if you want to make an impact, to learn and share knowledge, to be a part of the fast-paced digital environment, check out our tech stack below https://careers.veepee.com/en/vptech/ and start your journey. https://careers.veepee.com/en/vptech/

Descripci√≥n:
Hi, we're Fever!

Fever is the leading entertainment discovery platform, with a mission to inspire people through experiences. We are looking for bar-raisers who want to work hard, have fun, and make history with us. Fever combines its marketplace and Secret Media Network (such as Secret London, Secret NYC, Secret Los Angeles, Madrid Secreto, Paris Secret) through technology to reach over 30 million people every single week. Fever has also rolled out Fever Originals, which are proprietary events in which we follow a data-driven content creation strategy, using analytics to understand audiences and develop new, unique experiences.

Fever is present in over 80 cities worldwide, in countries such as the UK, US, France, Brazil, Portugal, Australia, and Spain, and is always in the process of expanding to new markets. Fever is also backed by top-notch institutional investors, including Rakuten Capital, Accel, and Atresmedia. We have continued to disrupt the entertainment space during the pandemic, and launched the Stranger Things Drive Into ? the largest event in the world in 2020!

Required Skills And Experience

You're a bilingual English speaker.
At least 2 years of working experience in data science or analytics in a MEDIA FIELD. College degree in a STEM field is preferable. Master?s degree is ideal.
Proficiency with Python or R and SQL. - or HIGHLY RECO.
Proficient in data visualization
Familiarity with marketing, social and analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Google Ads Manager, Facebook Analytics, Tubular, YouTube, Snapchat etc. is a MUST/HIGHLY RECO.
Strong data story-telling ability to be able to turn observations into insights and communicate them clearly.
Ability to problem solve, think critically, and deliver a consistent, premium product/output to stakeholders.
Candidates should be organized, detail-oriented, data driven, curious to uncover data insights and should be comfortable working in a collaborative setting.

Responsibilities

Provide access to data through dashboards, reports, data pipelines and data analysis
Research new and innovative ways to make a business impact and test hypotheses that could drive business value.
Analyse and model big data to set goals and recommend actions that drive business decisions
Point data users in the right direction as to what data is available and how to use/interpret the data
Work with data scientists and engineers to define a data collection strategy
Implement data validation processes to ensure data quality
Develop a data-driven understanding of categories, formats, and creative tactics that make content successful

PLUS

Deliver data-driven, creative and insightful solutions to a global Editorial team (more than 30 editors) across various platforms
Proven ability to translate data and metrics into actionable creative recommendations; Equally capable of creative and analytical thinking
Knowledge of how content variables, target audiences, and distribution methods all affect content performance, and an ability to create recommendations that balance and optimize the three in parallel

SUCCESS WILL LOOK LIKE

Broaden reach, awareness, recognition, connection and favorability among audiences
Surpass benchmarks across platforms, franchises and campaigns
Deliver data-driven, creative and insightful solutions to Editorial across various platforms
Maintain open communication between Publishing, Editorial, and the Data Team
Establish new partners, events and strategies to push content to new audiences

Benefits

Opportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader
40% discount on all Fever events and experiences
Work in a location in the heart of Madrid, with possible travel across our markets
Home office friendly and flexible schedule
Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth
Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with!
English lessons
Free fruit and drinks!

About The Role

Our EMEA Data Team requires an Associate Data Research Analyst to process our data across global markets. We are a team of data analysts who have effective relationships with other teams and are committed to deliver best quality data. As a Data Research Analyst in the Data Division, you will need to work closely with the global Operation and Document Team and Local Business Representatives, taking responsibility for data coverage, quality, and timeliness to the highest standards. The Operation Data Analyst will form closer links with providers related to data acquisition processes and gain expert knowledge of our database. The position will be based in our Data and Development Center EMEA and will report to the Leader of the Data Operation Team.

Job Responsibilities

Collaborate strongly with the global data teams
Meet the predetermined production deadlines for internal and external clients
Continuously evaluate procedures, create and enhance analytical tools, and implement process improvement projects.
Using project management methodology such as LEAN Six Sigma to track, evaluate and determine resolution approach for complex data issues.
Collect and maintain Morningstar data, ensuring high levels of data accuracy, completeness and coverage.
Act as an expert regarding investment data points and calculations including new financial market trends
Demonstrate a high sense of ownership of the issues in the data ticket queue to be responsive and provide timely updates, follow-up, expedition, and resolution.
Understand roles, responsibilities, and expertise of internal partners to expedite issue resolution.
Translate requests from internal clients into detailed written specifications and user stories.
Develop/document client use cases to ensure any new functionality meets and exceeds client expectations.

Qualifications

A bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent is required
Proficient oral and written communication skills. Fluent in English and French and at least another European language are required.
Collaborates well in a team environment, have the ability to communicate and work with team members from diverse backgrounds, in a conscientious and inclusive way.
Sensitive to clients‚Äô needs
Solid understanding of the financial industry and passionate about investment data.
Excellent organizational and time-management skills, capable of handling high volumes of data and meeting strict deadlines
Solid analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate large amounts of data with attention to detail and accuracy
You will be collaborating with cross functional teams and leading from the front when it comes to Operational data so experience within data methodology/quality and processes is a big bonus.

Previous Experience In Project Management Is Preferred.

Knowledge about Microsoft Excel

Boston Scientific is dedicated to transforming lives through innovative medical solutions that improve the health of patients around the world.

Boston Scientific transforms lives through innovative medical solutions that improve the health of patients around the world. Our culture and values are what differentiate us from other companies, and we‚Äôre very proud of who we are as a company. Today, we're 36,000 colleagues strong, with an impressive portfolio of 15,000 products. We‚Äôre at the forefront of the medical device industry-leading, evolving, and transforming it into bolder and more amazing territories. Our principles power our performance, and together, we turn our shared vision into value. For our patients. And our employees

With the increasing demand for affordable healthcare services and growing requirement for innovative medical devices, it has become pertinent for us, to increase our Health Economics & Market Access function.

In this context, we are looking for talented Health Economics and Market Access (HEMA) professionals who will be support the development and execution of effective health economics, reimbursement and market access strategies for Boston Scientific‚Äôs in close collaboration with internal and external teams.

Your Responsibilities Could Include

Lead development and execution of practical strategies to secure optimal reimbursement (coding/coverage/payment) for Boston Scientific products and procedures Lead implementation of tactical planning activities required to achieve reimbursement objectives (e.g., new code applications, customer billing guides).

Monitor policy developments that impact the reimbursement of BSC products. Build relationships in key markets with government, physician, hospital, and third-party payer decision makers.
Establish and support a work environment of continuous improvement that supports BSC‚Äôs Quality Policy, Quality System and the appropriate regulations for the area they support. Ensure all employees are trained to do their work and their training is documented.

What We Are Looking For In You
Solid work experience involving leadership of functional and cross-functional teams
Experience in health policy, market access, reimbursement, health economics and/or outcomes research
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, including demonstrated ability to develop relationships at all levels in an organization

What We Can Offer To You

About Us

As a global medical technology leader for more than 35 years, our mission at Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) is to transform lives through innovative medical solutions that improve the health of patients. If you‚Äôre looking to truly make a difference to people both around the world and around the corner, there‚Äôs no better place to make it happen.

Ryanair Holdings plc, Europe‚Äôs largest airline group, is the parent company of Buzz, Lauda, Malta Air & Ryanair DAC. Carrying over 154 m guests p.a. on more than 2,400 daily flights from 82 bases, the group connects over 200 destinations in 40 countries on a fleet of over 475 aircraft, with a further 210 Boeing 737‚Äôs on order, which will enable the Ryanair Group to lower fares and grow traffic to 200m p.a. by FY24. Ryanair has a team of over 19,000 highly skilled aviation professionals delivering Europe‚Äôs No.1 on-time performance, and an industry leading 34-year safety record. Ryanair is Europe‚Äôs greenest cleanest airline group and customers switching to fly Ryanair can reduce their CO‚ÇÇ emissions by up to 50% compared to the other Big 4 EU major airlines.

The Role

The role of the Digital Business Analyst is to understand and drive the product development of Ryanair‚Äôs platforms. You will be tasked with working with multiple stakeholders across the business in order to gather and document project requirements and to assist in the development process of Ryanair.com. This temporary (maternity cover) position will be based in Madrid, in Ryanair Labs Madrid, that provides services for Ryanair.

Responsibilities
Meet and work directly with stakeholders to define project requirements.
Collect and analyse business needs and translate into clear requirements for the development teams.
Translate high-level business requirements into robust functional specifications that are supported by user story boards/user cases.
Work closely with Product Owner, Scrum Master and UX/UI designers on use cases
Manage product backlogs and work with development team to drive delivery of value
Drive business analyst‚Äôs best practice to ensure high quality output is achieved

Requirements
Strong experience of Process Design and Business Analysis
Experience of working with Product teams and UX/UI designers an advantage
1/3 years of writing requirements documents and other software development materials
Experience of working in and agile, fast-paced consumer centric ecommerce environment.
Experience of working on major consumer interfacing websites an advantage
Strong hands-on Stakeholder Management
Excellent Document writing and detailed process understanding
Communicating and Influencing
Formalised training in Project Management or Process/Lean desirable

Benefits

Flight Benefits

Makers of the new - DuPont is elevating our commitment and reinventing the ways in which we shape the world. From new kinds of nourishment for the world‚Äôs infants to new technologies that enable life-giving medical care. This is how, together with our partners, we will foster sustainable progress for generations to come.
Our Information Technology organization is recruiting for a Business Data Specialist in Asturias, Spain. This position will participate in a cross-functional, global team environment as a member of the Enterprise Data Solutions Delivery organization, responsible for supporting global design, realization, implementation and deployment of data management solutions (processes, tools and controls).
Key Responsabilities
Drive standardization, simplification, harmonization and improvement of master data and related E2E (end-to-end) processes to ensure maximum benefit is derived.Champion governance, alignment, and communication of Best Practices across the master data related business processes.Identify opportunities to streamline the strategic data management processes to support standardization, simplification and consistency in data across channels and regions.Develop business case for business process changes/improvements.Assist data project teams by providing in-depth technical and/or SAP functional knowledge needed to resolve highly complex issues. Lead the way as we migrate to new technical tools and software. Responsible for promoting standards and best practices within and across groups.Work with data project leader in defining project plans, setting milestones, and estimating completion dates. Investigate technical and software-related problems, analyze, and recommend solutions. Explain resolution and impact to clients in terms they will understand.Develop technology-driven processes to automate strategic data management process and more accurately track benefit realization.Develop reports to support data management execution and measurement of adherence to key data standards.Assure that business key information and systems requirements are met by preparing all other external documentation above and beyond program and job source documentation. May meet with clients and/or business analysts to assist in defining business needs and ensure the development of quality applications maintaining data integrity.Perform any other essential duties as assigned.
Calificaciones What you need to succeed
Bachelor's degree and over 10 years of experience in a Business Process Analyst or closely related role, with technical expertise in SAP.Basic understanding of an entire horizontal process chain. In-depth understanding of some processes and how they work in SAP, in particular those consuming Vendor and/or Material Master data.Knowledge of database management concepts.Proficiency in English.
Skills, Knowledge & Abilities
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; strategic thinker.Ability to work independently and in a team.Strong oral, written and interpersonal communications skills. Strong project management capabilities (PMP certification valued).Modeling capabilities, including experience developing, defending and refining models.Exposure to take an active role at direct and indirect teams in managing, cleansing and consolidating large data sets from various sources.Demonstrated ability to drive results and measure business impact.

About Glovo:We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.Your work-life opportunity:Cook Room is our delivery-only kitchen vertical: we provide a shared-kitchen facility to our restaurant partners to support their expansion while making delicious and diverse types of cuisines available for our customers everywhere!In response to the rapid growth in consumer demand for restaurant delivery meals, combined with the lower costs incurred by using these facilities, the demand for such solutions is booming. We are looking for a Cook Room Operations Sr. Analyst that will support us in scaling this exciting vertical!The successful candidate must be a self-starter, results-oriented, analytical and also be passionate about kitchen innovation and entrepreneurship.Do you want to evolve in one of the fastest growing Start-ups of Europe, building a product that will change people¬¥s day-to-day and disrupt the on-demand market?Be a part of a team where you will:Be the owner of the kitchen operational metrics of Cook Rooms at global level and seek continuous improvement implementing new tools and protocols Be the Global advisor for Cook Room infrastructure: design definition, equipment, area distribution, etc. Be a master in kitchen operations - perform local audits to spot kitchen inefficiencies and improve processes to reduce costs.Responsible for controlling operational & capital kitchen expenditures globallySupport local teams in kitchen operators recruitment & training. Building tools to measure & track performance. Seek constant kitchen innovation, identifying quick wins, run pilots and scale success globally. Leveraging tech solution to increase efficiency Supervise the maintenance of the working environment ensuring best-in-class hygiene and safety standardsProfessional English is a must, other languages is a plusYou have:5+ years of experience in high demanding positions, including exposure to construction and roll-out of a retail or food & beverage environment (kitchens/restaurant operations or QSR management, would be highly desirable). Strong analytical skills are a mustPassionate about Innovation & operational excellence360 mindset and hands-on attitude: you‚Äôll have to roll up your sleeves! Strong organisational and project management skills, ability to prioritise and multitask, work well under pressure, handle multiple issues simultaneously in a dynamic environment.Ability to leverage day-to-day on-site operations to build Cook Room long term strategy Out of the box thinker and high level of self-initiative (proactive in finding new solutions to new issues).Excel/Google sheets proficiencyProfessional English is a must, other languages is a plusKnowledge in food safety is a plus Nice-to-haves:Experience in setting up strategy and growth models for new businessesPassionate about analytics: you enjoy deep diving into problems to find the root causeAbility to influence stakeholdersExperience our Glovo Life benefits:Enticing Phantom Shares planAttractive Relocation package (if applicable ;))Comprehensive Private Health InsuranceCobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and foodFree monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!Discounted Gym membershipsFlexible working environmentWhat you‚Äôll find when working at Glovo:Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.Glownership:We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of 2020, we‚Äôre currently present in more than 22 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia. For additional information on Glovo, please visit

Are you ready to go further?

Reliable. Competent. Thanks to mutual cooperation, we ensure that a healthy optimum is always attained, both professionally and personally. These qualities have turned the HARTMANN GROUP into one of the leading international providers of medical and hygiene products. The secret of our success? Scope for development. We offer our just over 10,000 employees in more than 30 countries the opportunity of participating in shaping our common future. Take advantage of your new scope of action in the Marketing Area at LABORATORIOS HARTMANN S.A. in Matar√≥.

Data Analyst

Responsibilities

Your area of responsibility:

Prepare data analysis in order to have proper decisions. Demonstrate a ?hands-on? approach as the Data Expert for the sales & marketing team (external and internal base info for the business management). Implementation of business intelligence tools. Help on Sap Analytics Cloud rollout. Act as L2 support in Salesforce (train teams on new functionalities, detect data gaps, escalate issues if exist). Develop Business Intelligence culture around the organization.

Bachelor?s degree in Statics, Mathematics, Economics or Political Science. Master?s degree with a focus on Data Analysis (Data Science, Data Analytics or Big Data). Computer Knowledge of compliance Salesforce, SAP Analytics cloud, Excel, Minitab and SPSS. Fluent communication skills in English Minimum 1-2 years of experience as a Data Analyst. Experience in working on international teams. Good communication skills with the ability to train. Proven consulting skills with the ability to align technical proposals with business strategy. Good people skills with experience of work with teams in a matrix organization.

Are you ready for an internationally successful company? Do you appreciate the benefits of an outstanding market position? Then start your career at HARTMANN now. With us, attractive framework conditions and excellent training opportunities await you. After all, our greatest potential is your personal development.

AbbVie‚Äôs mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people‚Äôs lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women‚Äôs health and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.

Job Description

PepsiCo is embarking on a number of initiatives to make us more efficient and agile as a company. One key initiative is to harmonise our core business processes and common data, enabled by the latest SAP technology.

We want people who get excited at the thought of shaping a challenging project and creating agile and harmonised processes. If this sounds like you and you have an interest in SAP (S4 Hana) then read on.

The Senior Data Analyst role will support the migration of data from the legacy system to SAP target systems, as well as liaising with local data leads, legacy experts and project data and functional resources. In addition you will have hands on end-to-end data conversion experience for large SAP IT projects.

You must have previous experience as an SAP Data Migration Analyst (minimum 2-3 SAP Full Implementation experience), and strong knowledge of SAP SD, MM, P2P, OTC and FICO In addition to this, you will have strong experience in data cleansing tools, processed and procedures to support data preparation and migration activities

Qualifications/Requirements

Senior Person with minimum 10 years experience in SAP in Quality Management

End to End Data Migration experience ‚Äì Minimum 2-3 full implementations ‚Äì Markets, Manufacturing Sites

Responsible for successfully and sustainably supporting the data elements of the new Global Template harmonised processes and data for all Value Streams utilising support available from Data Lead & Global Process Experts, IT, Value Stream Leads, Data CoE team and super network users in all markets

Role will cover customer, supplier, material, pricing, BOM and other required data objects in scope

Support Data Lead in all Data training and support change management for Value Stream Teams, first wave markets and DMO set up

Solid understanding of Core Business processes and usage of data

Solid understanding of data structures in SAP, metadata and dependency of data objects

Strong knowledge of master data management

Provide regular updates to the Data Lead & Project leadership on Time/Cost/Quality risks and mitigations

Knowledge of a FMCG process in your functional area (desirable)

Experience with Agile/Scrum processes (desirable)

Positive, resilient and motivated to change and simplify processes

Ability to perform and prioritise under pressure

Meticulous and organised

Commercially minded and a passion to take others with you

Experience of project work and/or implementing change management in a multinational environment

Comfortable with ambiguity and able to move forward or seek answers regardless

Hunger and Drive to succeed and challenge stakeholders to ensure best practice

Who We Are

Vistaprint‚Äôs Data and Analytics (DnA) organization is working to make our company one of the world‚Äôs most well-known and successful data-driven companies. The cross-functional team includes product owners, analysts, technologists, data engineers and more ‚Äì all focused on providing Vistaprint with information and tools we can use to deliver jaw-dropping customer value. DnA team members are empowered to learn new skills, communicate openly and be active problem-solvers.

What You Will Do
Be immersed in diverse teams (e.g., Product Owners, Marketing, Developers) where you will collaborate on analyses and continually bring forward ideas and insights to drive value for our customers
Support Agile Campaigning and Reading test results to inform personalization strategy and testing roadmap.
Be a part of the overall CRM team providing insights and analysis to drive better customer experiences - across channels and touchpoints
Data Exploration, Visualization, and Dashboarding. Identify trends and drivers, perform exploratory data analyses and present views that will provide visibility into our performance.
Data Analysis and Modeling. Incorporate multiple data sources and methodologies to find opportunities to drive marketing efficiency in our advertising and improve the customer experience to acquire valuable customers and promote repeat shopping behavior.
Design and execute a/b/n tests to optimize the customer experience and analyze results to provide insightful recommendations to the business. Support customer lifecycle flow tests with long-term reads in addition to A/B testing. Experience with Optimizely and customer lifecycle marketing a plus.
Collaborating in a fast paced, agile environment that focuses on delivering customer value early and often
Your Qualifications:
Passionate about data and technology. You are proficient in SQL. Other programming languages (e.g., Python, R) are a plus. Experience with web analytic tools (i.e., Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics) a plus.
Inquisitive by nature. You are comfortable with exploratory analysis and statistical techniques and are driven to find meaningful patterns and trends in the data.You bring your perspective on results and seek ways to improve. Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Looker is a plus.
Experienced. 3+ years in an eCommerce environment and a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or related field.
Why You‚Äôll Love Working Here:
At Vistaprint, we put extraordinary importance into the wellbeing of our employees, which is why we offer perks that ensure an excellent work/life balance. Perks include language courses, flexible schedules, work from home capabilities, and very generous time off, including our outstanding sabbatical-like program, ‚ÄúVistabreak‚Äù, Summer hours and Public Holidays, to name a few!

About Us

As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vistaprint is a dynamic organization that maintains an exciting, entrepreneurial culture. With founder Robert Keane‚Äôs return as CEO, we‚Äôve renewed our focus on empowering and helping small businesses. To do this, we create customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We thrive on providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation and growth ‚Äì for both our customers and our team.

About Syngenta

Syngenta is a leading agriculture company helping to improve global food security by enabling millions of farmers to make better use of available resources. Through world class science and innovative crop solutions, our 28,000 people in over 90 countries are working to transform how crops are grown. We are committed to rescuing land from degradation, enhancing biodiversity and revitalizing rural communities.

Role Purpose
Responsible for new tools implementation, data management, analysis and data delivery to different crops involved within R&D Trials platforms in Spain.
Promote and implement new environmental data sets and processes in line with this role target, and agronomic practices. Responsible for environmental data capture, and equipment associated to it in order to support quantitative or qualitative data taken, providing analysis to different crops involved.
Coordination and supervision of operational data collection teams, ensuring good communication within the team and with the rest of the station's staff.
Monitoring of activities according to weekly planning, providing ideas and solutions to the different setbacks that can be generated in the activity
Operational team member of YPR-DC activities, so get hands on other activities when necessary, within department responsibilities.


Accountabilities

Resources
Weekly, monthly and annual planning in line with YPR & DC team availability.
Monitoring different processes within Data Collection activities, supporting YPR when necessary too.

Operations
Optimize data delivery (Quality, Quantity, and on Time).
Organize activity demands according to weekly planning to meet tasks and expectations.
Support projects at Veg R&D stations for better implementation processes.
Ensuring the implementation of existing new tools and supporting and implementing future tools that are being generated, providing ideas and solutions to get or adopt new ones.
Activelly proposing new team solutions (Smat sheets, pivot tables, macros, and continuous improvement mindset is required)

People
Responsible for ISO 9001:2008, GSPP and HSE protocols, ensuring and promoting compliance
Support the HSE manager and ensure secure operations.
Ensure the motivation and participation of the site community in collaboration with other features on the site. Positive and constructive.

Reports /Communication
Active report through visual performance boards
KPI‚Äôs tracking for data collection teams with an operational excellence mindset
Data delivery versus agreed deadlines.


Critical Skills
Data analysis experience, demonstrating his or her ability to manage tasks and personnel.
Advance English skill in order to communicate fluently within EAME Region
Handling Excel (create pivot, etc., Smart sheets Power BI, and a plus if computational Skills in place (Python, R, etc.)
Critical thinking, OpEx training and continuous improvement skills and mindset
Resource and coordinate temporary staff in order to get operational data

Critical knowledge
Knowledge in vegetable crops, computer science, data management and environmental data sets (sensors, remote communication, etc.)
Build working relationships between different functions (Breeders, Marketing, Sales and farm staff).
Standards implementations GSPP, ISO 9001 v2015, etc.

What We Do Matters

Here at The Knot Worldwide, we believe in doing work that matters. In 16 countries around the world, our leading family of brands (The Knot, WeddingWire, Bodas, Hitched, The Bash, The Bump, and more) inspire, inform, and celebrate our communities as they move through life‚Äôs milestones. Our couples and business partners depend on us. They're all in. So are we.

About The Role

This Data Analyst will work with the Ads & Growth team at TKWW. They will help the team understand performance by developing analytical tools and performing ad-hoc analysis. They will assist with product testing, modeling, data investigations, and visualizations. They will be a valued partner and trusted advisor.

Responsibilities
Analyze TKWW user behavior and identify growth opportunities to drive acquisition and product engagement
Identify key trends and areas of opportunity for product and business teams
Help provide data and insights to drive up revenue mix by investigating and optimizing the funnel
Assist with setting up, conducting, and interpreting outcomes of A/B testing and other forms of experimentation
Create and manage reports and data assets in dashboarding tools like Metabase, Google Sheets, Google Data Studio, Excel and develop presentations to keep the team apprised of key trends
Communicate, collaborate and present results to clients within TKWW
Explore novel ways to look at our data
Assist with development of metrics and goals
Successful Data Analyst Candidates Have
Background working within a team in a data-driven environment
SQL and database experience
Experience with Google Analytics and BigQuery or other event tracking
Experience with financial modeling
2-3 years of hands-on web analytics or business intelligence
Commitment to timelines, accuracy, and professionalism
Ability to work in a fast paced environment and shift gears quickly
Excellent communication and project management skills
You have a Bachelor or Master's Degree
Proficiency with R or Python is a plus
What We Love About You
You deeply understand our users and put them at the center of everything you do. You aim to serve and delight them every day.
You are respectful and act with the highest integrity. If you see something that isn‚Äôt right, you say something.
You ask questions to understand a perspective and are comfortable respectfully challenging assumptions. You are not turned off by constructive conflict to get to the right answer.
You set clear ambitious goals. You anticipate obstacles, persevere, and are accountable for your commitments.
You aren‚Äôt afraid to challenge the status quo and know that there‚Äôs no such thing as failure if you learn from it.
You seek out feedback and never settle in your quest to grow and develop. By being here, you make our company stronger.

Proficient in SQL. Experience with visualization tools (either Tableau, Looker, Power Bi

Vistaprint‚Äôs Data and Analytics (DnA) organization is working to make our company one of the world‚Äôs most well-known and successful data-driven companies. You enjoy and/or have demonstrated ability tackling complex problems, drawing inferences from data, and using your analysis skills and eye for business to identify solutions. You have excellent organizational skills, strong attention to detail and ability to effectively deliver on projects supporting multiple business partners.
Team-minded and versatile. You have experience and an interest in partnering with multi-functional team members who come to the table with different perspectives. You are open to creative approaches to solving problems.
Experienced. 0 to 3+ years in an analytics environment and a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or related field.

Descripci√≥n:
The mission of the Senior Content Business Analyst is to support Content teams with analyzing all our available data, supporting business decisions in order to maximize the Content impact on the business. The Senior Content Business Analyst should understand and communicate the financial and operational impact of any changes that may occur by determining the data requirements, metrics and delivering business analysis of a project or program, and keeping a clear line of communication with stakeholders.

What will your responsibilities be?
Be able to translate complex business analysis into digestible explanations while providing non-area related use-cases & examples Build case studies and what-if analyses to evaluate impact of new products, business features and pricing changes. Build meaningful and appealing self-service dashboards independently. Fully understand how a change in your area will impact the entire company and be able to anticipate risks & opportunities. Understand the concept of statistical significance and the ways of reporting it by mastering basic statistical methods. Identify new opportunities for the business. Be able to anticipate a potential risk or opportunity within your area before it happens. Provide input to discussions on areas of strategy, and reach out to teams and groups within and outside of your team, to gather information from stakeholders. Come up with repository/development process improvements within the team. Be proactive and try to eliminate obstacles which are slowing down you or your team. Keep clear communication with the stakeholders. Proactively communicate any analytical finding and propose possible actions. Act as a stand-in for the Team Lead and help with onboarding and mentoring of your colleagues.
What are we looking for?
3 to 5 years of experience in the (Business) Analyses role supporting profitability-wise business decisions (preferably from travel industry - e.g. airline pricing/GDS knowledge) Strong business acumen applied in analyses, ability to define the scope, track, execute, and communicate on projects. Great analytical skills and flawless attention to details Good problem-solving skills Experience with Data Visualization, retail analytics and Modelling are a plus Experience with BI tools (Looker, Tableau, ect.) SQL knowledge is a plus Intellectually curious, analytically rigorous, hard-working and a good business intuition are musts! Ability to communicate complex results to less quantitatively sophisticated users Easiness to conceptualize (including setting the right requirements in terms of Data & modelling capabilities) and extract insights from Data You use a variety of communication methods to communicate and drive others. You are eager to work in a fast-paced environment where things change quickly and you can have a great impact on company growth and development.
Things that we offer and you might love about us:
We believe we‚Äôre a fun bunch to work with, and you will get to see how a young, vibrant yet global company disrupts the travel industry. You‚Äôll work in one of the most promising tech companies (awarded Forbes Startup of 2017, Super-brand Award 2017, Deloitte Technology Fast 50 ‚Äì the fastest growing technology company in Central Europe). We visit and speak at conferences and technological events worldwide. We use our work time wisely with a friendly vacation policy and work schedule. We also like to party and hang out together. We work, play, relax, workout and even nap in our offices (complete with sauna, gym, masseur, sleeping spots, canteen, chillout zones, free refreshments, etc). Dogs, kids, and parties are welcome in our offices. We also enjoy common benefits, such as meal vouchers, flexible benefits scheme, sick days, VIP Medical Care, flight vouchers, multisport card, etc. Besides a fair salary, we can also look forward to quarterly bonuses dependent on overall company performance. We‚Äôre a great team of passionate and fun-loving people from across the globe who you‚Äôll love working with. We look forward to you joining our team-buildings and parties!

Ryanair is Europe‚Äôs favourite airline, operating more than 1,800 daily flights from 85 bases, connecting over 200 destinations in 33 countries on a fleet of over 371 Boeing 737 aircraft. Ryanair has orders for a further 293 new Boeing 737 aircraft, which will enable Ryanair to lower fares and grow traffic from 119m this year to 200m p.a. in FY24. Ryanair has a team of more than 10,000 highly skilled aviation professionals delivering Europe‚Äôs No.1 on-time performance, and has an industry leading 30-year safety record.

The Role

Ryanair is looking for a Product Owner to join its Digital & Marketing team. Reporting to the Head of Product and Design, the role of a Product Owner in Ryanair is to understand and drive the product development of Ryanair‚Äôs platforms within a fast-paced agile environment. You will be tasked with working with multiple stakeholders across the business in order to gather and document project requirements and to assist in the development process of Ryanair.com.

Drive business analyst‚Äôs best practice to ensure high quality output is achieved.
Translate business requirements into detailed functional design using Use Cases

Experience of working with Product teams and UX/UI designers an advantage

Experience of working in and agile, fast-paced consumer centric ecommerce environment.

Advanced level of English
