Descripci√≥n:
We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in.
To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply...
Job Details
Kantar is the world‚Äôs leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar‚Äôs 30,000 people help the world‚Äôs leading organisations succeed and grow.
Profiles
Our profiles colleagues are the experts in helping clients connect with people. This includes survey design, sampling, profiling, data integration and activation for programmatic campaigns. Their single access point to 88 million deeply-profiled research-ready respondents enables clients to build rich profiles of their target audience and access immediately actionable data.

The Role (wider Context)

We are looking for a Senior IT Engineer that will become the local expert of a new Audience Measurement platform. The person will be a leader representative for the platform in the Spain‚Äôs market. High motivation, analytical mindset, and a high ability to communicate with many different teams are the key aptitudes to progress successfully in this position. He/she will be accountable for the correct functioning of the Platform and will be in continuous collaboration with our Central team in London to inform about the particular necessities of the market and thus collaborate in the evolution and modernisation of the platform. This role is also accountable of providing a first-level support service with a critical impact on the delivery to our clients.

Mission (the Sell)

We are embarking on a new exciting challenge to align our legacy Audience platform to a global Kantar platform.
While we are in the final stage of the migration process, we need someone that starts collaborating in the transition and helping us to mitigate the impact on our clients, adapting the particularities of Spain to the new system.
The person will drive all the requests coming from the Operations and Market teams to the Central team and will articulate the best solution in each case.
A challenging position within a fast growing, dynamic and innovative company working in an international role. The opportunity allows for growth and choice in a new and exciting career path
Transforming our Audience Measurement platform is one of the Kantar global strategic initiatives to move towards a new age in the field of the Digital Audience Measurement.
KEY OUTCOMES
Acquire the knowledge of Atria at expert level
Help on the transition from Comtel to Atria
Response to any incident during the daily operation
Discuss, propose and eventually develop solutions in the Atria platform that can resolve particularities in Spain's market
Interface with the Central Team in London
Contribute to the evolution of the Platform in the Cloud

Capabilities

Long experience in Linux systems
High knowledge of Oracle Database and SQL language.
Analytical skills.
Big Data landscape: experience in Spark.
Cloud technologies ‚Äì Azure, DataBricks, Docker / Containers, Kubernetes.
Programming languages: C, Python, Java and Cobol (valuable)
High level of English (spoken)
High ability to cope with a steeped learning curve
Ability to read and understand "tones" of scripts and components
Interactivity with a great variety of teams
High motivation to contribute to a strategic project
Availability out of working time to support the Atria system
JOIN US

Job Description

We are growing our Requirements Engineering / IT Business Analyst Team in Vigo and are looking for new colleagues who will bring their consultative and analytical experience spiced up by technical skills.

And by technical skills we mean that you have a solid experience working in web-development projects interpreting clients wishes into technical specifications for the Development team.

If it sounds like you, read on...

Your Tasks
You will be the link between our customer and our development teams and translate business requests to technical requirements and into technical concepts.
You will write business requirements, testing software, executing operational tasks and providing project management support while strengthening your technical acumen and business consulting skills.
You will take responsibility for the conception and design of web-based solutions in the digital marketing domain, designing, testing and launching the technology that meets fully the business need. You will truly be a game changer for our clients.
You will also be brainstorming with the client at the outset of a project, then acting as an assistant project manager as the project progresses.
You will support the analysis and implementation of requirements along the entire software development cycle.
You will document and present the solutions implemented with your team for internal and external stakeholders.

Strong verbal and written English skills (C1 and higher)

Knowledge of software modelling methods (UML, flow charts, use cases...), methodologies and process models in software development
Readiness to travel (up to 50% depending on project)

Motivation to work in a distributed, international team

Enthusiasm and an open mind which is looking for continuous improvement
You are not afraid of giving and receiving feedback

Vistaprint‚Äôs Data and Analytics (DnA) organization is working to make our company one of the world‚Äôs most well-known and successful data-driven companies. The cross-functional team includes product owners, analysts, technologists, data engineers and more ‚Äì all focused on providing Vistaprint with information and tools we can use to deliver jaw-dropping customer value. DnA team members are empowered to learn new skills, communicate openly and be active problem-solvers.

What You Will Do

Are you inquisitive by nature with passion about data and technology? You will be part of the creation of Vistaprint‚Äôs time-series analysis and forecasting capability! You will explore and visualize data, making recommendations and building scalable data products that help Vistaprint become more data-driven in its planning processes!
Collaborate in a complementary team (e.g. Product Owners, Marketing, Developers) on analyses, bringing forward ideas and insights to drive value for our customers.
Identify trends and drivers, perform exploratory data analyses and present views that will provide visibility into business drivers: Data Exploration, Visualization, and Dashboarding.
Incorporate multiple data sources and methodologies to find opportunities to help us better understand customer behavior and give to product-level demand forecasting: Data Analysis and Modeling.
Design and execute experiments to optimize our forecasting data products for accuracy and usefulness.
Focus on delivering customer value early and often in a fast-paced and agile environment.
Your Qualifications
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or related field.
Experience with SQL or with another programming languages to support analytics, such as Python or R.
Sophisticated level with exploratory analysis and statistical techniques that are driven to find relevant patterns and trends in the data.
Experience with data modelling, visualization and data exploration tools such as Tableau or Looker, is a plus. And previous experience with time-series or forecasting analysis is desirable.
Minimum 3 years working in an analytics environment.
Why You'll Love Working Here

Being at Vistaprint means that you don‚Äôt see work as just a building, a desk or a manufacturing floor. You see it as a chance to take a step forward in your career journey ‚Äì and your life. We strive to give you everything you need to learn, grow, and succeed. Through innovation, collaboration, and perpetual exposure to what‚Äôs next, we‚Äôre always pushing boundaries and broadening our horizons. We embrace the chance to operate outside of our comfort zone to discover what we‚Äôre capable of. Some might call that a challenge; we just call it another great day at work.

Remote First-Culture

In 2020, Vistaprint adopted a Remote-First operating model and culture. We heard from our team members that having the freedom, autonomy and trust in each other to work from home and, the ability to operate when they are most productive, empowers everyone to be their best and most brilliant self. Vistaprint also provides collaboration spaces for team members to work physically together when it's safe to do so or believe in office working will deliver the best results. Currently we are enabled to hire remote team members in over 20 US States as well as several countries in Europe: Spain, Germany, UK, Czech Republic, the Netherlands and Switzerland.

About Us

As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vistaprint is a dynamic organization that maintains an exciting, entrepreneurial culture. With founder Robert Keane‚Äôs return as CEO, we‚Äôve renewed our focus on empowering and helping small businesses. To do this, we create customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We thrive on providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation and growth ‚Äì for both our customers and our team.

Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. Job Description

We are currently looking for a User Acquisition Data Analyst to complement our Global Data Science team.

You will be part of our HQ data science team, and collaborate very closely with our UA team as well. Together with other data analysts, data scientists in the team, you will continuously deliver actionable insights from our vast amount of UA and in-game data, with the goal of driving our games‚Äô growth and improving UA efficiency.

From the beginning of your adventure with us, you will be called to:
Explore our data warehouse and grow deep understanding of UA and game tracking data
Master marketing data dimensions and measure definitions
Perform 360 analysis to answer questions from stakeholders in a timely manner
Turn your analyses into valuable actions that can be taken by the UA or game team
Understand statistical analysis and can apply that to UA testings

Qualifications

Essential (must-have):
Minimum 1 year of professional experience in a similar role (e.g. data analyst, UA analyst etc.)
Excellent SQL skill, you would consider yourself an SQL expert.
Sensitivity for data quality and deep quantitative analysis skills
Ability to deliver clean, accurate and understandable data visualization and dashboards
Familiarity with marketing terms such as CPI, RoAS, creative optimization
Understanding of statistical analysis
Positive attitude and interest in interacting with other teams
Excellent sense of organization and great autonomy, enjoy individual and team work.
Good knowledge of English (written and oral).
Passion for games!

Desired
High level of proficiency in relevant scripting language(s), e.g. R or Python
Prior experience in working on marketing/UA teams
Good understanding of mobile attribution and UA performance measurement

Additional Information

Why Join the World of Gameloft?
Because you want to be part of an exceptional experience within a company that is constantly growing!
Because you want to work with talented people who are industry pioneers!
Because you want to join a global company and meet great people around the world from all walks of life.
Or, just because you‚Äôre looking for a great place to work!


Benefits
Permanent contract, full-time job and excellent Social Benefits.
The offer includes relocation assistance, a merit based salary progression system and a competitive initial salary package.
Career-development opportunities.
An exceptional, dynamic, demanding and motivating working environment within a fast growing company.
Challenging and rewarding work on the next great frontiers in games.
Exceptional library of diverse games with broad distribution.
An international environment which offers daily contact with other countries & cultures
Excellent local working conditions (quality of offices, geographical location of office in the centre of Barcelona).

Be able to translate complex business analysis into digestible explanations while providing non-area related use-cases & examples

The role

We are looking for a Technical Business Analyst to shape, drive and aid with the maintenance and reform of our internal systems as well as identifying better tools to improve our data products. You will be providing support to the content data operations in the UK and Seville and liaising with the product owners and engineers in Autodata to review and streamline the tools and technology to bring efficiencies and better customer outcomes.

What You‚Äôll Do
Identifying and evaluating relevant technology solutions and tools to solve business problems, exploit opportunities and drive forward continuous improvements
Act as liaison and participate in defining technology tools and solutions to solve complex, multidisciplinary business problems with long-term implications
Comfortable operating in a business that is underpinned by all things ‚Äòdata‚Äô
Working cross-functionally with operations (data content) and technology teams
Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to summarise requirements to senior stakeholders
Requirements elicitation, prioritisation and management (Agile, not waterfall)
Solid technical background, exposure to a software development environment and proven experience having worked in Agile and Scrum
Experience in a wide range of business analyst skills (e.g. use cases, user stories, requirements traceability, process mapping)
Able to break down complex business problems from epics into user stories
Balance technology and business issues as well as communicate appropriately with both technology and business experts
Develop, define, and build technology business cases that will enable business and technology change
Participate in business process and technology initiatives to improve business performance
Excellent understanding of technology life cycles and the concepts and practices required to implement effective technical business change.
Evidence of troubleshooting and solving problems in a highly technical customer focused service environment
Strong problem-solving ability and a willingness to roll your sleeves up to get the job done
What You‚Äôll Bring
Proven track record of having work in Agile environments and having delivered technical transformational change
Over 3 years of experience in a product owner / senior business analysis role.
Proven ability in requirements elicitation, prioritisation and management (e.g. use cases, user stories, process mapping, etc)
An ability to conduct tools research and gather requirements that will support the business case. Define outcomes and benefits realisation as part of the business case
Adept at removing blockers and finding ways to overcome constraints/difficulties
Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to summarise options and potential solutions to your peers and the leadership team
Able to work cross-functionally with business and technology teams
Attributes and Characteristics
Structured and self-organised
Analytical skills
Relentless customer centric mindset and approach
Process-driven mind-set and problem-solving skills
A technical aptitude and interpersonal skills
Excellent presentation and communication skills
Your mindset, attitude and values will be essential to success, with proactivity, collaboration, thought leadership and product expertise at your core

Are you ready for a new challenge?Celonis is the leader in business transformation software and recently introduced a new software category, the Execution Management System. Powered by its market-leading process mining core, the Celonis Execution Management System (EMS) offers platform capabilities that help companies to create applications to manage every facet of execution management from analytics, to strategy and planning, management and automations.The newly introduced Celonis Knowledge Models aim to simplify the building of intelligent applications in our Studio. They offer a single point of access to the data available in our EMS platform and at the same time allow us to put the data into context by storing interlinked descriptions and definitions of business entities, such as records, KPIs, filters or also abstract concepts like execution gaps. They ensure that a single definition is applied to ensure that users are building on the same foundation and can trust and understand the data.As the Product Manager for the Celonis Knowledge Models, you will closely collaborate with a set of diverse stakeholders, both within and outside of the Celonis organization, to build outstanding products that our customers love and end-users enjoy.In this role, you will shape the product vision and roadmap for the Knowledge Models and how they support the build of applications in our Celonis Studio and proactively work towards transforming that vision into reality. You will ensure that we have a scalable approach in place to become a knowledge hub for process expertise along with a delightful UI to create, browse and use knowledge. Your success will result in increased adoption of knowledge models via usage of analyses and applications.Do you enjoy embracing a vision and turning it into reality, all while applying and developing your peer-leadership and upwards-leadership skills to convince others to join forces to bring ideas to life? This could be as a product manager/owner or data scientist/analyst etc...have experience in enterprise software development...are capable of taking abstract data, technology trends, solutions, and present them to a business audience...are familiar with end-to-end product lifecycle and methodologies, programming languages, databases, design and prototyping tools ...are fluent and comfortable in working and presenting in EnglishWE...... see people as the fundamental pillar of our success. Therefore, we invest into the personal growth and skill development of each individual alongside with the strength finder test‚Ä¶ offer attractive compensation models (stock option packages, employee referral bonus, family service, flexible working hours)... are visionary and one of the fastest growing Software-Unicorns in the world‚Ä¶ are experts in the field of Process Mining - the new Celonis Execution Management System provides a set of instruments and applications: the EMS offerings help companies manage every facet of execution management from analytics, to strategy and planning, management, actions and automations‚Ä¶ distinguish ourselves through a unique combination of innovative start-up atmosphere paired with great professionalism and self-responsible workCelonis is an equal opportunity employer. Craft:Data, Analytics & StrategyJob Description:We are looking for a Principal Business Performance Analyst to be a senior member of our growing Central Analytics team at King. Working with stakeholders from across King, you will provide critical insights into the state and trend of our business that enable better decision making and drive impact. Your work will be crucial to help push the boundaries of how we understand our players and games. As a senior part of the Central Analytics team, you will set the standard for outstanding, holistic business insights. Your reporting will seamlessly combine King‚Äôs own data with player insights and market intelligence.Your role within our KingdomYou will be working collaboratively across all parts of the business to crack company- wide problems in how we can grow our business. Reporting to the Director of Central Analytics, you will:Deliver actionable insights that can support and drive impactful decisionsLead the business, including King‚Äôs Leadership Team, in understanding key performance trends and identifying opportunities for growth Provide accurate data, insights, analysis and forecasts for decision makers and stakeholdersPerform quantitative and qualitative analysis on our portfolio of games and player networkCommunicate results in a clear and concise manner, with an understanding of data visualisation and the importance of drawing accurate conclusions from multiple data sourcesFoster strong relationships with other key functions across King, such as Finance, Corporate Strategy and MarketingAs a senior member of Central Analytics and the whole data community at King, be an advocate for high quality, impactful data deliverablesPosition yourself as key expert on our own business, industry trends and the competitor landscape to evolve our thinkingIdentify opportunities for growth, influence key stakeholders and drive initiatives to a successful outcome.Skills to create thrillsYou are a highly analytical, passionate problem solver. You have the ability to draw data driven business insights that will add real value to King. You are proactive and demonstrate the ability to learn quickly. Experience working in a commercial data team, providing business insights and models which lead to data informed business decisionsYou can see the forest, not just trees. You understand the problems and opportunities from a player and a business perspective, and then find the right data, analysis or interpretation to translate into actionable insightsMethodological and pragmatic with a hands- on approach that can get straight to the point when needed Strong communication skills: you can communicate the most complex insights concisely and clearly in writing and in personGreat relationship building and influencing skills, and experience in managing and satisfying senior stakeholders‚Äô needsMasters or PhD Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics. Economics, Engineering or similar field or work experienceHighly proficient in SQL as well as Python or R for numerical analysisPrior experience in an industry with very short implementation cycles such as e- commerce, online products/services or games Experience in working with highly- skilled peers in analytics, data science and engineering, consumer research, and Business PerformanceBonus PointsSolid understanding or enthusiasm for the games industrySkills to create reports and dashboards that allow teams to understand and optimize initiatives using tools such as Python/R, Looker and BigQuery (GCS)Knowledge of and/or interest in dashboard & reporting toolsOpen to feedback as a way of learning and improvingPragmatic problem- solver ‚Äì someone who looks for solutions rather than worrying about problemsAbout KingKing is a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, with people all around the world playing one or more of our games, including franchises such as Candy Crush, Farm Heroes, Pet Rescue and Bubble Witch.We have 249 million monthly active users as of fourth quarter 2019 across web, social and mobile platforms. King was acquired by Activision Blizzard Inc. (Nasdaq ATVI) in February 2016 and operates as an independent unit of thecompany.A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of HeroesMaking games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.Making the World PlayfulMaking the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It‚Äôs what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players ‚Äì and we‚Äôre not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!Applications needs to be in English.Discover King at careers.king.com

Descripci√≥n:
Do you have great interpersonal skills with the ability to explain and present insights and make your team more enthusiastic about data and experimentation? Do you want to work for a growing eCommerce company with ambitious goal? Then get in touch, we might have a great role for you!

Purpose

As a Conversion Specialist / Analyst at albelli you will analyze and optimize experience of the albelli photo product editors which include online and downloadable editors as well as a mobile app. You will bring an understanding of web analytics and conversion rate optimization and translate it into stunning user experience leading to commercial benefits.

You will significantly contribute to the data driven product development by translating data into actionable insights, communicating them to the team, and proactively driving the A/B testing process. You will present your findings to your product owner, conversion specialists, and other stakeholders.

You will work with in-house UI/UX designers, copywriters, developers, and analysts to get most out of our data with the use of variety of tools. The role is highly influential and you will be able to validate your data driven hypotheses on real visitors and customers.

You will have a chance to exchange experience with other talented conversion specialists and analysts. As a professional willing to learn, you are encouraged to join relevant conferences and meetups. All that in an open environment which gives you flexibility and also room for making mistakes.

Responsibilities
Define KPI‚Äôs for photo product editor performance and experiments;
Proactively identify opportunities for improvements, using data and research;
Create hypotheses for experiments;
Cooperate with the team to build prototypes;
Setup experiments independently or with developers;
Monitor, evaluate experiments and present recommendations;
Coach and educate your team and the business about the data and experimentation.

Join one of the hottest Barcelona-based high-growth startups !

About Momentum Data And Our Team

At Momentum Data we are rethinking the way enterprise B2B marketing teams operate. Founded in London, and serving the world‚Äôs largest enterprises from our Barcelona office, we are using cutting-edge technologies, such as AI & Robotic Process Automation, to help B2B marketers leverage the potential of direct marketing channels and of B2B social media.

We are a group of young and driven professionals from all corners of the globe who have come together in Barcelona. Our team is multilingual, but our daily work requires full fluency in English.

About This Role

As Data Analyst & Campaign Manager, you‚Äôll be responsible for the implementation and execution of our client campaigns, from target audience definition, data extraction and preparation, all the way to the campaign management working with our RPA software, datasets and custom spreadsheets. To excel in your role you‚Äôll have to understand our client‚Äôs needs and work out effective solutions to their problems independently. As part of our campaign operations team, you will gain broad knowledge of B2B marketing and sales concepts as well as the technical aspects of them.
Spreadsheet proficiency
Mathematical mindset (data and numbers driven)
High attention to detail
Strong capacity to focus
Project management skills

JOIN US ON OUR JOURNEY!

Momentum Data‚Äôs main offices are located in the heart of Barcelona. Our journey has just begun but we are a stable and profitable high growth operation. Our team consists of likeminded individuals who are equally driven and enjoy coming to work every day. We are truly living the startup life to the fullest. Join us, grow with us, and become an essential part in making Momentum Data a market leader in the space of B2B marketing technology.

In order to increase your chances, please send a short email to click apply, tell us which job you are applying for, and include a link to your LinkedIn profile. We‚Äôre looking forward to your application.

Descripci√≥n:
As we create a colorful, capable and cleaner world through chemistry, we invite you to join our team to harness the power of chemistry to shape markets, redefine industries and improve lives for billions of people around the world.

At Chemours, our purpose is to help create a colorful, capable and cleaner world through the power of chemistry!

The Chemours Company, headquartered in Wilmington, DE, has a Senior Finance Analyst position available in Asturias, Spain. This is a highly visible, key role within the Company and the Finance function.

The responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to, the following:
Develop financial models in support of company strategic projects and/or manufacturing plant operational costs analysis.
Perform complex financial analysis across different business units or Corporate Functions providing insights and actionable recommendations or corrective measures for performance optimization.
Understanding Finance data patterns and solving the analytics use case.
Support annual budget and monthly forecast setting process for multiple plant sites and/or business/functions.
Provide proper financial stewardship overall manufacturing activities; specifically, accurate planning, control, and accountability.
Work with business and analyst teams to implement data strategies, build data flows, and develop conceptual/logical/physical data models.
Actively participate in the evaluation of finance processes, identifying and implementing improvement ideas to increase automation and/or quality of reporting/data.
Provide technical support and guidance to business users.
Understand and document end-user usage models and requirements.
Audit project-level data model quality deliverables to ensure that practices and standards are met.

An Ideal Candidate Should Possess
MBA/master‚Äôs degree with a major in Economics/Finance/Business Administration.
Over 5 years of professional work experience in Management Consulting, Investment Banking, Corporate Finance, or Private Equity.
Excellent modeling skills combined with a solid understanding of accounting and a strong ability to create logical frameworks for problem-solving.
Experience in operational KPIs, Balance Score Cards, and reporting/ review processes to ensure a continuous improvement of our business‚Äô operational performance.
Familiarity with SAP (including SAP Business Warehouse) and Oracle HFM would be an advantage.
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English, other languages will be a plus.
Effective communication and persuasion mastery with experience engaging with leadership teams in stressful and pressing times.
Versed in leading holistic performance improvement projects and understanding different kinds of Project Management Office (PMO) tools.
Knowledge of LEAN/Six Sigma production philosophies would be an asset.
Strong drive for action, including the ability to juggle multiple priorities at the same time
Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines while managing multiple projects.
Desire to work in multi-cultural, global environments.
In the spirit of customer centricity, refreshing simplicity, collective entrepreneurship, safety obsession, and unshakable integrity we are the home of some of the world‚Äôs greatest brands and greatest employees! Learn how you could be a catalyst for change at Chemours.

At Chemours, you will find sustainability in our vision, our business and your future. If you want to work on the leading edge of your field and have a desire to make a difference, join Chemours and discover what it means when we say ‚ÄúWe Are Living Chemistry‚Äù.

Descripci√≥n:
Vistaprint‚Äôs Data and Analytics (DnA) organization is working to make our company one of the world‚Äôs most well-known and successful data-driven companies. The cross-functional team includes product owners, analysts, technologists, data engineers and more ‚Äì all focused on providing Vistaprint with information and tools we can use to deliver jaw-dropping customer value. DnA team members are empowered to learn new skills, communicate openly and be active problem-solvers.

Do you want to be at the intersection of art and science? We are establishing a team to fuel the power of machine learning to innovate how customers will discover and build designs on our products! We are looking for an experienced analyst that will take the lead on generating insights on how should transform the Vistaprint customer experience! Join us on this journey as we take design to the next level!

What You Will Do
Be immersed in a diverse data product team where you will collaborate on data products and continually bring forward ideas and insights to drive value for our customers.
Data Exploration, Visualization, and Dashboarding. Identify trends and drivers, perform exploratory data analyses and present views that will provide visibility into our performance and opportunities in design.
Data Analysis and Modeling. Incorporate multiple data sources and methodologies to understand the impact of opportunities identified through insights tools.
Collaborate in a fast paced, agile environment that focuses on delivering customer value early and often.
Value driven impact partner for key business stakeholders, influencing strategy and growth opportunities.
Tackle challenges and seek sophisticated problems, drawing inferences from data, and using analytic skills to determine solutions and deliver results.
Be a game-changer. To innovate, we will be challenging how we have always thought of design and need to be ready for unchartered territory. and innovate on high value initiative in the full-spectrum design domain.
Your Qualifications:
Experience with and proficiency in SQL.
Good understanding of exploratory analysis and statistical techniques and skilled in finding substantial patterns and trends in the data.
Excellent organizational skills, good attention to detail and ability to efficiently deliver on projects supporting multiple business partners.
Experience partnering with versatile, multi-functional team members who come to the table with different perspectives and have a consistent record of developing creative approaches to solving problems.
4+ years in an eCommerce environment and a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or related field, with validated experience coaching and mentoring junior team members.
Nice to Have:
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Looker
Other programming languages (e.g., Python, R)
Experience with web analytic tools (i.e., Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics)
Why You'll Love Working Here:
Being at Vistaprint means that you don‚Äôt see work as just a building, a desk or a manufacturing floor. You see it as a chance to take a step forward in your career journey ‚Äì and your life. We strive to give you everything you need to learn, grow, and succeed. Through innovation, collaboration, and perpetual exposure to what‚Äôs next, we‚Äôre always pushing boundaries and broadening our horizons. We embrace the chance to operate outside of our comfort zone to discover what we‚Äôre capable of. Some might call that a challenge; we just call it another great day at work.

Remote First-Culture

In 2020, Vistaprint adopted a Remote-First operating model and culture. We heard from our team members that having the freedom, autonomy and trust in each other to work from home and, the ability to operate when they are most productive, empowers everyone to be their best and most brilliant self. Vistaprint also provides collaboration spaces for team members to work physically together when it's safe to do so or believe in office working will deliver the best results. Currently we are enabled to hire remote team members in over 20 US States as well as several countries in Europe: Spain, Germany, UK, Czech Republic, the Netherlands and Switzerland.

About Us

As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vistaprint is a dynamic organization that maintains an exciting, entrepreneurial culture. With founder Robert Keane‚Äôs return as CEO, we‚Äôve renewed our focus on empowering and helping small businesses. To do this, we create customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We thrive on providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation and growth ‚Äì for both our customers and our team.

Descripci√≥n:
Cyber Security Presales Engineer

Job Description

Micro Focus is seeking a highly motivated and qualified professional for a Cyber-security Presales Consultant role to be based in Madrid, Spain.

CyberRes is the Micro Focus Business Unit 100% focused on Cyber Resilience and Security technologies, holding a leadership position in the industry. Our unique portfolio covers multiple pillars to provide enterprise-grade software solutions with high added value: SecOps ‚Äì SIEM, Behavioral Analytics, Log Management and SOAR (ArcSight); DevSecOps - Application Security Testing throughout the entire software development life-cycle (Fortify); Data Privacy and Protection - Discovery, classification, protection and end-to-end management of personal and sensitive information (Voltage, SCM); Identity & Access Security suite (NetIQ).

As a Micro Focus CyberRes Presales Consultant, you will possess exceptional presentation, written and verbal skills. You will ideally be familiar with the entire Micro Focus CyberRes product portfolio and have a main technical focus on SecOps and Data Privacy and Protection. You will have a deep understanding of security principles, architectures and design, industry landscape and trends.

Responsiblities

You will be responsible for a wide range of presales activities including

You will be joining an extremely motivated sales team, playing a key role as subject matter expert in state-of-the-art security spaces.
Product presentation and technical deep diving to prospects, customers, and partners
Conducting and documenting successful PoCs (Proof of Concept) and live demos of ArcSight SIEM/UBA/Log Management solutions mainly and Voltage/SCM solutions
Addressing RFI/RFP/RFQ responses in an extensive, and timely manner
Customization and localization of product documentation
Maintaining a healthy and positive relationship with key customers and partners, meeting them regularly and keeping them up to date with the latest product releases and new features
Representing Micro Focus at trade shows and events, also as public speaker in presence and virtually
Representing Micro Focus in the specific market with a high standing and thought leadership.
Besides the product specialization required and explained above, you will be trained across the entire CyberRes portfolio.

Skills & Experience
At least 3 years of field experience as a Presales Engineer in the information security market or security specialist
Robust knowledge of information security fundamentals, market analysis and product verticals (architectural design, technology, hands-on)
Excellent skills in SIEM/Log Management and Threat Intelligence presentation, implementation, customization, troubleshooting
Good knowledge of Linux and Windows Operating Systems, RDBMS, networking fundamentals, VMware hypervisors, container-based deployment technology via Docker/Kubernetes
Ability to understand, write and troubleshoot Scripts (RegEx, Perl, Phyton)
Ability to communicate the value of a solution in terms of financial return and impact on customer business goals
Good knowledge of and relationships with the local IT security market up to C-level (system integrator, resellers, distributors are a plus)
Confident in diving into different scenarios: from C-level meetings to bits & bytes bake-off against competitors
Spanish mother tongue and fluent spoken and written English required

Considered As a Plus
Existing hands-on skills on Micro Focus ArcSight (preferred) or another market leading SIEM
Experience with data encryption or data privacy technologies
CISSP, CISM, CEH, CCSK or CIPT certifications
Programming experience in C++, Java or other object oriented programming language
Experience as SOC Analyst, Consultant or Manager
The position is based in Madrid, Spain. In normal time travelling is required for approx. 20% of working time, mainly throughout Spain and Portugal.

Micro Focus is one of the world‚Äôs largest enterprise software providers, delivering the mission-critical software that keeps the digital world running. We combine pragmatism, discipline, and customer-centric innovation to deliver trusted, proven solutions that customers need in order to succeed in today‚Äôs rapidly evolving marketplace. That‚Äôs high tech without the drama.

Descripci√≥n:
Job Purpose

To support the IPP Analyst team in maintaining and strengthening trading relationships with all relevant vendors and with Product Marketing to obtain competitive advantage for Tech Data via professional inventory planning and procurement.

Responsibilities
Placing orders based on profiles produced by the IPP Analyst team taking into account any logistics efficiency requirements (i.e. pallet, layer, carton etc.).
Back to back ordering of products with no established run rate.
Place direct ship purchase orders on vendors. To check order confirmations for correct product, quantity, pricing and delivery dates and to invoice customers on receipt of proof of shipment or delivery.
Ensure that all purchase orders raised are within authorised and agreed sign off limits.
Check vendor order confirmations for correct product, quantity, pricing and delivery dates, and updating system (SAP) accordingly.
Expedite all open orders to maximise customer satisfaction and take responsibility for highest degree of due date accuracy in SAP. Supporting texts to be added if necessary for POD (proof of delivery) requests and queries.
To assist the IPP Analyst team with vendor price changes by ensuring correct cost prices are reflected within SAP.
Stock Rotation: a) request authorisation reference from the vendor for either contractual or negotiated terms within prescribed timescales b) once reference obtained, raise Return to Vendor quotation order and record on central database c) validate all stock is returned to vendor in accordance with RMA.
Support IPP Analyst team in resolution of Logistics (primarily Goods In) and Finance queries within prescribed timescales.
To work within set policies and procedures and to continually review and update where necessary.
To own and manage through until completion, any ad hoc projects as defined by IPP Management.
Provide high level of service, support and accuracy to the IPP team
To consistently achieve set targets
Represent Tech Data at all times in an efficient and professional manner
Deliver maximum stock availability, minimise customer backlog and inventory depreciation costs, whilst maintaining stock levels in line with our key performance indicators.
Provide a first class and high availability stock profile (best in Group/IT distribution) with justified commercial risk and cost.
Knowledge Skills and Experience
Effective communication with internal & external partners
Must be proactive and self-motivated
Strong attention to detail
Ability to organise and prioritise daily routine to support a rapidly changing environment
Solid working knowledge of current IT technologies
Good working knowledge of MS Office tools (Outlook, Excel, Word) and inventory replenishment systems (SAP R3) would be advantageous.
Commercial and financial acumen - to balance inventory value and recovery margin.
Good analytical skills - to analyse data and take appropriate action.
Must have a focused, pro-active and committed attitude - to set and achieve action plans.
Sound knowledge of basic purchasing and inventory principles and practices.

The mission of the Senior Content Business Analyst is to support Content teams with analyzing all our available data, supporting business decisions in order to maximize the Content impact on the business. The Senior Content Business Analyst should understand and communicate the financial and operational impact of any changes that may occur by determining the data requirements, metrics and delivering business analysis of a project or program, and keeping a clear line of communication with stakeholders. What will your responsibilities be? Be able to translate complex business analysis into digestible explanations while providing non-area related use-cases & examples Build case studies and what-if analyses to evaluate impact of new products, business features and pricing changes. Build meaningful and appealing self-service dashboards independently. Fully understand how a change in your area will impact the entire company and be able to anticipate risks & opportunities. Be able to turn business problems into data definitions. Understand the concept of statistical significance and the ways of reporting it by mastering basic statistical methods. Identify new opportunities for the business. Be able to anticipate a potential risk or opportunity within your area before it happens.

Provide input to discussions on areas of strategy, and reach out to teams and groups within and outside of your team, to gather information from stakeholders.

Come up with repository/development process improvements within the team.

Be proactive and try to eliminate obstacles which are slowing down you or your team.

Keep clear communication with the stakeholders. Proactively communicate any analytical finding and propose possible actions. Act as a stand-in for the Team Lead and help with onboarding and mentoring of your colleagues.

What are we looking for? 3 to 5 years of experience in the (Business) Analyses role supporting profitability-wise business decisions (preferably from travel industry ‚Äì e.g. airline pricing/GDS knowledge) Strong business acumen applied in analyses, ability to define the scope, track, execute, and communicate on projects. Great analytical skills and flawless attention to details Good problem-solving skills Experience with Data Visualization, retail analytics and Modelling are a plus Experience with BI tools (Looker, Tableau, ect.) SQL knowledge is a plus Fluent English Intellectually curious, analytically rigorous, hard-working and a good business intuition are musts! Ability to communicate complex results to less quantitatively sophisticated users Easiness to conceptualize (including setting the right requirements in terms of Data & modelling capabilities) and extract insights from Data You use a variety of communication methods to communicate and drive others. You are eager to work in a fast-paced environment where things change quickly and you can have a great impact on company growth and development. Things that we offer and you might love about us: We believe we‚Äôre a fun bunch to work with, and you will get to see how a young, vibrant yet global company disrupts the travel industry. You‚Äôll work in one of the most promising tech companies (awarded Forbes Startup of , Super-brand Award , Deloitte Technology Fast 50 ‚Äì the fastest growing technology company in Central Europe). We visit and speak at conferences and technological events worldwide. We use our work time wisely with a friendly vacation policy and work schedule. We also like to party and hang out together. We work, play, relax, workout and even nap in our offices (complete with sauna, gym, masseur, sleeping spots, canteen, chillout zones, free refreshments, etc). Dogs, kids, and parties are welcome in our offices. We also enjoy common benefits, such as meal vouchers, flexible benefits scheme, sick days, VIP Medical Care, flight vouchers, multisport card, etc. Besides a fair salary, we can also look forward to quarterly bonuses dependent on overall company performance. We‚Äôre a great team of passionate and fun-loving people from across the globe who you‚Äôll love working with. We look forward to you joining our team-buildings and parties! Throughout the recruitment process and for some time after it‚Äôs finished, we‚Äôre going to process your Personal Data. You can find all the necessary information in our Privacy Policy available at https://jobs.kiwi.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/

100% | Madrid

Bring along your knowledge, your enthusiasm and your dedication and take charge as an IT Business Analyst at Axpo. We offer a variety of challenging tasks and projects, and the flexibility to present and implement your own ideas. The energy industry is changing; it is continuing to develop dynamically and innovatively. That's why we promote internal and external courses, coaching and digital learning opportunities to educate and further train our employees on both professional and technical topics.

What you will do
Drive product discovery by interviewing and regularly meeting with stakeholders
Articulate and promote product vision
Create functional and technical documentation for the product team
Drive planning/prioritization sessions with the product team
Define qualitative and quantitative testing measures and support automation of testing
Present new functionality to business users; and ensure customer satisfaction by seeking and considering their feedback
What You Bring & Who You Are
University degree in any Engineering domain or Business Management
Excellent presentation and communication skills
Proven ability to analyze complex systems/requirements, and breaking these down to efficiently streamline implementation effort
Good degree of technical autonomy (Excel, SQL, scripting languages)
Good command of written and spoken English (interview will be conducted in English)
Willingness to participate in trainings and education at our headquarters in Switzerland (subject to travel restrictions due to pandemic)
Previous hands-on experience with software development
Experience with agile software development practices (Scrum/Kanban)
What we offer

Your development matters to us. Therefore we invest in your professional growth with a wide range of internal training opportunities and the possibility of cost and/or time-sharing.

We offer fairness. In addition to a competitive salary, all employees are entitled to a performance-based component

A modern workplace awaits you in the centre of Baden. The main station is less than a five-minute walking distance. Baden is just 15 minutes from Zurich by train, and offers attractive shops, cultural variety and a wide range of hot springs.

About Us

Axpo Iberia, a subsidiary of the Axpo Group, was established in Spain in 2002 and manages the most important independent portfolio of renewable energies on the Iberian Peninsula. We offer our customers in Spain and Portugal products and services in the fields of energy and gas supply, energy management for producers of renewable energies and heat and power cogeneration, as well as trading of raw materials, biomass and CO2. Axpo is Switzerland's largest producer of renewable energy, as well as an international leader in energy trading and the marketing of solar and wind power. At its headquarters in Switzerland and in 30 countries across Europe as well as the US, around 5,000 employees use state-of-the-art technology to develop sustainable, innovative energy solutions.
More information

About The Team

Our Software Development Team in Madrid consists of highly motived, highly skilled people that enjoy working in a flat hierarchy.
Axpo Iberia belongs to the Axpo energy group, a leading energy company with Headquarters in Switzer-land and subsidiaries across Europe. Axpo Iberia was incorporated in Spain in 2002.

The Role Involves

Beam Suntory is Crafting the Spirits that Stir the World. Rooted in two centuries of family heritage, Beam Suntory has evolved into the world's third largest leading premium spirits company ... where each employee is treated like family and trusted with legacy. With our greatest assets - our premium spirits and our people - we're driving growth through impactful marketing, innovation and an entrepreneurial spirit. Beam Suntory is a place where you can come Unleash your Spirit by making an impact each and every day.Revenue Strategy Senior AnalystThe following position is is open in Madrid, Spain.What makes this a great opportunity.This role provides the opportunity to understand the entire cycle of the Pricing Process. Starting from Pricing Strategy until the deployment of these strategies in the different markets.This role will allow as well the development of interpersonal skills, as this role requires a high level of coordination with other functions.Role ResponsibilitiesThe role is pivotal to support the design and development of our International Revenue Strategies for existing brand qualities & New product development in alignment with the brand houses. Utilizing insights to communicate revenue strategies and tangible actions to support them
Supporting the region by working towards an annual harmonized pricing and margin plan, through
utilizing competitor shelf pricing insights and aligning implementation to the brand pricing guidelines. Developing as well a recommendation of price change by brand across the business.
This role will require strong cross functional capabilities, as it will act as a key link between International RGM, the Brand House strategy & finance teamsQualifications & Experience* Minimum 8 years experience in financial roles experience in a FMCG environment. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will serve as a technical and thought leader on this diverse and highly skilled team. You‚Äôll synthesize large datasets and solve complex problems through the use of advanced machine learning and statistical modelling. You‚Äôll work in a highly collaborative, team environment, guiding and mentoring junior data scientists / analyst and collaborating with multiple stakeholders. You will assist management in the communication of insights and the implementation of impactful data science solutions across the organization.

Requirements

ÔÇ∑ Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
ÔÇ∑ Overall 7+ years of experience in Data Science with 4+ years of experience in designing, developing, evaluating, and deploying predictive modelling, machine learning, advanced analytics

ÔÇ∑ Superior coding skills using common data science tools, including Python (strongly preferred), R, Linux/Unix command line and shell scripting.

BusinessObjects, Looker, Tableau, etc.

science, mathematics, engineering, physics, etc.

Nombre empresa: Cloud Services and Process Analyst (German Speaking)
Sector: Servicios y tecnolog√≠as de la informaci√≥n Software Servicios financieros
Descripci√≥n:
Job Purpose

The Cloud Systems & Services team is responsible to optimize the processes required for these businesses. This includes offering shared services through Tech Data owned Shared Service Center outsourced to service partners in EMEA.

An important role for this Analyst will work on projects to design and implement a scalable central operational processes and monitoring service aligned to Tech Data‚Äôs Cloud support services offerings as well as interacting with applicable Services providers. The Analyst will identify specific customer requirements and ensure that our IT Service Providers are able to fulfill these requirements based upon an appropriate service catalogue. The Analyst will participate on projects, briefings and progress updates. The analyst will collaborate with Tech Data's selling Business Units to develop the right sales strategies and to assist in launch of products/services/programs/campaigns across EMEA. Other project orientated duties may be assigned as needed.

The team is also responsible to roll-out Cloud solutions and Services to all Tech Data entities in Europe (21 countries +). The team will collaborate with all of Tech Data's Business Unit leaders and their key partners, to develop the right strategies, and strive to deliver best in class systems with maximum impact and synergy across Europe.

Responsibilities
Act as a first point of escalation for your customer, ensuring their issues are prioritized appropriately and resolved without delay.
Monitor open cases and escalate to Support teams to ensure SLAs are met and exceeded.
Drive regular scheduled customer conference calls and meetings to ensure the continual flow of information with timely updates on all open issues and on-going projects
Ability to build credibility through action and responsiveness resulting in the perception that you are the customer‚Äôs go to champion within Tech Data.
Facilitate summary status reports; including monthly performance reviews and quarterly service reviews.
Deeply understand the customer‚Äôs business strategies, challenges and IT landscape. Possess the ability to deliver business value by aligning Tech Data solutions to address the customer‚Äôs short and long-term support needs
Coordinate internal resources, including technical and customer support, professional services and management to deliver towards account performance objectives and customers‚Äô expectations
Mapping of process flows across Operations teams, the collection, documentation and analysis of data, the identification of process gaps and support of process improvement initiatives to increase operational efficiencies
Document Operational ‚ÄúAs-is‚Äù processes and the desired ‚ÄúFuture State‚Äù processes. Deploy services and escalate issues as needed.
Review existing processes and provide advice in specialized subject areas, for example legal guidelines, internal compliance policies, services, technical support, or others as necessary.
Ensure appropriate training and self‚Äìactualization of skills for all staff for new processes or with outsourced parties.
Manage constant communication with countries and other stakeholders around processes.
Knowledge Skills and Experience

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Fluency in German(native) and English
Account management experience
Microsoft technical expertise with analytical problem management skills
Fundamental understanding of ITSM in large organizations
Comfortable interacting with all levels of management
Working knowledge of ITIL incident, problem and release management process and procedures
Ability to effectively work with tight schedules and fast paced environment to minimize problem impact on the customer
Solid understanding of ecommerce and Support Services market
Capable of working independently, and having responsibility as an individual (ownership)
Comfortable working in an international results driven project organisation.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
Project Experience of Software Licensing, Support, or Customer Service functions definite advantage.
Experience in managing distant or virtual teams in a service desk environment preferred.

Malmak Sun Power Energy Ltd is hiring a Business Analyst to join our project team. You will work alongside other business analysts and report directly to the project manager. Your main tasks will include performing detailed requirements analysis, documenting processes, and performing some user acceptance testing. To succeed in this role you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users.

Business Analyst Responsibilities
Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement,
and developing and implementing solutions.
Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies.
Staying up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize
systems.
Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.
Performing requirements analysis.
Documenting and communicating the results of your efforts.
Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and
management.
Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful
reports.
Working closely with clients, technicians, and managerial staff.
Providing leadership, training, coaching, and guidance to junior staff.
Allocating resources and maintaining cost efficiency.
Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements.
Performing user acceptance testing.
Managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance.
Updating, implementing and maintaining procedures.
Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements.
Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users.
Managing competing resources and priorities.
Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.
Business Analyst Requirements
A bachelor‚Äôs degree in business or related field or an MBA.
A minimum of 5 years experience in business analysis or a related field.
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable
solutions.
Advanced technical skills.
Excellent documentation skills.
Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations.
Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook.
A track record of following through on commitments.
Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.
Experience leading and developing top performing teams.
A history of leading and supporting successful projects.
Candidates Meeting The Above Requirements Should Apply To

The Steering Committee,
Malmak Sun Power Energy Limited,
02 Uganda Avenue,
Town Centre,
Kabwe, Zambia.

Job Title

Barcelona (flexible)

About The Company

IWG is the global operator of leading workspace providers. Our companies help more than 2.5 million people and their businesses to work more productively. We do so by providing a choice of professional, inspiring and collaborative workspaces, communities and services.

Digitalization and new technologies are transforming the world of work. People want the personal productivity benefits of living and working how and where they want. Businesses want the financial and strategic benefits. Our customers are start-ups, small and medium-sized enterprises, and large multinationals. With unique business goals, people and aspirations. They want workspaces and communities to match their needs. They want choice.

Through our companies we provide that choice, and serve the whole world of work: Regus, Spaces, No18, HQ and Signature. We create personal, financial and strategic value for businesses of every size. From some of the most exciting companies and well-known organizations on the planet, to individuals and the next generation of industry leaders. All of them harness the power of flexible working to increase their productivity, efficiency, agility and market proximity.

Join us at .

Maintains all documentation in our different documentation tools

Maintains deep system and business knowledge.

Extensive IT Experience
Specific Business Analyst training or certifications
Understanding of Software Development, System design, Digital, Web, Mobile, UX standards, solutioning and specification
Agile software development (how specifications are written using Agile)
Experience working with Executive and C-Level Mgt

Proven experience managing agile methodologies delivering business value IT Solutions
Ability to deliver results on time and to the very highest standards.
Ability to quickly gain the required business acumen and technical, behavioural and contextual elements of a project.
Running large and small-scale projects.
Key /technology understanding, how to manage Technology teams and discussion with SMEs in IT
Excellent English communication and executive level presentation skills

The APD CoE is recognized as a strategic partner within the organization, and within that, the Business Analyst supports Global and Regional applications (Non ERP) by assisting other Business Analysts with the resolution of system issues.

Key Responsibilities

Comprehend PPG‚Äôs Applications model and configuration Assists project teams with developing solutions to meet specific business requirements to improve business processes and participates in project life cycles from inception, development and testing, through implementation Develop and cultivate effective working relationships with both functional team members and IT personnel Resolve system incidents and issues, create and update documentation, and participate in or conduct workshops and training sessions for colleagues and Key users Act as application owner for some applications/platform and project manager (or Product Owner ‚Äì Agile) for all project related to these applications

We are currently recruiting for a Business Analyst to join our team based in Madrid, Spain. This is an excellent opportunity where you focus on providing the organisation with quality software development advice, analysis and project management. This will be achieved through the effective capture and translation of business requirements into technical design documentation and the coordination of the software development project lifecycle.
The key accountabilities of this role include:
Investigate, record, analyse and confirm system requirements and business processes.
Identify overlapping requirements/processes across the existing and upcoming software portfolio.
Make recommendations to the Product Owner for business processes requiring refinement.
Make recommendations to the Development Team Leader on the value, feasibility and impact of the system requirements.
Negotiate acceptance criteria.
Produce high quality and concise requirements and design documents which accurately reflect the business requirements and can be clearly understood by all members of the team.
Provide ad-hoc advice and clarification to software developers throughout the development of the solution.
Support developers by participating in Unit/Integration Testing.
Ensure products entering the User Acceptance Testing phase are built to specification and are of a high quality.
Coordinate the implementation of the solution with system owner(s), users and technical delivery teams.
Setup and maintain technical documentation.
Complete project completion documentation.
Manage a variety of tasks concurrently and show flexibility of work patterns in order to meet timeframes and delivery.
Person Specification:
Excellent analytical skills.
Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills.
Demonstrate patience, tolerance and understanding.
Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail.
Highly self-motivated and directed.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure.
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Education and Technical requirements:
College diploma or university degree in the field of business administration, finance, or information systems
Three to five years related work experience
Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development
Proficient in MS Excel (or similar) and collaboration tools such as Jira
Knowledgeable in the use of UML and Use Cases
In-depth understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle
Fluency in English is essential.
Knowledge of Gherkin is a plus.

Description

Data Analyst (German speaker)

Purpose of the position

We are looking for a Data Specialist with high level of German or native speaker to work applying a combination of technical, business thinking and analytical skills to strengthen the company's value proposition, both during pitches and in the development of strategies through analysis, learning and recommendations based on an excellent command of data.

Responsibilities
Use social and web analytics tools to conduct research and strategic processes.
Generate weekly and monthly content performance reports for our clients' platforms and collaborate in coaching sessions with the content and creative teams to optimise the platform in terms of content, messages, formats and duration, based on the insights and learning that emerge from the reports.
Provide and analyse information on data related to website traffic, bounce rates, funnel performance, conversion rates and any other website related activity.
Based on that information, make recommendations that will improve the overall performance of the site and its visibility in online searches.
Monitor and understand the behavior of users who visit the site.
Keep abreast of new trends and optimization strategies.
Provide clients with access to all such information, analysis and recommendations through
Monthly performance reports
Dashboards in data studio

Requirements

Tools

Google Suite, Google Analytics, Facebook Ads Manager, FB insights, YouTube Analytics, Brandwatch, SocialBakers, Data Studio, Klipfolio or any other Data Visualization

Competencies
Experience in digital data analysis and content.
Fluent or native German speaker.
High level of English (direct contact with international clients)
Experience in marketing agencies, advertising, digital.
Experience in digital research or market research.
Experience with data visualisation tools.
Experience collaborating in regional or global teams.
Strategic thinking and focus on results.
Communication and public presentation skills.
KPI'S
Proactivity and creativity within the assigned accounts and projects of the group.

Descripci√≥n:
Beam Suntory is Crafting the Spirits that Stir the World. Rooted in two centuries of family heritage, Beam Suntory has evolved into the world's third largest leading premium spirits company ... where each employee is treated like family and trusted with legacy. With our greatest assets - our premium spirits and our people - we're driving growth through impactful marketing, innovation and an entrepreneurial spirit. Beam Suntory is a place where you can come Unleash your Spirit by making an impact each and every day.

Revenue Strategy Senior Analyst

The following position is is open in Madrid, Spain.

What makes this a great opportunity?

This role provides the opportunity to understand the entire cycle of the Pricing Process. Starting from Pricing Strategy until the deployment of these strategies in the different markets.

This role will allow as well the development of interpersonal skills, as this role requires a high level of coordination with other functions.

Role Responsibilities

The role is pivotal to support the design and development of our International Revenue Strategies for existing brand qualities & New product development in alignment with the brand houses. A key component of the role is to interpret global into local guidelines and support the implementation in the different channels/markets. For Non-Brand House brands develop revenue strategies that support brand positioning to optimize value and maximize sustainable growth.

The Role Involves
Ensuring BSI global brand‚Äôs pricing strategy aligns with desired brand role, ambition, and positioning.
Developing insight and understanding the pricing action and strategy of competitors and how they impact Beam Suntory brands
Maximizing the perceived consumer value of different brand sizes within the same brand to optimize profitability
Understanding how the pricing actions of different brands/competitors interact with each other. Using elasticities to predict the impact of price changes to volume, Gross Profit, NSV, at distributor, retailer and consumer level (own, internal, cross elasticities)
Utilizing insights to communicate revenue strategies and tangible actions to support them
Supporting the region by working towards an annual harmonized pricing and margin plan, through
utilizing competitor shelf pricing insights and aligning implementation to the brand pricing guidelines. Developing as well a recommendation of price change by brand across the business.
This role will require strong cross functional capabilities, as it will act as a key link between International RGM, the Brand House strategy & finance teams

Qualifications & Experience
Minimum 8 years experience in financial roles experience in a FMCG environment. Previous RevMan/Pricing experience is beneficial.
Power point Presentation experience (including preparation and tailoring delivery to audience)
Proficiency with Windows and MS Office including advanced knowledge of Excel
Strong language skills fluent in written & spoken English
At Beam Suntory, people are our number one priority, and we believe our people grow together in diverse and inclusive environments where their unique insights, experiences and backgrounds are valued and respected. All recruitment and hiring decisions are based on an applicant‚Äôs skills and experience.

Company Description

At Netcentric, we come to work every day knowing we‚Äôre part of the solution to the most complex challenges brands have ever faced: digital transformation. Consumer expectation of brands is increasing in a world that is more connected and fast-paced.

Netcentric is a dynamic and innovative service provider with a unique culture. We empower our employees to use their creativity, looking beyond tools and technology to unlock the full potential of the Adobe Experience Cloud, so that we can deliver visionary digital marketing solutions for the world‚Äôs most recognized brands.

As part of the Cognizant Digital Business, we reap the benefits of combined expertise and access to multidisciplinary teams, forging ahead to become a leading customer experience player in Europe.

Our teams are based in some of the world‚Äôs most exciting cities - in Zurich, Munich, Berlin, Frankfurt, Dresden, Barcelona, Bucharest, London and Amsterdam. In all of our offices, you will find a culture that embraces over 48 different nationalities.

And oh, did we mention that we empower employees to make meaningful decisions at work through Holacracy?

Job Description

We are growing our Requirements Engineering / IT Business Analyst Team in Vigo and are looking for new colleagues who will bring their consultative and analytical experience spiced up by technical skills.

And by technical skills we mean that you have a solid experience working in web-development projects interpreting clients wishes into technical specifications for the Development team.

If it sounds like you, read on...

Your Tasks You will be the link between our customer and our development teams and translate business requests to technical requirements and into technical concepts. You will write business requirements, testing software, executing operational tasks and providing project management support while strengthening your technical acumen and business consulting skills. You will take responsibility for the conception and design of web-based solutions in the digital marketing domain, designing, testing and launching the technology that meets fully the business need. You will truly be a game changer for our clients. You will also be brainstorming with the client at the outset of a project, then acting as an assistant project manager as the project progresses. You will support the analysis and implementation of requirements along the entire software development cycle. You will document and present the solutions implemented with your team for internal and external stakeholders. Qualifications

What do we require? Strong verbal and written English skills (C1 and higher) First hands-on experience with web-based content management systems (CMS) Solid technical understanding of web development and web application integrations Able to translate business requirements to technical solutions Basic knowledge of HTML / CSS / JavaScript and / or web-relevant programming languages Experience in the creation of wireframes / mock-ups for IT applications Experience in the analysis of IT processes and the structured creation of requirements for IT systems Knowledge of software modelling methods (UML, flow charts, use cases...), methodologies and process models in software development Readiness to travel (up to 50% depending on project) Eligibility to work within the EU and/or Switzerland What makes us smile, when looking at your profile‚Ä¶ Experience with Adobe Experience Cloud (AEC) products, especially Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), Adobe Analytics (AA), or Adobe Campaign (AC) Knowledge in the area of Search Engine Optimization (SEO) Motivation to work in a distributed, international team Experience in using tools like JIRA / Confluence A proactive mind-set, ability to share your ideas and bring them to life Enthusiasm and an open mind which is looking for continuous improvement You are not afraid of giving and receiving feedback Additional Information

At Netcentric you get: Permanent contract 30 working days of vacation for all employees Flexible working hours, with respect to project needs Recognition bonus system Continuous training and coaching Free language classes to polish your English or help you with your Spanish Dynamic and international team Private health insurance Sponsored gym membership Tax-free benefits (ticket restaurant, kindergarden and transport) An office location in the bustling district 22@ Many off-site company events, including our annual company summit Apple work equipment Everyone has a voice, we are a Holacracy organization
