Job Description

Job Description
The Payroll Lead Analyst will lead the Payroll process and ensure Payroll data is obtained and provided to populate the activpayroll payroll build templates in readiness for the outsourcing of payroll delivery/calculations in the SDL countries of operation.
The Data Analyst will work with the activpayroll implementation team to ensure we meet the delivery deadlines for the outsourcing of payroll delivery/Calculations in accordance with the implementation schedule.
What will the role involve?
Identify the data required for each template and work closely with the existing data source to ensure the data is obtained according to the required timescales
Carry out validation and reconciliation on payroll data to ensure the data provided to activpayroll is accurate
Collate and prepare payroll data into the required format for completion of the relevant nominated templates
Troubleshoots payroll processing develops root cause analysis and works with the MDM workstream Lead/MDM manager
Analyse and document the reasons for variances (Tax/Social Security and other social deductions) and work with managers and Human Resources and line managers to resolve issues
Maintain GDPR compliance for all sensitive personal information shared between parties , such as payslips.n
Ensure data is handled within compliance and security guidelines, including deletion of data
What Skills And Experience Are Required
Previous experience in payroll transformation projects and/or system migrations in a mid size company with a Global/multi country footprint
Multi Country Payroll knowledge
Advanced Excel skills
Experience of working with large data sets
Ability to manage stakeholders at all levels and set clear expectations on deliverables and timescales
Strong communication skills, able to gather and interpret payroll data ensuring the result meets the business requirement
Analytical skills
Understanding of payroll data and legislation is advantageous

Who We Are

Vistaprint‚Äôs CFO Organization empowers teams to focus on their domain and serve customers. Clear guardrails pave the way for strong engagement and efficiency in our lines of business, regional operations and central functions. Team members work cross-functionally, impacting every area of the company ‚Äì from human resources, communications and real estate to finance, controllership and legal services. The CFO team makes critical capabilities accessible, delivering services and information that every employee needs to succeed in their role.

Positioning ourselves centrally and globally, we offer opportunities to scale processes and ideas, facilitate feedback loops across Vistaprint‚Äôs organizations and build a team of world-class talent, with specialized skill sets.

We are growing our team in Barcelona, Spain. We are seeking a highly motivated and driven Senior Data Analyst. This newly crafted position, working with the Global Finance Data Lead, will be assisting and supporting the Finance team with coordination of the strategic business planning process, reporting, consolidation in business performance and analytics globally. This is a key role within Vistaprint that will help craft the future of the business and the overall finance organization.

As a Senior DA, you will be focused on enabling data driven decision making through the development of analytical tools and conducting ad-hoc analysis to formulate hypotheses and recommendations. You will work within the Global Finance Data team, but also specifically as part of the Finance organization. This structure offers the support and access to the analytical resources, tools and techniques that both Finance and Analytics provide.

What You Will Do
Drive the budget, forecast, and financial reporting for Vistaprint Business Lines.
Collaborate in a fast paced, agile environment that focuses on delivering value to our customers early and often
Immersed within the Finance data you will turn business questions into functional analysis and lead exploratory analyses to uncover insights and find opportunities to improve key metrics and optimize revenue and profit
Design, execute, analyze and report out on sophisticated analytics models as well as partner with other analytics leads to advise the development, maintenance, and improvement of tools for analyzing and executing tests
Build and maintain standardized reports and dashboards across multiple platforms and data sets to provide accurate data and insight for teams on an ongoing basis
Build and package management reports; analyzing and interpreting data and historical trends. Reporting on and delving into findings as needed
Your Qualifications:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or related field, along with shown experience and skills in data analytics using SQL in a multi-channel e-commerce environment
A passion and strong orientation for data and technology. You are comfortable with exploratory analysis, statistical techniques, with curiosity and adaptability complemented by a results-oriented personality to drive insights
Experience in data analysis (Cohort Analysis, Recency, Frequency, Price Volume Mix), and with the following tools: Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Web Analytic tools (i.e., Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Adobe Site Catalyst or Core-Metrics) desired
Proficient in SQL (Python and/or R is a plus), and in data visualization in Tableau or Looker is also a plus
Proven experience translating business objectives into quantitative insights and implementing tracking into scalable reporting.
Strong communication to enable delivery of technical concepts to non-technical business partners, and collaboration skills, giving and receiving feedback, ability to work in cross functional teams, shared ownership of projects.
Excellent organizational skills, good attention to detail, and the ability to effectively run and prioritize multiple concurrent tasks and initiatives
Ability to think outside the box, think creatively about approaching analytical questions
Why You‚Äôll Love Working Here:
At Vistaprint, we put excellent importance into the wellbeing of our employees, which is why we offer perks that ensure an extraordinary work/life balance. Perks include work from home capabilities and very flexible time-off opportunities.

About Us

As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vistaprint is a dynamic organization that maintains an exciting, results-oriented culture. Empowering and helping small businesses is our core focus, with an emphasis on crafting customer value (and delight) through accessible, ground breaking technology. We grow with providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation and growth ‚Äì for both our customers and our team.

We are looking for some of the finest experts to optimize the effectiveness of a leading company, through an extremely challenging IT Transformation project. We are looking for a QA Testing Automation Engineer in Madrid, to identify opportunities for automation within software processes (delivering automated solutions), working closely with other teams to help discover and eliminate problems by gathering requirements and implementing testing process automation and frameworks.

Tasks & Responsibilities
Design and execute QA automated tests to validate applications by creating scripts that automatically run testing functions / test functionality. This includes determining priority for test scenarios and creating execution plans to implement these scenarios.
Identify and analyze bugs, highlighting problems to identify solutions, and regularly deliver reports (to other members of the Engineering Team, collaborating with them and other business units to find the best methods for solving problems in apps and systems, as well as to understand how automation can improve workflow).
Install and set up Databases and backup applications (relevant to automation) to prevent errors and to protect against data loss.
Identify potential quality issues (that may affect apps, in development, service or business processes) and run tests by analyzing databases, systems, networks, applications, hardware and software.
Gather requirements from clients, customers, or end-users to develop the best automation solutions.
Requirements
Experience : 3 to 5 years of experience in applications development and testing (as Analyst / Technical Lead), having demonstrated proficiency in working with global and local highly-qualified development teams, in a collaborative environment, organized in Scrum (Solid knowledge of Scrum / Agile methodology is desirable, as well as a DevOps-oriented & Cloud mindset).
Technical Skills & Knowledge : Experience with Selenium framework (and mobile app testing).
Valuable experience : Experience using SonarQube. Experience within the Banking ‚Äì Financial Services industries.
Additional Details: We are looking for a professional with solid technical knowledge (of software engineering, design patterns and software architecture, programming, and coding experience, ideally with AI, ML, Automation, Robotics knowledge‚Ä¶) and able to understand complex business processes and workflows. Experience with technical documentation, architectural diagram, components, flows and use cases, as well as in analysis of existing systems from high level architecture to application code review.
Languages : Fluent level of English and Spanish.
Personal & Soft Skills : Team-player able to work under-pressure, meeting deadlines with multidisciplinary teams. Leadership, analytical, project management and communication skills. Ability to identify risks, resolve conflicts and plan tasks.
Education : Degree in Engineering, Telecommunications, IT or similar.
WHAT DO WE OFFER?

Working in collaboration with international teams, the project will be focus on improving efficiency by developing and implementing in-house some of the strategic business processes of the company from a defined roadmap. Company Description

At Netcentric, we come to work every day knowing we‚Äôre part of the solution to the most complex challenges brands have ever faced: digital transformation. Consumer expectation of brands is increasing in a world that is more connected and fast-paced.

Netcentric is a dynamic and innovative service provider with a unique culture. We empower our employees to use their creativity, looking beyond tools and technology to unlock the full potential of the Adobe Experience Cloud, so that we can deliver visionary digital marketing solutions for the world‚Äôs most recognized brands.

As part of the Cognizant Digital Business, we reap the benefits of combined expertise and access to multidisciplinary teams, forging ahead to become a leading customer experience player in Europe.

Our teams are based in some of the world‚Äôs most exciting cities - in Zurich, Munich, Berlin, Frankfurt, Dresden, Barcelona, Bucharest, London and Amsterdam. In all of our offices, you will find a culture that embraces over 48 different nationalities.

And oh, did we mention that we empower employees to make meaningful decisions at work through Holacracy?

Job Description

We are growing our Requirements Engineering / IT Business Analyst Team in Vigo and are looking for new colleagues who will bring their consultative and analytical experience spiced up by technical skills.

And by technical skills we mean that you have a solid experience working in web-development projects interpreting clients wishes into technical specifications for the Development team.

If it sounds like you, read on...

Your Tasks
You will be the link between our customer and our development teams and translate business requests to technical requirements and into technical concepts.
You will write business requirements, testing software, executing operational tasks and providing project management support while strengthening your technical acumen and business consulting skills.
You will take responsibility for the conception and design of web-based solutions in the digital marketing domain, designing, testing and launching the technology that meets fully the business need. You will truly be a game changer for our clients.
You will also be brainstorming with the client at the outset of a project, then acting as an assistant project manager as the project progresses.
You will support the analysis and implementation of requirements along the entire software development cycle.
You will document and present the solutions implemented with your team for internal and external stakeholders.
Qualifications

What do we require?
Strong verbal and written English skills (C1 and higher)
First hands-on experience with web-based content management systems (CMS)
Solid technical understanding of web development and web application integrations
Able to translate business requirements to technical solutions
Basic knowledge of HTML / CSS / JavaScript and / or web-relevant programming languages
Experience in the creation of wireframes / mock-ups for IT applications
Experience in the analysis of IT processes and the structured creation of requirements for IT systems
Knowledge of software modelling methods (UML, flow charts, use cases...), methodologies and process models in software development
Readiness to travel (up to 50% depending on project)
Eligibility to work within the EU and/or Switzerland

What Makes Us Smile, When Looking At Your Profile‚Ä¶
Experience with Adobe Experience Cloud (AEC) products, especially Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), Adobe Analytics (AA), or Adobe Campaign (AC)
Knowledge in the area of Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
Motivation to work in a distributed, international team
Experience in using tools like JIRA / Confluence
A proactive mind-set, ability to share your ideas and bring them to life
Enthusiasm and an open mind which is looking for continuous improvement
You are not afraid of giving and receiving feedback

Additional Information

At Netcentric You Get
Permanent contract
30 working days of vacation for all employees
Flexible working hours, with respect to project needs
Recognition bonus system
Continuous training and coaching
Free language classes to polish your English or help you with your Spanish
Dynamic and international team
Private health insurance
Sponsored gym membership
Tax-free benefits (ticket restaurant, kindergarden and transport)
An office location in the bustling district 22@
Many off-site company events, including our annual company summit
Apple work equipment
Everyone has a voice, we are a Holacracy organization

Want to be a part of our team?
The Compliance and Data Protection Analyst is responsible for the assisting in the assessment of the company‚Äôs compliance and risk posture as they relate to its information assets. The purpose of this position is to execute the planned activities of the information security and service risk management program, report on their outcome and resolve deviations from the defined thresholds. Responsibilities require project management experience to ensure effectiveness system-wide analysis; controls testing and improvement; risk assessment; maintain related awareness and education; and improvement of policies, standards and guidelines.

Working at NTT

Key Responsibilities
Ensure that the IMS (ISO 27001, ISO 20000-1and GDPR) is maintained in the organization.
Responsible for the company policies to be updated and aligned to group and business needs.
Generating monitoring reports related to IMS performance and effectiveness.
Monitor their achievement of the define the objectives of the Integrated Management System.
Ensure that non-conformities and corrective actions are managed.
Monitor and maintain ISO support processes.
Monitor and report the continuous improvement of the IMS.
Coordinating audits of existing CMS compliance standards related to Information Security and Services.
Improve risk management framework and supervise compliance with Risk Management policy.
Maintenance of the company risk register, follow-up of risk treatment plans and report risk to relevant stakeholders.
Ensure and monitor activities and process related to GDPR (records of processing activities, third parties contracts review, vendor risk assessment, etc).
Coordinate activities related to PCI DSS (Audit plan, coordinate PCI vendor propose, etc).
Establish, implement and test a Business Continuity Plan.
Provide Integrated Management System awareness training to organization personnel

What will make you a good fit for the role?

Proven Experience Of
Knowledge of information security, service management and risk management frameworks and compliance practices such as ISO/IEC 20000-1, ISO/IEC 27001, PCI-DSS, GDPR, SOC2.
Understanding of relevant business operations, policies and strategy, and the ability to deliver risk mitigation at the speed of a dynamic technology company.
Excellent logical and structured ability to effectively understand and decompose business needs, goals, and objectives into tangible requirements, solutions, and alternatives.
Demonstrated ability to work within a global team and effectively manage onshore and offshore personnel and vendors.
Ability to think critically through complex situations, with a knack for persuasion and consultation.
Demonstrated knowledge of developing compliance reports, and IT policies, procedures, and practices.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills, including formal report writing experience targeted to technical, business, and executive audiences in verbal and written formats.

Preferred Experience
Between 1 and 3 years of experience in an IT Audit, Governance, Risk or Compliance role performing information security audits or risk assessments.
Project Management skills.

Experience working with cross functional teams.
Broad base of technical skills.

Description

Are you passionate about data analysis and marketing in business? Would you like to work in the digital side of a leading agricultural company? If both answers are positive, Corteva Agriscience is looking for a Digital Marketing Analyst .

Your main mission will be to lead the value creation from data and business analytics, developing and implementing digital transformation projects for the company with a strong focus on the agricultural market. You will be responsible for the data strategy, digital tools and social metrics, working on the implementation of the digital culture within the company and the commercial network. From our headquarters in Seville, you will be part of a growing team in charge of the implementation of a new CRM to support the sales structure, with special attention to customer insights and interactions. This position is designed for a proactive person, with a strong commercial and digital background, looking for an attractive challenge in a leading global company in the agricultural sector.

Your responsibilities will include (but not limited to) the following:
Be part of the company's data strategy, implementing data analytics and data structure processes on existing and future databases.
Carry out analytics to assess the end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels, identify trends and evaluate customer touch points.
Manage the change to new internal CRM and ERP systems.
Manage and oversee the organization‚Äôs business efforts by growing revenue from core and digital products and services.
Measure and report performance of digital marketing campaigns and assess against goals (ROI and KPIs).
Collaborate in the company's digital transformation projects, with a special focus on data and analytics-oriented workflows.
Run and distribute digital marketing analytics reports, including website traffic and behavior, apps, digital advertising, digital product launches and social networks.
Advocate of digital transformation in agriculture.
Other Responsibilities
Evaluate emerging technologies, providing thought leadership and perspective for adoption where appropriate.
Brainstorm new and creative growth strategies in digital domain
Interact with the marketing teams on the design and implementation of digital marketing plans and communications

Job Description

We are growing our Requirements Engineering / IT Business Analyst Team in Vigo and are looking for new colleagues who will bring their consultative and analytical experience spiced up by technical skills.

And by technical skills we mean that you have a solid experience working in web-development projects interpreting clients wishes into technical specifications for the Development team.

If it sounds like you, read on...

Your Tasks
You will be the link between our customer and our development teams and translate business requests to technical requirements and into technical concepts.
You will write business requirements, testing software, executing operational tasks and providing project management support while strengthening your technical acumen and business consulting skills.
You will take responsibility for the conception and design of web-based solutions in the digital marketing domain, designing, testing and launching the technology that meets fully the business need. You will truly be a game changer for our clients.
You will also be brainstorming with the client at the outset of a project, then acting as an assistant project manager as the project progresses.
You will support the analysis and implementation of requirements along the entire software development cycle.
You will document and present the solutions implemented with your team for internal and external stakeholders.
Qualifications

What do we require?
Strong verbal and written English skills (C1 and higher)
First hands-on experience with web-based content management systems (CMS)
Solid technical understanding of web development and web application integrations
Able to translate business requirements to technical solutions
Basic knowledge of HTML / CSS / JavaScript and / or web-relevant programming languages
Experience in the creation of wireframes / mock-ups for IT applications
Experience in the analysis of IT processes and the structured creation of requirements for IT systems
Knowledge of software modelling methods (UML, flow charts, use cases...), methodologies and process models in software development
Readiness to travel (up to 50% depending on project)
Eligibility to work within the EU and/or Switzerland

Motivation to work in a distributed, international team
Experience in using tools like JIRA / Confluence
A proactive mind-set, ability to share your ideas and bring them to life
Enthusiasm and an open mind which is looking for continuous improvement
You are not afraid of giving and receiving feedback

APPLICATIONS ARE INVITED FOR THE POSITION OF SENIOR DATABASE ANALYST DATA CENTRE AND COMPUTING SYSTEM INFRASTRUCTURE & SERVICES IT INFRASTRUCTURE & OPERATIONS ICT SERVICES DIVISION

Non-Union Level 8 - $80,439 - $96,526

The Toronto Catholic District School Board (TCDSB) is currently hiring for a Senior Database Analyst. This position is part of the IT Infrastructure and Operations Department. The Senior Database Analyst will work closely with the application development teams and various leaders to understand database and data management requirements.

Criteria For An Interview

ÔÇ∑ University degree in Information Technology, i.e., Computer Science, Computer Engineering or an equivalent combination of education and experience
ÔÇ∑ Minimum of two (2) years experience managing Database Systems architecture, design, data
modeling, development and implementations in an enterprise environment
ÔÇ∑ Professional certification as Microsoft Certified System Administrator (MCSA), Microsoft Certified Solution Expert is an asset
ÔÇ∑ Expert knowledge of most recent version of SQL Server, SQL Server Integration Services, SQL Server Reporting Services, Active Directory, Windows Server 2016/2019, PowerShell and scripting
ÔÇ∑ Strong skills with high availability, business continuity and disaster recovery including Always On Availability Groups, mirroring, clustering and log shipping
ÔÇ∑ Excellent knowledge and experience with data analytics tools, data integration services, cloud systems, IT methodologies, data management best practices and IT security concepts
ÔÇ∑ Knowledge and experience with System Center 2016 (SQL Management Pack), VMware and
Dell EMC Networker SQL Backup an asset
ÔÇ∑ Excellent analytical, critical thinking, decision making, problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
ÔÇ∑ Demonstrated leadership ability in researching, planning, designing, implementing, administrating and supporting enterprise applications
ÔÇ∑ Self-motivated with excellent interpersonal and relationship building skills
ÔÇ∑ Well-developed ability to manage staff and assign projects and tasks
ÔÇ∑ Excellent verbal and written communication skills with strong attention to detail
ÔÇ∑ Availability to work outside core office hours, as required

Major Duties And Responsibilities

Reporting to the Senior Manager ‚Äì Data Centre/ Computing System Infrastructure and Services, the primary function of this position is responsibility for the effective planning, managing, building, maintaining, monitoring and troubleshooting the database infrastructure. Major duties and responsibilities will include but not limited to the following:

ÔÇ∑ Manage, maintain and provide operational support of the existing database infrastructure to ensure scalability, reliability, security and operational efficiency
ÔÇ∑ Perform capacity planning, performance tuning, monitoring, database optimization, change control management, backup and recovery, disaster recovery planning and manage security access control
ÔÇ∑ Carry out installation, configuration, deployment and upgrade of MS SQL Server based on internal and industry best practices.
ÔÇ∑ Perform as Technical Lead to take ownership of database projects involving multiple technologies and collaborate with various business units
ÔÇ∑ Provide Tier 3 technical support, troubleshooting, problem analysis and resolution and escalation to third party as required
ÔÇ∑ Assist the application systems and development teams with designing, data modeling, developing entity relationship diagrams and optimizing database queries.
ÔÇ∑ Develop and maintain documentation on systems management and operational policies, processes and procedures; follow operational policies and processes that are compliant with ITIL standards and change control best practices, and automate database processes
ÔÇ∑ Proactively analyze existing database infrastructure and data management processes to identify where integrity, performance, reliability and availability can be improved
ÔÇ∑ Provide technical level analysis and review of new information technology projects to determine if project deliverables are meeting strategic objectives of the business
ÔÇ∑ Provide technical inputs including and recommendations for business cases, reports and RFPs/RFQs
ÔÇ∑ Prepare and update infrastructure design documents, technical end-user documentation, system technical and functional specifications, standards; provide in-services, conduct presentations, develop project plans and schedules for project implementation
ÔÇ∑ Oversee and supervise the work duties of assigned staff
ÔÇ∑ Collaborate with technology peers, application developers, technical mentoring, share technical knowledge and guidance with other staff and manage work performed

Please Note

ÔÇ∑ Perform other duties as assigned or required

This position will require the incumbent to be available for ‚Äúon call‚Äù work and must be flexible to work after hours including evenings and weekends. A valid Ontario driver‚Äôs license and access to a vehicle is required for travel to Board and non-Board sites (eligibility for mileage reimbursement).

Diversity And Inclusion

Consistent with the TCDSB‚Äôs Employment Equity policy, the TCDSB is strongly committed to fostering and creating a diverse and inclusive leadership team as well as a diverse and inclusive organization. As such, we especially welcome applications from individuals who would contribute to the further diversification of our staff, including but not limited to those who self-identify as visible minorities, persons with disabilities, aboriginal peoples and women. You are invited to voluntarily indicate if you identify as one or more of the aforementioned communities. This information will be kept confidential.

Barrier-Free Recruitment and Selection
Consistent with the principles of the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), the TCDSB is committed to creating an inclusive, barrier free recruitment and selection process. Please inform the Human Resources department at the time of your application of any requirement for an accommodation. The need for documentation to support the accommodation request will be requested as required prior to the implementation of any accommodation measures.

A IT Business Analyst/Service Manager drives business opportunities enabled by information and technology. He should be the strategic interface between Business needs and technology and development, risk management and relationship management.

Detailed activities: What you'll be working on
Identifying customer needs and overseeing service delivery within the business context, always maintaining a positive relationship with the customers. Supporting and coordinating projects and changes together with Business Process Owners, SME‚Äôs and development teams (external or internal), as well as supporting test activities. Coordinate and control the different service delivery teams, managing conflict, and ensuring the processes and tasks are carried out efficiently. Determining ways to reduce costs without negative impact in customer satisfaction. Assessing customer feedback and using creativity to establish, improve, and refine services. Building partnerships and liaising with Business team leaders and Key Users Community to determine the company's services, delivery criteria, and solutions for issues that may arise. Initiate and analyse changes on current service specifications. Performing technical tasks aimed at the control of service operations and the system interfaces.
Solution scope and requirements
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science or equivalent, with relevant work experience. Strong leadership and teamworking skills. Manage, escalate and support the daily services delivery between Business Process Owners/SME‚Äôs and external maintenance providers. Monitor service performance, deal with escalations, and ensure delivery of contracted deliverables. Exhibits an Agile mindset in the approach to work, i.e.: Enables a diverse group of partners to speak with a single voice Good enough instead of perfection Focus on ‚ÄúReuse before Buy before Make‚Äù Broad IT technology skills, especially Google, SQL, .net, IIS, etc. and Collaborative tools. Hands on experience in ITSM tools, preferable Service Now. Preferred with experience supporting ERP (SAP) and/or CRM (Salesforce) implementations and tests activities. Strong customer service, project management, and quality control skills. Communicate effectively in english, spanish and valued knowledge also in french.

About AirDNA

As the world's leading provider of short-term rental data and analytics, AirDNA tracks the daily performance of over 12 million properties on Airbnb and Vrbo in 120,000 global markets. Through a combination of machine learning algorithms and source data on over 750,000 listings, AirDNA has revolutionized pricing, benchmarking, and investing in alternative accommodations.

Our customer roster includes a who‚Äôs who of investment banks, hotels, hedge funds, real estate investors, and vacation rental pros. We are bootstrapped, profitable, and looking to take the world by storm in 2021 and beyond.

Your Role

We are looking for an experienced FP&A analyst to establish and improve budgeting, monitoring, and forecasting processes. You will own the financial models to forecast all aspects of the company. This role will work with departments across the company to identify key drivers, relationships, and KPIs that effectively describe our operations and build frameworks and models to forecast them.

Here‚Äôs What You‚Äôll Get To Do
Lead and drive Financial Planning and Analysis for a SaaS business; including forecasting, budgeting, and strategic financial modeling
Prepare detailed financial modeling and reporting that assists leadership in understanding the forces that will impact key operational, financial, and strategic decisions
Own monthly processes to monitor progress against goals and evaluate budget variances to ensure a clear understanding of factors influencing our financial position and key metrics
Develop robust revenue forecasting methodology using inputs from Product, Sales, Marketing
Perform quantitative analysis of operational and financial data to support all areas of the company
Provide analysis to support mergers and acquisitions
Utilize demonstrated process improvement mindset to assist the Finance department in moving from manual processes to streamlined automated processes through the evaluation and implementation of new financial reporting and analysis tools
Perform ad hoc analysis for executives as required
Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll need to be successful:
3+ years of finance experience (such as analyst, controller, FP&A manager)
Modeling skills for SaaS P&L, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow
Expert proficiency in financial modeling and analyzing complex data sets
Outstanding presentation and strong communication and analytical skills
An exceptional eye for detail and comfort managing large amounts of data
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, remaining agile through change
Excellent communication skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment
Bonus points for experience in a SaaS business
The AirDNA Team

We're a tight-knit group who care about empowering the next generation of shared economy entrepreneurs. We like to work hard. We believe in work/life balance because we make work a fun environment you‚Äôll want to be a part of. We all wear multiple hats and are working on at least 5 projects at a time. Life is never boring here. We're risk takers. We care about each other and lend helping hands all day, every day.

Company DescriptionAt Netcentric, we come to work every day knowing we‚Äôre part of the solution to the most complex challenges brands have ever faced: digital transformation. Consumer expectation of brands is increasing in a world that is more connected and fast-paced.
Netcentric is a dynamic and innovative service provider with a unique culture. We empower our employees to use their creativity, looking beyond tools and technology to unlock the full potential of the Adobe Experience Cloud, so that we can deliver visionary digital marketing solutions for the world‚Äôs most recognized brands.
As part of the Cognizant Digital Business, we reap the benefits of combined expertise and access to multidisciplinary teams, forging ahead to become a leading customer experience player in Europe.
Our teams are based in some of the world‚Äôs most exciting cities - in Zurich, Munich, Berlin, Frankfurt, Dresden, Barcelona, Bucharest, London and Amsterdam. In all of our offices, you will find a culture that embraces over 48 different nationalities.
And oh, did we mention that we empower employees to make meaningful decisions at work through Holacracy?
Job DescriptionWe are growing our Requirements Engineering / IT Business Analyst Team in Barcelona and Vigo and are looking for new colleagues who will bring their consultative and analytical experience spiced up by technical skills.
And by technical skills we mean that you have a solid experience working in web-development projects interpreting clients wishes into technical specifications for the Development team.
If it sounds like you, read on...
Your Tasks
You will be the link between our customer and our development teams and translate business requests to technical requirements and into technical concepts.
You will write business requirements, testing software, executing operational tasks and providing project management support while strengthening your technical acumen and business consulting skills.
You will take responsibility for the conception and design of web-based solutions in the digital marketing domain, designing, testing and launching the technology that meets fully the business need. You will truly be a game changer for our clients.
You will also be brainstorming with the client at the outset of a project, then acting as an assistant project manager as the project progresses.
You will support the analysis and implementation of requirements along the entire software development cycle.
You will document and present the solutions implemented with your team for internal and external stakeholders.
QualificationsWhat do we require?
Strong verbal and written English skills (C1 and higher)
First hands-on experience with web-based content management systems (CMS)
Solid technical understanding of web development and web application integrations
Able to translate business requirements to technical solutions
Basic knowledge of HTML / CSS / JavaScript and / or web-relevant programming languages
Experience in the creation of wireframes / mock-ups for IT applications
Experience in the analysis of IT processes and the structured creation of requirements for IT systems
Knowledge of software modelling methods (UML, flow charts, use cases...), methodologies and process models in software development
Readiness to travel (up to 50% depending on project)
Eligibility to work within the EU and/or Switzerland
What makes us smile, when looking at your profile‚Ä¶
Experience with Adobe Experience Cloud (AEC) products, especially Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), Adobe Analytics (AA), or Adobe Campaign (AC)
Knowledge in the area of Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
Motivation to work in a distributed, international team
Experience in using tools like JIRA / Confluence
A proactive mind-set, ability to share your ideas and bring them to life
Enthusiasm and an open mind which is looking for continuous improvement
You are not afraid of giving and receiving feedbackAdditional InformationAt Netcentric you get:
Permanent contract
30 working days of vacation for all employees
Flexible working hours, with respect to project needs
Recognition bonus system
Continuous training and coaching
Free language classes to polish your English or help you with your Spanish
Dynamic and international team
Private health insurance
Sponsored gym membership
Tax-free benefits (ticket restaurant, kindergarden and transport)
An office location in the bustling district 22@
Many off-site company events, including our annual company summit
Apple work equipment
Everyone has a voice, we are a Holacracy organization

Non-Union Level 8 - $80,439 - $96,526

The Toronto Catholic District School Board (TCDSB) is currently hiring for a Senior Database Analyst. This position is part of the IT Infrastructure and Operations Department. The Senior Database Analyst will work closely with the application development teams and various leaders to understand database and data management requirements.

Criteria For An Interview

ÔÇ∑ University degree in Information Technology, i.e., Computer Science, Computer Engineering or an equivalent combination of education and experience
ÔÇ∑ Minimum of two (2) years experience managing Database Systems architecture, design, data
modeling, development and implementations in an enterprise environment
ÔÇ∑ Professional certification as Microsoft Certified System Administrator (MCSA), Microsoft Certified Solution Expert is an asset
ÔÇ∑ Expert knowledge of most recent version of SQL Server, SQL Server Integration Services, SQL Server Reporting Services, Active Directory, Windows Server 2016/2019, PowerShell and scripting
ÔÇ∑ Strong skills with high availability, business continuity and disaster recovery including Always On Availability Groups, mirroring, clustering and log shipping
ÔÇ∑ Excellent knowledge and experience with data analytics tools, data integration services, cloud systems, IT methodologies, data management best practices and IT security concepts
ÔÇ∑ Knowledge and experience with System Center 2016 (SQL Management Pack), VMware and
Dell EMC Networker SQL Backup an asset
ÔÇ∑ Excellent analytical, critical thinking, decision making, problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
ÔÇ∑ Demonstrated leadership ability in researching, planning, designing, implementing, administrating and supporting enterprise applications
ÔÇ∑ Self-motivated with excellent interpersonal and relationship building skills
ÔÇ∑ Well-developed ability to manage staff and assign projects and tasks
ÔÇ∑ Excellent verbal and written communication skills with strong attention to detail
ÔÇ∑ Availability to work outside core office hours, as required

Major Duties And Responsibilities

Reporting to the Senior Manager ‚Äì Data Centre/ Computing System Infrastructure and Services, the primary function of this position is responsibility for the effective planning, managing, building, maintaining, monitoring and troubleshooting the database infrastructure. Major duties and responsibilities will include but not limited to the following:

ÔÇ∑ Manage, maintain and provide operational support of the existing database infrastructure to ensure scalability, reliability, security and operational efficiency
ÔÇ∑ Perform capacity planning, performance tuning, monitoring, database optimization, change control management, backup and recovery, disaster recovery planning and manage security access control
ÔÇ∑ Carry out installation, configuration, deployment and upgrade of MS SQL Server based on internal and industry best practices.
ÔÇ∑ Perform as Technical Lead to take ownership of database projects involving multiple technologies and collaborate with various business units
ÔÇ∑ Provide Tier 3 technical support, troubleshooting, problem analysis and resolution and escalation to third party as required
ÔÇ∑ Assist the application systems and development teams with designing, data modeling, developing entity relationship diagrams and optimizing database queries.
ÔÇ∑ Develop and maintain documentation on systems management and operational policies, processes and procedures; follow operational policies and processes that are compliant with ITIL standards and change control best practices, and automate database processes
ÔÇ∑ Proactively analyze existing database infrastructure and data management processes to identify where integrity, performance, reliability and availability can be improved
ÔÇ∑ Provide technical level analysis and review of new information technology projects to determine if project deliverables are meeting strategic objectives of the business
ÔÇ∑ Provide technical inputs including and recommendations for business cases, reports and RFPs/RFQs
ÔÇ∑ Prepare and update infrastructure design documents, technical end-user documentation, system technical and functional specifications, standards; provide in-services, conduct presentations, develop project plans and schedules for project implementation
ÔÇ∑ Oversee and supervise the work duties of assigned staff
ÔÇ∑ Collaborate with technology peers, application developers, technical mentoring, share technical knowledge and guidance with other staff and manage work performed

Please Note

ÔÇ∑ Perform other duties as assigned or required

This position will require the incumbent to be available for ‚Äúon call‚Äù work and must be flexible to work after hours including evenings and weekends. A valid Ontario driver‚Äôs license and access to a vehicle is required for travel to Board and non-Board sites (eligibility for mileage reimbursement).

Diversity And Inclusion

Consistent with the TCDSB‚Äôs Employment Equity policy, the TCDSB is strongly committed to fostering and creating a diverse and inclusive leadership team as well as a diverse and inclusive organization. As such, we especially welcome applications from individuals who would contribute to the further diversification of our staff, including but not limited to those who self-identify as visible minorities, persons with disabilities, aboriginal peoples and women. Solera is a global leader in data and software services that strives to transform every touchpoint of the vehicle lifecycle into a connected digital experience. Degree in Finance / Business Administration/Engineering
3-5 years of experience as a Senior Financial Analyst or similar role within a high demanding multinational company, Big 4 or Consulting.

Excellent analytical skills with experience in project controlling.

Experience with BI processes and tools

Description

We are glad to invite you to join one of the leading entertainment brands. We are currently looking for a Quality Analyst with native level of German, eager to develop his/her career with the worldwide leader in outsourced omnichannel customer experience management.

This role requires a professional with a keen eye for details who can work resourcefully and efficiently to assure quality of programs, software and systems.

Your Main Responsibilities Will Be
Performs call, secure email and chat reviews using established quality monitoring forms.
Reviews for compliance with policies and procedures, ensures staff are providing accurate information.
Reviews After Call Surveys.
Prepares quality reports and performance trends.
Provides management with daily and month end call management and department performance reports.
Works on a variety of assigned special projects.
Requirements

What will you bring?
Native level of German and fluent in English
Professional verbal and written communication skills
Ability to use procedures to make decisions and logic to identify needed exceptions
Ability to handle multiple tasks at a time and meet deadlines
Technical expertise with spreadsheet and word processing software
Proficient PC skills
Must be self-motivated, detail oriented, have the ability to accurately gather and document statistics
Must be effective and efficient working in a team environment
Excellent typing skills
Benefits

Full-time contract, 39 hours/week, from Monday to Friday.
A permanent presence of coaches who will facilitate your personal and professional development
Established career path to grow within the project
Bi-weekly, monthly or quarterly contests
Employment with the world's largest provider of contact center services
Excellent work environment, great colleagues, social arrangements and personal development
Dynamic business casual environment with colleagues of all ages gathered in a highly-motivated team
